neighborhood_overview: East Village/ Alphabet City has tons of cafes and bars and is a great place to explore the rest of the city from.
notes: Please note this room shares a bathroom with the other guest room. Also note that the terrace is upstairs outside the hosts bedroom, please be aware of noise and privacy. Thanks!
transit: The L train is about a 10+ min walk, but please ask us for the quickest route! You can also hop on the bus right at the end of the street to take you straight to the station, which takes under 10 min (+ you get a free transfer with your metro card). And if you're feeling adventurous you can rent a citi bike on the block. Thanks for taking a look!
interaction: Unless traveling for work, we'll usually meet at least when you arrive. But I'm always available to give recommendations and help out any way I can.
house_rules: No smoking inside the apartment, but you're welcome to smoke outside on the terrace. Also, please be respectful when you use the terrace, as it is outside of the hosts bedroom.

neighborhood_overview: After walking all day downtown in the crowded streets, when I get out at my subway stop uptown I feel happy to be in my neighborhood, calmer, more friendly, lively and spacious. I walk home and I finally relax, I feel I am in the City, 20 minutes away from Colombus Circle…. but yet in my lovely quiet home. The neighborhood has become gentrified, there are now lots of new lovely restaurants and coffee shops. Some Art Galleries and new stores. My Gym is at 158th street, a great and inexpensive giant club. The supermarket is across Broadway, two blocks away. Fairways is at 134th street and for major food shopping is the best! On 145th there is my Bikrham Yoga club, the farmacy, the hardware sore, a library…. I find everything I need close by.
notes: New double plate induction hotplate and a big multi function microwave.  Cable Tv has been istalled.
transit: Train N. 1 at 3 blocks distance, 3 minutes walk. It connects to the express train N. 2 or 3 on 96th street. Train A/B/C/D: at W 145th St (at St. Nicholas Ave, 10/15 minutes walk) Bus: M4 and M5
interaction: I will always be available on phone or email in order to help if necessary.
house_rules: 1) Check in between 12 and 7pm. 2) Check out between 8:30am and 12:30pm 3) The door of the apartment has to be closed with both locks each time you go out. Be careful not to go out without the keys because the door locks itself and you may be locked out. I am providing  complete sets of keys: if you loose one I would ask you 50$ refund to replicate the lost set. 4) No private party in the apartment, no extra guests. 5) Garbage has to be brought downstairs everyday in the specific garbage dump of the building ( to avoid cockroaches) : also garbage is divided in 2 different bags: organic and general. 6) please keep music, voice, on a moderate volume 7) if you use air conditioned turn it off when you go out of the apartment otherwise electrical bill will show an extra expense that I would have to charge extra if it is exaggerated. 8) Children under age of 12 are not allowed. 10) NO CHECK IN on Sunday  11) LONG TERM GUESTS: my assistant will clean apartment and change linen every 2 weeks.

neighborhood_overview: It's full of energy and character.
notes: I'm often asked about the safety of the neighborhood. Harlem has changed a lot in the past several years. It is safe to walk around day or night, alone or in a group.  The security deposit will be refunded as long as the house rules are followed. I dont have many rules. The two most important of these rules: You absolutely MUST keep the shared bathroom clean. This means cleaning out the drain trap after every shower whether you wash your hair or not. This means not leaving hair on the floor of the bathroom. And this means not leaving the bathroom mirror dirty after every use. The second important rule is following the recycling rules. I don't want to keep your deposit. This is not some way for me to make more money. I genuinely want you to feel relaxed and welcome in my home. Some rules are necessary for good co-habitation, even short term. Unfortunately, having a fine seems to make people more responsible.
transit: The apartment is 4 blocks from the express 2/3 train.
interaction: as much or little as you want
house_rules: No smoking in the apartment.  You will be expected to do wash all your own dishes with soap. You will be expected to follow the recycling rules. You may not leave any hair in the bathroom.

neighborhood_overview: NoHo is perfectly situated downtown Manhattan. You're nestled right in between East Village and SoHo. You can walk everywhere and experience the amazing energy on the streets. Some of NYC's best restaurants and bars are right outside the door. Neighborhood: Location, location, location! Best spot to stay in Manhattan! Right in between East Village, NoHo, SOhO, Nolita & Lower East Side. Hundreds of restaurants...some of NYC's best, as well as bars & cafe's. Just a few minutes walk from SoHo, Fifth Avenue & Broadway, perfect for shopping. Most hot-spots are also within walking distance. The F subway station is right across the street, otherwise 3 other subway stations are nearby and buses and cabs are right outside the door.
notes: The apartment is on the 4th floor, which in the US is 3 flights of stairs.  Please note there is no elevator/lift in the building. So if you're elderly or have difficulties climbing stairs, this may not be for you.
transit: There is access to NYC's subway right across the street and 3 other subway stations nearby.
interaction: I am always available via phone, sms or email with any questions you might have during your stay.
house_rules: CHECK-IN IS POSSIBLE BETWEEN 5PM - 12AM.  PLEASE NOTE THAT I ALWAYS LIKE TO CALL MY GUESTS PRIOR TO THEIR ARRIVAL TO GO OVER POTENTIAL QUESTIONS & CONCERNS FOR BOTH THE GUESTS AND HOST.

neighborhood_overview: Central Park, TimeWarner center on Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Radio city, Broadway theaters, Carnegie Hall, Fifth Avenue shopping, gourmet restaurants in Hells kitchen or Upper West side, best Museums and much more! 24 hours CVS pharmacy and dinner restaurant on a corner,... 11 subway lines to get around all 5 boroughs of NYC. The apartment is right off Columbus Circle.
notes: I want you to enjoy your stay in my apartment so please don't hesitate to reach out with any questions in order to help to plan your trip.  Look forward to your inquiries.
transit: Subways: 1,2,3,A,C,E,F,R,N,Q,W. Bus, rent a Citi Bike.

DROP OFF business, you can get you cloth back the same day or next morning. Price is the same as you would pay to do it your self; here you actually don't need to spend your time doing it. * No smoking  * No pets

notes: We try not to overbook, however occasionally it happens so we have added check-in and check-out times. Check out time  is 12:00 noon. Of course, we will work with our guests as we can to accommodate travel plans, especially later departure times.  Just let us know.  If somehow another guest overlaps we can keep your luggage safe until you need it. Check in time is anytime after 3:00 p.m. Earlier check-in can be accommodated, as long as the previous guests have departed the day before and it is arranged a few days ahead of time.
transit: Close to 2, 3 and 6 trains.  Walking distance to Metro North. The easiest airport to get to and from is La Guardia, you can take a local bus from the airport, the M60, to Park Avenue and walk to the house from there, or take the 6 train one stop.  It's about a 20 minute ride.  You'll need to by a MetroCard at the airport. There are a number of ways to get here from JFK.   The best least expensive way to get to the house from JFK airport is to take the AirTrain directly from the airport to Jamaica Station and get the subway E train from there into Manhattan.  The first stop in Manhattan is the Lexington Avenue 51/53rd Street station, from there transfer to the 6 train and go uptown to 116th Street.  The house is two blocks from the 6 train station.  It's $7.75 per person. For information about a bus: Look up NYC Airporter.  It's $18 one way per person or $34 round trip. NYC Airporter is the official bus operator of the DOT & The Port Authority of New York & New Jersey.  They provide exp
interaction: We can leave coffee outside your door if you'd like it in the morning.  We'll change linens when asked.  Interaction depends on the guest.  We're happy to help with any questions you may have and give a tour of subway stops and local shops.
house_rules: Enjoy.

neighborhood_overview: It's safe, and the "hottest" in NYC right now, sometimes called "NoMad" because of its proximity to Madison Park, home of the original Shake Shack and a sweet small park. Its basically at the border of Gramercy and Flatiron. In nice weather you can walk anywhere - ten minutes to Chelsea, East Village, etc. The nearby architecture is lovely, the streets are clean and sidewalks not too crowded.  Curry Hill is a block to the east, with great Indian food and groceries... Eataly is a block to the west, a must-visit Italian market with fresh fish/meat/produce and a bunch of mini-restaurants. Tons of great restaurants nearby. And if avant-garde fashion is your thing, Dover Street NY is very cool and very close.
transit: The 6 train and the N/R are 1 blk away, so you have the rare treat of being east but able to get to the west side pretty easily. Express buses run up and down Park and Madison Avenues, great for museum trips. There's a Citibike dock right across the street.
interaction: Guests enjoy total privacy - it's their apartment - although I am just a text or email away should they need anything. Note that I do live in this apartment - it's not a "vacation property."
house_rules: The main rule is the Golden Rule - please treat the apartment and building with respect. In addition, no parties and no overnight guests that haven't been previously approved by me. A book in the apartment provides check-out procedures, wireless access codes, appliance instructions, arrival/departure instructions etc. Also there are takeout menus, my own neighborhood guide and several other city/neighborhood guides.

neighborhood_overview: Fantastic and vibrant neighborhood. Area highlights include Apollo Theater, Red Rooster, Sylvia's, Studio Museum of Harlem, The Schomburg and Central Park.  Central location providing easy access to all areas of the city while still retaining a neighborhood feel. Definitely not a small village but a welcome respite from the mad rush of the city center.
transit: The apartment is centrally located: best way around NYC is via subway. - 9 subway lines within a 10 minute walk from the apartment. - multiple bus lines are within a 5 minute walk, including the M60 to LGA airport - 3 CitiBike bike rental stations/kiosks within a 5 minute walk - For those driving, easy access to RFK/Tri-Boro and George Washington Bridges, I87 and I95 Highways - 7 minute walk to MetroNorth Railroad at 125 Street
interaction: We pride ourselves on helping our guests have a great visit. We are always reachable via phone/app/text/email etc.

neighborhood_overview: Architectural beauty, historic, well developed, safe, peaceful, less expensive than downtown, restaurants, environmentally friendly-several parks nearby,  less traffic, and noise pollution. Within walking distance of the Hudson and North east Central Park. Close to the center!!! Times Square is only three train stops away!!!
transit: Three subway stations service the neighborhood and several buses. Main subway station, is around the corner from the apartment, less than a two minute walk away. Transportation runs 24/7. Easy access from all three major aiprorts: JFK, La Guardia and NEWARK.
interaction: Am always available to answer any questions or concerns. I respond immediately, and assist with planning your itinerary.
house_rules: No drugs. Smoking outside, or out the front window.  No pets in the apartment, but a cat or a small well trained dog is allowed. Please inquire about bringing a pet, prior to reserving. Please make sure to lock the apartment door, upon leaving and entering the apartment.  No loitering anywhere on the property: front steps, vestibule, nor lobby. The apartment faces and overlooks, a long stretch of gorgeous park.. there are park benches, a few steps away from the property.  SHOELESS HOME: Please make sure to wipe feet on the mat feet prior entering the apartment. Please leave shoes at the door. Trekking in dirt and bacteria, is abrasive therefore, corrosive to the hardwood floor, and unsanitary. Thank you!  No roof access, please do not go up to the roof. There’s a boogie man up there.  Thank you and enjoy your stay!

notes: Please note that the building is on a major street (1st avenue) so while this means you are in the heart of the East Village, there will be some street noise   even with two sets of soundproof windows.  The apartment itself is above a dive bar on the ground floor.  Low level of music can be heard at night but it is never loud or distracting.  Most guests remark how quiet it is in the apartment given the location but if you are extremely sensitive to any noise this might not be the best place for you.
transit: The apartment is located in a vibrant, safe, downtown neighborhood known for its great dining and nightlife and is only a 5-10 minute walk to the F, L, 6, R, and N subway stations. In just minutes you can walk to the Lower East Side, Soho, Little Italy, Chinatown, Nolita, Alphabet City, Union Square, Gramercy, Bowery, and Greenwich Village, and you're just one subway stop away from exploring Williamsburg in Brooklyn.  This apartment is a great base from which to explore all that New York City has to offer.
interaction: I am available if you need help with the apartment or would like local recommendations.
house_rules: Please leave the apartment the way you found it. A fully refundable security deposit of $1000 is required, payable at the time of booking.  The amount will be refunded in full once I confirm that the apartment and its contents were not damaged. No smoking is allowed in the apartment.   Please remove shoes before entering the apartment as the floors scratch easily. No loud music or piano playing should occur after 10pm.  This includes the outdoor patio. No trash bags in the stairwell.  Please do not put anything on the refrigerator, including magnets.  Please do not flush anything other than toilet paper in the toilet.   No illegal file-sharing/Bittorrent usage is permitted.  You are liable for any damages due to copyright infringement during your stay.   No drinks on the piano.   For security please make sure the front door of the building is shut completely behind you.

neighborhood_overview: The Bowery is an incredible location simply due to the history and change it has seen and undergone in the past decade. Uniquely situated at the crux of Chinatown, Nolita and the Lower East Side, it is infused with shopping, restaurants and a burgeoning art scene. With Soho and the East Village just a couple of blocks away, you really have a myriad of environments to explore and discover. There are all the restaurants (La Esquina, Balthazar, Lovely Day, Cafe Henrie, Dimes, de Maria, Bacaro, Freemans, Essex...the list is really too long), boutiques (anything you can think of) and nightlife (Bowery Ballroom, the Box, Bowery Hotel, Crosby Bar, Gold Bar, Milk & Honey, etc...), basically anything you could ask for. There are also a growing number of galleries in the area alongside the New Museum. Close to gyms such as Equinox and NY Sports, the best yoga studios (Sky Ting and Y7), Whole Foods for marketing, and one of the best movie theatres, Sunshine Cinema and the new Metrograph, a cinema
notes: Stairs: Although it is noted in the description, I would like to reiterate that this is a 4th floor walk up.  NYC noise: The bowery has become a very popular destination and although I am on the 4th floor and have double pane windows, the noise does travel from the street. There are white noise machines in each of the bedrooms to allow for an easier transition into the bustling city.  Late arrival will incur an extra fee as additional arrangements need to be made. Between 7-11PM is 35$ and after 11PM is 50$
transit: The loft is literally around the corner from the most practical metro line. The B/D runs up the middle of manhattan to central park. It facilitates easy access to so many parts of the city and to brooklyn. The J, M, Z and F trains are 2 blocks away and provide additional means to accessing more of the city.
interaction: I have been living in New York for nearly 10 years mostly full time, working in fashion. I am happy to share with you my favorite spots and the little quirks that make New York so amazing or if you are simply looking for a yoga studio, a great restaurant or a unique florist. I speak fluent french and spanish with a working knowledge of italian.
house_rules: There is absolutely no smoking of any kind in the loft or building. If you end up smoking, there will be a fee of 500$ to have the place deep cleaned. The loft is not available for parties. Check-in is after 4pm and check-out is by 11am, I can be flexible, however please make me aware of any special requirements.  Arrivals between 7pm and 10pm will incur an extra charge of 35$. Arrivals between 10pm and Midnight will be 50$. After midnight will be 100$. Please plan accordingly.

neighborhood_overview: The Lower East Side is roughly bounded by the Bowery to the west, East Houston Street to the north, the F.D.R. Drive to the east and Canal Street to the south. The western boundary below Grand Street veers east off of the Bowery to approximately Essex Street (Where we are!). Galleries sprung up throughout the Lower East Side and East Village some 200. In December 2007, the New Museum relocated to a brand-new, critically acclaimed building on Bowery at Prince. A growing number of galleries are opening in the Bowery neighborhood to be in close proximity to the museum. The Museum of Reclaimed Urban Space, which opened in 2012, exhibits photography featuring the neighborhood in addition to chronicling its history of activism. The Lower East Side is also home to many live music venues. Punk bands played at C-Squat and alternative rock bands play at Bowery Ballroom on Delancey Street and Mercury Lounge on East Houston Street. Punk bands play at Otto's Shrunken Head and R-Bar. neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in upper Manhattan (Otherwise known as Harlem Heights) We are situated on Riverside Drive, Riverbank State Park is right across the street and offers a swimming pool, track, gym, soccer field, basketball courts, tennis courts, skating and an amazing bike path that stretches the length of Manhattan.  There are several good restaurants in the neighborhood, a Rite Aid on the corner, a supermarket and several banking machines apx. a block away.
notes: I think airbnb works best for both guest and host when you have a little dialog before hitting the "book it" button. So please feel free to ask any questions you might have about myself, my family and the accommodations. I am happy to answer :-) Thanks! Hope to be able to host you during your stay in New York!
transit: This is  a great area and well connected to the rest of the city via the 1, A, C, B and D subway lines ( the 1 train is only one block away) as well as the M5, M4, M19, and the M11 buses. Travel time is about 20 mins to midtown Manhattan.
interaction: I freelance and so I am not always available to answer questions in person. When I'm there I am more than happy to do so. I am always available by phone and text message. When I'm home I'm happy to make recommendations, suggestions and to help my guests find their way around NY.
house_rules: Please do not bring uninvited guests/friends into the apartment or the room. There is a $35.00 dollar charge for lost keys and a $25.00 fee for a lost key card. notes: An older historic type building with modern conveniences - Eleanor Roosevelt spent time in this apartment!

neighborhood_overview: The building is centrally located across from New York City's cultural center, Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts.   Named after and defined by the Lincoln Center for Performing Arts, Lincoln Square is home to the New York Philharmonic, the New York City Ballet and the Metropolitan Opera among many other cultural institutions. The neighborhood blends the prewar architecture and history, style and class of the Upper West Side with newer, modern construction.

neighborhood_overview: The East Village/ Lower East Side of Manhattan is a funky vibrant bohemian neighborhood, with tons of Bars,( ***there is one on the ground floor of the building***), Restaurants, Cafes, small cool Ma & Pa Shops, it is a vibrant night life destination and people from all walks of life come from all over. It gets pretty busy towards the weekend. My apt is located on Avenue A, ****which gets a bit loud at night. If you are noise sensitive.... please think before booking... :-)*****  It's still remains one of the most authentic and real, "untouched by Disney" ;-).... extra unique, vibrant NYC neighborhoods. Hey Katz Deli is around the corner. And again, I just love Alphabet city just the way it is.
notes: *I keep my home very clean. *I ask of you to respect that and try and keep my place as clean as possible.  *PLEASE NO SMOKING!!!!!!!!  Please no extra loud music, no parties allowed. * No Candles.!!! * Regular Garbage Schedule  Please place garbage outside the building on the sidewalk after 4:00 PM the following days: Sunday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday. * Recycling : Please place in clean plastic bag outside the building on the sidewalk after 4:00 PM Thursday.
transit: Transportation info: Subways: all with in a 10 minutes walk. *F Train- Enter on 1st Ave and  & E. Houston St.  *6 Train- Astor Place station E.8th & 4th Ave  *N,R,W,Q- Broadway & 8th St.   *L Train on East 14th St and First Avenue.  If you are visiting Williamsburg take the L train Super easy quick trip.  The L train is closed on weekends for repairs. Also Bus line: The 14A crosstown bus is right out-side the building. That will take you Crosstown on 14th st.  to most Subway lines.  At Union Sq 4,5,6, L, N, Q, R, W At 6th Ave The F, L At 7th Ave The 1, 2, 3 , L At 8th Ave A,C,E,L
interaction: If you need anything during your stay or any questions come up, send me an email,text, call  or just come upstairs.

I need to know your ETA for Checking -In as early as possible, so I can plan ahead when to expect you!!! It is important.  My place usually is booked solid, My check out time is pretty strict. :( ******Important: No more then 6 guests. I will cancel your reservation Immediately if you have more then 6  guests in your group. If I see that you are having more then 6 guests upon arrival or during your stay, You will be LOCKED out of the Apartment.!!!!!!!!!!!

neighborhood_overview: The Parks!  I'm located a block from Riverside Park which is right on the Hudson River with views across to New Jersey.  It has amazing running, walking and biking trails which can take you all the way down to Battery Park and the Statue of Liberty or north to old growth forests and the Cloisters!  I'm also 4 blocks from Central Park - about a 10 minute walk.  And a 10-minute walk to Columbia University.
notes: If you have special requests and/or needs, or require further information, please don't hesitate to contact me directly before booking. *A third guest can be accommodated for additional $50/per night, however, I just need to know the relationship, age, etc prior to approval.   Children under age of 1 can be accommodated at no additional charge. Please let me know if plan on receiving deliveries prior to or during your arrival - these can be accommodated - I just need to know in advance to provide further details.
transit: The apartment is a 3-minute walk to an Express subway stop - which can take you to Times Square in 10 min - and the financial district/Ground Zero in 20 minutes.   The subway line is the red line - 1/2/3 trains (2 and 3 trains are the EXPRESS trains, 1 is the local).  I recommend the MTA New York website/app for more information, directions, etc., AND/OR the apps itransnyc and HopStop. Taxi from JFK: taxi fare is a flat rate of $52 + tolls and tip and takes approx 40 minutes to 1 hour (depending on traffic).   From JFK: By subway/train - take AirTrain ($5.00) heading to Jamaica Station and get off at Sutphin Blvd/Jamaica Station.  Transfer to the Manhattan-bound "E" subway train ($2.75) heading to World Trade Center and exit at 42nd Street.  Transfer to the 1 (local train) or the 2 OR 3 express train (red line) heading Uptown to 96th St. station (2 stops on express train).  Total trip time will take approx. 1.5 hours max.  More detailed directions provided upon booking. From Newark:  T
interaction: I make every effort to be at the apartment to welcome my guests (although sometimes I can't be there due to work schedules but this poses no issue for arriving guests and self check-in information is provided upon booking) and am extremely timely in communicating before and during one's stay.  I'm more than happy to provide transportation assistance, restaurant recommendations (I have a very extensive guest book here and also printed in the apartment) and any other NYC questions you might have.  It's my true pleasure to assist my guests in any way possible to ensure a wonderful stay in the city. It's very rare that I need access during a guest's stay and, if at all, it's usually to say hello if I can't be there upon arrival.  ** If you prefer a self check-in let me know and I'll vacate premises prior to your arrival.
house_rules: Absolutely NO Smoking in apartment or building.  ONLY outside, away from main entrance.  - No Pets (unless arranged in advance).   - 2 ppl max.  - Doormen are not to be used as concierges, retrieving taxis, directions, etc.   - Check in and check out times MAY be flexible but not guaranteed so please look at them and let me know your arrival/departure times IN ADVANCE.   -Most importantly, no additional unauthorized  overnight guests  AND treat the apartment as if it is your own so please make sure that when you check out it is in ALMOST the same condition as when you checked in!   Thank you!

neighborhood_overview: It's a fantastic, up and coming neighborhood, full of new restaurants, coffee shops, bars, Etc.....also is located just outside of the "craziness" of touristy parts of the city.
transit: 2/3 Express train and B/C local are both one block away, so travel anywhere in NYC is quick and easy.
interaction: I love to see my guests in the morning for coffee, or for a glass of wine after a long day out in the city.  I'm usually gone during the day as well and have a flexible schedule so sharing the apartment is never an issue.  I can also recommend lots of things in the neighborhood and NYC in general to see and do!

neighborhood_overview: Soho New York?  It doesn't get better than this.  We are literally 1/2 block from all subways.
notes: The unit we are renting is completely separate and has it's own entrance to the unit and separate entrance to the shared bathroom so in no way are we ever "crossing paths." If you would like to see the planogram of the space it is in the photos section of this listing. This is a 4 floor walk up. Bath is shared however each unit has its own entrance. See planogram in photos section.
interaction: As much as they need.  Usually, we have little interaction as our guests are very independent.
house_rules: No smoking.  4th floor walk up so be sure you are ok with that. NO MORE than two people are allowed to rent at one time. There are no exceptions to this. Just know (as stated in the advert) that we usually rent Thurs-Sun/Monday but due to the massive popularity of this rental, we are renting all the time.  I usually come back to the city on Monday to work and tend to leave Thursday evening for my farm hence the bath is shared on the other days.  The unit we are renting is completely separate and has it's own entrance to it's unit to the bathroom so in no way are we ever "crossing paths."  Please see the pics for this listing as we have provided for you a detailed visual planogram of the loft set up.

neighborhood_overview: Sugar Hill. Jazz lives. You have arrived. Old world elegance, Belgian block streets, your view shed is George Washington's headquarters for the Battle of Harlem Heights in 1776. The neighborhood is safer than Greenwich Village or Chelsea. Peaceable kingdom. Restaurants: Malecon: 4141 Broadway (they deliver!). This is arguably the best Dominican food north of the islands kicking out the best Latin soul food in the city. Their chicken may be the best in town. Their sweet plantains are like little kisses. And cheap. Family style extends to after hours. I've met some of the greats of the merengue and bachata music scenes here just before dawn. Coogan's: 4015 Broadway (between 168th & 169th). Washington Heights favorite watering hole is the world's only Irish/Dominican bar. A great scene that serves decent pub cuisine. Malecon: 4141 Broadway (at 175th) & delivers ((PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). Their garlicky rotisserie chicken is perfection. Company on Edgecombe: 537 Edgecombe Ave (159th). Luxury
notes: Pets considered.  Smoking permitted in the garden.
transit: By Car – Up St. Nicholas Avenue to 160th Street, turn right one block or down Broadway to 160th, turn left to between St. Nicholas and Edgecombe Avenues. By Madison Ave. Bus – M2 to 160nd St & Edgecombe Avenue, M3 to 160th & St. Nicholas Avenue. By Subway – IND 8th Ave – A train to Harlem, Local, C train to 163rd St. Station, use south exit at 161st St. and walk one block south and one half block east. (NOTE: from April 13th to Sept, 2018 our 163rd St Station is being repaired.  Rather than our usual 3 minute walk, the 155th St & St. Nicholas subway station is a 6 minute walk, but that station is temporarily closed on weekends.  We find ourselves now mostly making a 10 minute walk to the 168th St. hub, the #1, A and C express stop.) By I.R.T. Subway – Broadway 7th Ave. line (1) to 157th St. Station. Walk north to 160th St., then 2 blocks east. From Airports – Grand Central Parkway to RFK Bridge.  Exit 125th Street, Harlem.  West to St. Nicholas Ave, North to 160th St, Right. No traffic
interaction: Hosts on premises to assist with anything you need, from directions to history lessons.  We rent one apartment only and fully meet NYC's requirements for short term rentals.
house_rules: Don't steal books or murder anybody and we'll get along fine!

neighborhood_overview: We live in Central Harlem. It is a very safe area so there is nothing to worry about. The walks to the train stations are safe and easy to navigate. it is an up and coming area so there is some construction in the area, but nothing that will disturb your stay. We are walking distance from the famous Apollo Theatre, two blocks from The Hamilton House and other historical Harlem landmarks.
notes: **CHECK IN AND CHECK OUT TIMES. VERY IMPORTANT** PLEASE note the check in and check out times if you are booking flights, trains or buses into the city. Our space is consistently booked almost back to back. We have a lot of people asking for earlier check ins/later check outs due to flights. Please know it is RARE that we can accommodate this. We both have fairly packed schedules, so the time we have reserved to turn the space around is very much needed. If you are asking for an exception in your check in/check out, do know there is a chance we won't be able to accommodate to that. As an alternative for keepings your suitcases, there are dozens of suitcase lockers located around the city for tourists (checkout bagbnb!) that you can store suitcases in if you want to explore the city before and after check out times. To guests that will be staying with us during the New York winter months (October-March) it is good to be aware that occasionally when the radiator/heat pipe comes on when i
transit: We are only 7-10 minutes walking distance from multiple train stops. You can walk to the 135th Street stop of the 2,3 EXPRESS trains and the 145th Street stop of the A,C,B,D EXPRESS and LOCAL trains. (Hidden by Airbnb) Maps very much helps you get around accurately. Uber, Via, Lyft, etc. All those ride share apps opperate here in the city and if you use the "pool" option the fares are extremely cheap.
interaction: While Derek and I both work long hours and may not be home most of the time during your stay, We are always available to help with any questions you have about the area. Our phone numbers will be left downstairs in addition to Airbnb sending it to you. Feel free to text us if you get locked out, are looking for a recommendation, etc. However, go get lost in the city! It is the BEST way to explore. Take a train to a random stop, get off and GO!
house_rules: We strive to maintain a very clean household, and expects guests to do the same. We ask that when in the shared spaces you are mindful to clean up after yourself, (no dishes left in the sink, toiletries left in shower, etc.) There is No Smoking of any kind in the apartment including but not limited to cigarettes, cigars, marijuana, vap pens, etc. If you wish to do so you may go outside. Also no burning of in-scents. There is to be no loud music to be played between the hours of 11:00pm -10:00 am as we have to be courteous to neighbors. The floor is tiled in the space so just be mindful of tv/music volumes because the sound really carries. When you leave, leave in the same condition as it was left for you. We have check-out instructions listed in the guest manual binder in the space for you.  Pets will be allowed only under special  circumstances that would have been discussed prior to booking.       No guests will be allowed in addition to those confirmed at the time of the booking. We

neighborhood_overview: Located on East 5th Street in the heart of the awesome East Village neighborhood. Many boutiques, cafes, restaurants and bars all within a 1-2 block radius.  Great stylish Italian restaurant "Lavagne" just down the block, local hipster bar "Sophie's" on the corner, cool brunch cafe "GG's" directly opposite and East Village's best Korean Noodle bar right next door! ("Minca")  10 minute walk to Broadway shops and more great restaurants and shops in Soho, Nolita and Lower East Side areas.  The famous Tompkins Square park and big supermarket just around corner.
notes: All towels, linen, soaps, shampoo & conditioner will be available so you have more room in your suitcase for more interesting things!    -  Free Wifi, password will be provided.    -  Please no pets or smoking inside.     - Two sets of keys will be provided.
transit: The East Village is known for its nearby access points to public transportation to discover the rest of New York City. Nearby subway lines: F (5 mins walk), 6 (10 mins walk), L (10 mins walk). Buses M15 and M9 are within less than 5 mins.
interaction: Your stay is all about you! We will not be present during your stay so you have full privacy. We will either hand you the keys and take you for a quick apartment tour or we will provide instructions to access our outside lockbox with keys so you can check in at anytime suitable to you.
house_rules: - no smoking - no pets - please wash dishes before leaving - if you break something, no worries that's just gravity, but please let us know so we can come to an arrangement if necessary. - you can leave towels in bathtub and linens on bed when leaving - have a great time in NYC! :)

neighborhood_overview: The East Village is a vibrant, energetic neighborhood with lots of shops restaurants, parks and more. For your convenience, the neighborhood offers plenty of restaurants (including vegetarian/vegan, Thai, Japanese, Mexican, pizza, falafels, diners and much more), grocery stores (including Whole Foods and Trader Joe's), farmer's markets, coffee shops, 24-hour delis and pharmacies, off-Broadway theatres, cinemas, nightlife options and more.
notes: 1. The room itself is very small and is approximately 6.5'x8.25' (about 53.5 sq. feet/5 sq. meters), and there are two guest rooms in the apartment. 2. Your bedroom is private, but YOU WILL BE SHARING THE COMMON AREAS of the apartment (bathroom, kitchen and living room) if I have guests in the other guest room for the same time period. If this is an issue for you, then do not book this room. 3. If I am not traveling, then I personally tidy up my place every day or every other one to clean the common areas and to make sure things are stocked (teas, hand soap, paper towels, toilet tissue, etc.) and garbage and recyclables are removed. I do ask that you help me keep the place clean by picking up after yourself and disposing of trash and recyclables in their proper places. The place is super-convenient as noted above, has an awesome host (if I may say so myself) and is a great value. I enjoy meeting different people, and I look forward to welcoming you as a guest into my home.
transit: The L train is a less-than-5-minute walk away, and multiple bus stops are within one to a few blocks away. Within a short walking distance is Union Square, Greenwich Village, the Lower East Side, Chinatown, SoHo, Washington Square Park and more! Subway trains that are very close include the L, 4, 5, 6, F, N, R, Q, all of which will connect you wherever you want to go in a snap!
interaction: I love NYC, and I love sharing my love of the city with my guests! I'm easily available if there are any issues, you have any questions or if you simply need some recommendations, tips or directions. If we don't see much of each other, just contact me via Airbnb message, text message, iMessage, Wh@tsApp, etc.
house_rules: Be kind. That about sums it up--not just in my apartment, but in life in general.  :-) Beyond that, here are a few things to note: • I generally say that check-in is after 12pm (noon) and check-out is by 10am.  However, I'm flexible if you're arriving/departing earlier or later (depending on my work projects and/or meetings that day); please let me know your arrival and departure times IN ADVANCE. • Please no smoking (including e-cigarettes and/or vaping) in the apartment or building--not even if a window is open. You will be asked to leave immediately, reported to Airbnb and charged a substantial fee for professional cleaning and odor removal services of the entire apartment. • Help conserve energy by turning off lights, air conditioning, television, laptops and other electronics when not in use. • Please help keep the kitchen and the rest of the apartment tidy by cleaning up after yourself--washing dishes, glasses and utensils immediately after use and cleaning up any spills and mess

neighborhood_overview: Hamilton Heights is a true New York neighborhood. Full of small local restaurants and local businesses. A place where they know your name. Local bars full of young people determined to make it in the Big Apple. Good food without downtown prices.  The place is full of history. Alexander Hamilton, one of America’s founding fathers, lived here. His house, now a free museum, is just blocks away from our house. In 1776 George Washington fought a battle of Hamilton Heights here. There is plaque commemorating that on Broadway.  Another interesting spot is Morris Jumel Mansion built as a summer villa in 1700s. It’s now a museum. An image rare view of life in early New York.
notes: Because of the tricky entrance (pleas see description of our space) we do not recommend elderly guests, or guests with children to book with us.
transit: We are located near two subway lines the number 1 and the A train.  The number 1 is a local train that runs along Broadway all the way to the southern tip of Manhattan. (Statue of Liberty) The A train is an express train which means it’s only 3 stops to Times Square (42nd street) We also have 2 bus lines: number 4 and 5 that take you to Central Park and all the museums.
interaction: We are always reachable by text or phone. We live above the airbb.

neighborhood_overview: Experience the diversity of contemporary Harlem and the culture, arts, and residents of this unique community that has influenced every corner of the globe. Harlem is a vibrant community, rich in arts and culture (The Apollo, Studio Museum in Harlem, jazz clubs, art galleries, historic architecture (Strivers Row, Astor Row, Hamilton Terrace, City College), cuisine (Italian cafes, soul food, French bistros, Senegalese, Ethiopian, Dominican, contemporary American, Mexican, bakeries, Caribbean), restaurants owned by internationally renowned chefs, and much more. Two blocks away, you will find 24-hour corner stores, Duane Reade (a citywide health, beauty and pharmacy chain), and a Chase Bank with 24-hour ATMs. Within walking distance, there are a number of takeout restaurants (Caribbean, Chinese, soul food) if you prefer to eat at home, and local bars (The Shrine, Cove Lounge, Harlem Social, Yatenga, Londell's and much more) where you are certain to meet local residents and fellow traveler
notes: Key Food 2630 Frederick Douglass Blvd (at the corner of West 140th Street) (Hours: Monday-Saturday: 7am-10pm)  Sunday: 8am-9pm)
transit: The B or C subway lines at the 135th Street station are steps from your door on the corner, a two-minute walk. One stop away, at the 125th Street station, transfer to the express A or D lines and in 15 minutes you are in midtown: Columbus Circle/Times Square, Central Park, the Museum of Natural History, Rockefeller Center, MOMA, and many more sites. The M3 Bus is located steps from the apartment and takes you to the East Side's Museum Row (El Museo del Barrio, Museum of the City of New York, Guggenheim, Whitney and Metropolitan museums). The M10, also on the corner, takes you to the Upper West Side (Museum of Natural History, Columbus Avenue boutiques and restaurants, Lincoln Center, movie theaters, and Central Park). There is a moderately priced parking garage, two blocks away from the apartment, in the basement of the Strivers Gardens apartment building (300 West 135th Street, between St. Nicholas Avenue & Frederick Douglass Boulevard).
interaction: Your hosts are the property owners, who live in their own apartment on-site, and we will ensure that your arrival is a smooth and comfortable experience. We have been providing vacation rental services and welcoming guests from all over the world for almost ten years. We have traveled, lived and continue to work overseas. We enjoy meeting our guests and providing them with all of the information at our disposal to make their visit to New York City a memorable one. We are happy to share our insider knowledge of the city and make recommendations for special events, discount shopping destinations, gospel churches, and trips to other boroughs and cities (Philadelphia, Boston, Washington DC).
house_rules: This apartment is in a private home with neighbors' homes on each side, typical NYC vertical living. We hope our guests will be considerate about noise levels  and observe quiet time after 10pm.

neighborhood_overview: The vibrant neighborhood of West Harlem one of Manhattan’s most dynamic and culturally significant neighborhoods. Famous Samuel Thiam’s decadent French restaurant Maison Harlem right on the corner by the apt, Acclaimed eatery Red Rooster, Nabe Harlem, Corner Social, and Harlem BBQ take soul and comfort food to new gastronomic heights. Saint Nicholas Park right across the street features Alexander Hamilton’s home and National Memorial, and General Grant’s tomb, the largest mausoleum in North America, is close on Riverside Drive. The legendary Apollo Theater and jazz Showman’s and Paris Blues showcase a diverse range of performers during the evening hours. With the Express A & D train and the local B & C subway lines and the Metro-North station, commuting to and from Harlem 125 couldn’t be more convenient. On 125th St next to apartment are tons of stores, including Chase Bank, Bank of America, Capital One, drugstores, American Apparel, MAC, Foot Locker, Marshall's, Old Navy, T-Mobile, Ni
notes: Now continue reading for some tips on NYC- :)  I have lived in Manhattan for many years, I am glad to help you with any questions or tips!  Times Square best at night! Empire State Building or Top Of the Rock – go an hour before sunset and stay till after dark!  For Broadway Show Discount Tickets, go to BroadwayBox or Theatermania online!  Statue of Liberty-take a boat leaving from the South Street Seaport. Museums are best on a rainy day, so check The Weather Channel app on your smartphone for detailed weather info!  I look forward to hosting you in amazing NYC! :)
transit: Taxi from Airport, DO NOT go with the guys standing inside & outside the airport saying- "Cab. Taxi" These are NOT LEGIT cabs they are gypsy cabs, meaning they don't have their license or a meter so you will get OVERCHARGED! Look for the Taxi stand right outside the airport, where the yellow cabs are. Yellow cab takes cash or credit card. However, the EASIEST way from airport is to use UBER. Download the Uber app on your smartphone & set up your account. When you land at airport and after you get your baggage, use Uber & put in my address for destination. They will pick you up in 1 min! SO EASY, CHEAP, & NICER CARS THAN TAXI!   CityPASS is awesome! Best Bus Tour to see the city - Grey Line Bus Tours  Best Free App for subway map - NYC Subway Best Free App for Smart Phone for NYC- NYCWAY  NYC is just a grid, so it's pretty easy. The higher the number the STREETS go, the more NORTH you are going. The lower the number the streets go, the more SOUTH. The AVENUES go higher from right to lef

I’m known to sleep thru Hurricanes so please make as much noise as you wish!

neighborhood_overview: SoHo is the most chic and culturally rich neighborhood in the city.  It has wonderful landmarked architecture, enjoyable people watching, exquisite shopping options and some of the best restaurants in the city.  Even if you don't end up staying in this loft, definitely stay somewhere in Soho.  No other neighborhood is as interesting or centrally located.
notes: There are a few reasonable house rules: don’t bother the neighbors; no smoking; kindly remove shoes when in the apartment; please return kitchen to the state you found it in; kindly follow recycling guidelines; turn off lights/AC when not in apartment (apartment runs on expensive wind power).  Thank you very much for your help.
transit: Mostly you will be walking around and enjoying the neighborhood, but if you want to sightsee further, the loft is ideally located within a few blocks of 4 out of the 5 major NYC subway lines: BDFM services the middle of the city, NR diagonally services the city, 6  services the Eastside and CE which services the Westside.
interaction: I generally leave town early prior to guests' arrival to accommodate a proper and thorough cleaning and resetting of the apartment. Regardless, I will email you a detailed house guide and map one week prior to your arrival date.
house_rules: No smoking, no exceptions.  No parties or commercial events, no exceptions.  Primary renter must be over 35.  Because of the exclusive location and wonderful neighbors, please no noise after 11 pm.  Kindly leave my home as you found it.

We are within 20 minutes walking distance of Little Italy, Soho, Tribeca, South Street Seaport, the Financial District. Also within walking distance are: Wall Street, Statue of Liberty, Battery Park, Ground Zero, the Lower East Side, East Village and K-town. neighborhood_overview: EXPECTATION MANAGEMENT: WIth regard to location-- We are NOT park avenue. This is a very real NYC neighborhood. I have lived here with my children for 6 years, take my dog for walks/go jogging in my neighborhood late at night and have never felt like I was in danger. HOWEVER, it is NYC and while it is usually quiet, you should expect the occasional ambient city noise. The building is a National Landmark, and is beautiful, but we do not have a doorman, marble floors, beautiful flowerbeds or anything like that. If you are looking for squeaky clean, having your luggage brought in with white gloves, etc. then you may want to look elsewhere. However, if you are accustomed to city living you will know this apartment is great as it is so close to the subway, and is located in a decent and relatively quiet neighborhood.  TRANSPORTATION: We are a quick 90 second walk to the major ACE (Blue Line) Subway line and 2 blocks (5 min walk) from 1,2,3 (Red) Subway line.  Both options will give you full
notes: - Official Check-In time is 4PM. Early Bag drop off MAY be available for an additional $25. Check for availability - we try to accommodate arrival times when we can. *Note* Once an appointed personal check in time is established it is expected that time will be adhered to from both the host and the guest. Yes, things happen and if they do, then appropriate and timely communication from BOTH parties is expected to make check-in as smooth as possible so no one is waiting on each other. If the guest OR host is more then 1 hour late to the appointed check-in time without reasonable communication - a $25 fee/refund will be assessed-- YES I am just as accountable as you :) - Check-out is at 10AM. We must be adamant about this as we need to prepare the room for our next guests. - Due to confusion, I just need to clarify. Anyone staying in the room beyond the first 2 people will be charged an extra $25/per person per night. Yes, Infants, children, teenagers, grandparents are indeed people. - D
transit: Our apartment in located on the 1st floor of a National Historical Landmark building at 157th & St. Nicholas Ave. (It is called the "Duke Ellington Building - Yes DUKE ELLINGTON LIVED HERE!) We are located in Hamilton Heights/Manhattan area New York City. A real NYC neighborhood -- sometimes has a bit more litter than I would like, but it is safe and homey. Has a Dominican flavor.  We are a super conveniently located to several mass transit lines. Only a quick 90 second walk to the major ACE (Blue Line) Subway line and 2 blocks (5 min walk) from 1,2,3 (Red) Subway line.  Both options will give you full direct access to the West side of Manhattan. Midtown access (Times Square/Central Park/Rockefeller Center/ Empire State Building/ Museum of Natural History/ 911 Memorial) is only a short 20 min subway ride.  If you have a car, street parking is available but can be a challenge to find, especially later in the day.   There is a grocery store only a few blocks away. This is a residential n
interaction: Traveling/Prior to your stay: We provide our guest email transactions as well as our 24-hr business line so we can stay in touch during your stay either via text/ phone or email.  International calls will be assessed a fee however as we are assessed that same fee by our provider. During your stay: I work from home, so I am home much of the time during the day.  The children will be at school most for most of the day on weekdays, but we will all be home on the weekends (Unless we are out of town). We do have a well trained German Shepherd - but she pretty much sticks with me, will never be in your room. She will be contained in one of the other bedrooms when we are not in the apt. We respect your privacy and keep quiet time at night so as not to disturb you, and ask our guests to do the same.
house_rules: Please take a moment & read this – you will be bound as accepting these rules upon check in & are responsible for them. *Infants DO count toward the total person count.  List any infants as children. This is shared space, so it is important that all rules are followed so there is harmony. They are common sense and easy to abide by.  Check-in: - Check-in time is 4PM. We do try to be flexible if possible with our guests travel itinerary, however check-in after 10PM will be assessed an additional $45 Late check-in fee. Additionally - there will be a $45 late fee assessed if the guest arrives later than 90 min after scheduled arrival. - Please be cognizant of your scheduled arrival time as I will be waiting for you to check you in personally. neighborhood_overview: Chelsea is a truly special neighborhood in Manhattan because of its art galleries, the High Line, the restaurants, the convenient public transportation, the beauty of the Hudson River, the gorgeous architecture, and the sense of community shared by the residents.
notes: Due to complications with receiving packages, we cannot receive deliveries for Airbnb guests. Please do not ask to have packages delivered before or during a reservation. Thank you:)
transit: Public transportation is among the best in our immediate neighborhood. Also, getting to/from the three airports is very easy. From LGA, take the Q70 LTD bus (i.e., the express bus to Roosevelt St). At Roosevelt, transfer to the E subway toward Manhattan (total cost $2.50). From JFK, take the AirTrain to Jamaica Station. Transfer to the E subway toward Manhattan (total cost $7.50). From EWR, take the AirTrain to the airport train depot. Transfer to the NJ Rail to Manhattan's Penn Station (total cost app. $13.00 per person). Then, take the E subway downtown one stop, or take a taxi to our home. You can also walk from Penn Station if the weather is nice. From the E subway train, exit at 23 Street station in Manhattan. Walk two blocks to Tenth Ave. We live near the northwest corner of Tenth Ave and 23 St.
interaction: As much or as little as our guests like. We will cross paths occasionally in the kitchen, however :)
house_rules: Please treat our home as you would have others treat your own. You are welcome to come and go as you please (i.e., no curfews). The kitchen and living room are at your disposal. No entertaining outside guests, smoking, or playing loud music. The use of illicit drugs is strictly forbidden. Use of the clothes washer is available with our supervision and at a cost of $7 per load (regretfully, we found this measure necessary after our machine was accidentally broken by a guest). Our building has stairs and is therefore not suitable for small children.

neighborhood_overview: Greenwich Village,often referred to by locals as simply "the Village", is a largely residential neighborhood on the west side of Lower Manhattan in New York City. A large majority of the district is home to upper middle class families and celebs, like Anna Wintour, Phillip Seymour Hoffman, Annie Leibowitz, etc. Greenwich Village, however, was known in the late 19th to mid 20th centuries as an artists' haven, the bohemian capital, and the East Coast birthplace of both the Beat and '60s counterculture movements, writers and artists galore . What provided the initial attractive character of the community eventually contributed to its gentrification and commercialization. The name of the village was Anglicized from the Dutch name Groenwijck, meaning "Green District" into Greenwich, a borough of London.
notes: TRAINS CLOSEBY 5mins 1 , A, C, E, M, F, B, D, 6, R, N, Q, PATH Street parking available, particularly on weekends, during the week you may have to move it around a bit based on parking regulations. There are also plenty of proper car lots for about $40 per day.
transit: Every major subway line is about 5-7 minutes away by foot, even the train from JFK airport.

And of course, chemistry is key in any situation. Some people want to hang and some aren't interested at all. I really don't mind either way.

Like no other area in the city. A very peaceful cool neighborhood, yet just a short trip to all the action. neighborhood_overview: The East Village is a vibrant, energetic neighborhood with lots of shops restaurants, parks and more. For your convenience, the neighborhood offers plenty of restaurants (including vegetarian/vegan, Thai, Japanese, Mexican, pizza, falafels, diners and much more), grocery stores (including Whole Foods and Trader Joe's), farmer's markets, coffee shops, 24-hour delis and pharmacies, off-Broadway theatres, cinemas, nightlife options and more.
notes: 1. The room itself is about 9.5'x14' (about 135 sq. feet/12.5 sq meters), and there are two guest rooms in the apartment. 2. Your bedroom is private, but YOU WILL BE SHARING THE COMMON AREAS of the apartment (bathroom, kitchen and living room) if there is another guest in the other guest room for the same time period. If this is an issue for you, then do not book this room. 3. If I am not traveling, then I personally tidy up my place every day or every other one to clean the common areas and to make sure things are stocked (teas, hand soap, paper towels, toilet tissue, etc.) and garbage and recyclables are removed. I do ask that you help me keep the place clean by picking up after yourself and disposing of trash and recyclables in their proper places. The place is super-convenient as noted above, has an awesome host (if I may say so myself) and is a great value. I enjoy meeting different people, and I look forward to welcoming you as a guest into my home.
transit: The L train is a less-than-5-minute walk away, and multiple bus stops are within one to a few blocks away. Within a short walking distance is Union Square, Greenwich Village, the Lower East Side, Chinatown, SoHo, Washington Square Park and more! Subway trains that are very close include the L, 4, 5, 6, F, N, R, Q, all of which will connect you wherever you want to go in a snap!
interaction: I love NYC, and I love sharing my love of the city with my guests! If we don't see much of each other, just contact me via Airbnb message, text message, iMessage, Wh@tsApp, etc.

However, I'm flexible if you're arriving/departing earlier or later (depending on my work projects and/or meetings that day); please let me know your arrival and departure times IN ADVANCE so that we can coordinate a mutually agreeable check-in time and details. • Please no smoking (including e-cigarettes and/or vaping) in the apartment or building--not even if a window is open. You will be asked to leave immediately, reported to Airbnb and charged a substantial fee for professional cleaning and odor removal services of the entire apartment. • Help conserve energy by turning off lights, air conditioning, television, laptops and other electronics when not in use. • Please help keep the kitchen and the rest of the apartment tidy by cleaning up after yourself--wash

neighborhood_overview: Check out the Guidebook up top or click on Maps to see some of the dozens of places I've pointed out that are walking distance.   This is the beating heart of NYC - and, in my opinion, it's best neighborhood. Aside from being close to tourist sites, bars, lounges, lounges, clubs, restaurants, cafes, shops, bakeries, and everything you'd want in your visit here.   YOU'LL ALSO BE WALKING DISTANCE TO:    Bryant Park   Chelsea Market   Eataly   Empire State Building   Flatiron   Florist Market (colorful view from my windows, especially in the morning!)   Gramercy   Herald Square   High Line   Korea Town   Macy's   Madison Square Garden   Madison Square Park   Manhattan Mall   Meatpacking District   New York Public Library   Penn Station   Shopping   Times Square   Union Square   West Village and many more. notes: I would be more than happy to help you plan your time here, so feel free to ask!
transit: This includes the following lines: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, A, C, D, E, F, M, N, Q, R. I know that these letters and numbers might not mean much to you now, but you'll be quite pleased when you can get home quickly after a long day on your feet.  In addition, the airport trains from JFK and Newark bring all passengers to Penn Station, which is only one avenue and six blocks away.
interaction: I'm happy to share my knowledge about the area and NYC - my favorite 24 hour restaurants, where to buy wine, bars, jazz clubs, nightclubs, museums, an insane amount of food (from Afghani to West African, with French, Chinese, Mexican, BBQ, Lebanese, Greek, Indian, Italian, American, Cambodian, sushi, Thai, Korean, Middle Eastern and much more thrown in - all walking distance), tourist spots, non-touristy local hangouts, and everything in between.
house_rules: This is an extremely upscale and quiet building - please be respectful, quiet, low key and do not draw much attention to yourself - especially when coming and go during your stay, and arriving/departing. - Absolutely no parties.  - No loud noise.  - No loud music.

neighborhood_overview: What's not to love?  20 years ago, this neighborhood was the mecca of punk rock.  Today, all sorts of galleries, amazing restaurants, and great independent retailers have popped up. Additionally, Thursday - Saturday, this is one of the most popular areas for night life in the city.  The neighborhood itself still looks grimy, but it's safe as ever. The area was gentrified 10 years ago, but residents don't want the punk rock feel to leave just yet. And then there's chinatown 2 blocks away..
notes: Note that this is a monthly sublet. In addition to abiding by Airbnb's terms, you will be asked to sign a sublet agreement as required by law. The agreement just discusses the rental price and that you can't re-rent without permission from the landlord. It also goes over your rights as a tenant. You will also be asked to put down a 1 month security deposit via airbnb. The perk is - the landlord knows this is a sublet, so no need to "hide airbnb" :-) Also please note that this is a sublet and not a vacation rental or hotel. If maintenance is needed, let me know and I'll try to get someone in as soon as I can. This does depend on the building at times. You may be asked to leave keys for the building super/maintenance if repairs are needed. Generally repairs are done according to urgency. NYC does not require landlords reimburse for time spent waiting for repairs so we don’t get reimbursed while we wait. :-/ For this reason you will be required to purchase renters insurance. It’s $5-$15/m
transit: The F, M, J, and Z trains are 1 block away. The B and D trains are a 5 minute walk away. Also, there are several buses (particularly the M15 and M15 select) 5 minutes from me.  If coming from JFK, take the airtrain to the J train and get off at Delancey/Essex. If coming from LaGuardia, take the M60 bus to the B train and get off at Grand street.  All 3 airports also have private shuttle buses, which are great if you have extra luggage.  If you'd prefer to take a car service, good luck car service charges the best rates. They are cash or credit, with slightly higher rates for credit card. Rates are as follows: JFK $37 cash, $45 credit; LGA $27 cash $33 credit; EWR $40 cash, $48 credit. (note EWR also has tolls). You will need to reserve the car in advance.
interaction: I’ll be traveling but always happy to give tips from abroad. I also have friends who are local and can help on the ground if needed.
house_rules: No drugs or smoking in the apartment.  (There's a great smoking spot on the rooftop) Please remove your shoes Due to allergies, I cannot accommodate animals - even service animals (I’m so sorry!) Reservations must start before May 15 2020 and be for at least 30 days. All 30+ day bookings are subject to a background and credit check as well as a 1 month security deposit, to be added to the cost of your reservation.  All 30+ night stays are considered tenants and are required to sign a lease agreement.

transit: We highly suggest using the subway as it’s the most convenient and the quickest.
interaction: So far we have loved hosting on AirBnb and meeting new people! Unfortunately, our work schedules keep us away from the apartment for the most of the day, so we usually do not see much of each other. However, we are always there if you need help/ advice/ directions - we are just a phone call or text away!
house_rules: No guests allowed since this is our home. We will respect your privacy but you please respect our property.  Please let us know when contacting if you are planing to check in early or check out later than 10AM. neighborhood_overview: Chelsea carries the proud role of being one of Manhattan's leading  contemporary arts scene, combining the intellectual and social rigors of a close-knit community with a modern emphasis on growing economic opportunities in both art and business.  Lying east of the Hudson River and immediately south of the Lincoln Tunnel, this densely populated neighborhood has grown from humble beginnings to possess a traditional artistic spirit.
notes: A little more about our location, our neighborhood is called Chelsea, which is on the West Side of Manhattan in New York City, with many famous sights, including the High Line and Chelsea Market. With more than 200 art galleries, the neighborhood is known as a center for art in the city. Chelsea is abundant with green space that encourages outdoor activity and healthy lifestyles, Chelsea turns every sunny afternoon into an excuse to go outside. Here is a little more information to give you a New Yorkers perspective.There are many parks which cater to residents and visitors of all ages. When the sun comes out on a warm afternoon, the High Line stands as one of New York's most popular destinations. This elevated park includes a 1.45-mile-long green space of wildflowers and grasses ideal for walkers and sunbathers. As an old rail track that went out of use in 1980, this unique park offers panoramic views of the hustle and bustle below while removing visitors from the city's fast-paced env
transit: Transportation is key to enjoying your stay in NYC. Our building features many options from the subway,bus,taxi and Uber. The Subway and bus stop are literally right outside our front door. Please read our reviews as it is tough to beat the location and accessibility to public transportation from the location of our home. There is also a parking garage in our building as well, which features covered parking for the day or longer and also features Zipcar and other rental car companies.
interaction: We are always here for our guests if they need any information or suggestions however as our experience grows in being hosts with Airbnb so does our house manual which contains many of our favorite restaurants and sites.
house_rules: No Smoking No Additional Guests unless we have previously discussed. No Pets Clean up after yourself No parties or large gatherings unless we have discussed and are in agreement. The kitchen is great but we ask that you buy your own groceries or if you happen use something in the house please replace it. This is our home - So we kindly ask that you treat it that way

neighborhood_overview: . --- FROM THE "NOT FOR TOURISTS" GUIDE: Whew, finally a break from the chaos. This part of the Upper Upper East Side is a place for families, young, old, black, white, Latino, rich, poor--it just depends what block you stumble upon. Head above 96th Street for some of the best Mexican food on the planet, or head west to Central Park, where you'll find kids and adults playing soccer, softball, and football (Not touristy Central Park). Get some culture at the neighborhoods museums, get some knowledge at a lecture at the 92nd Street Y, but most importantly, get ready to be somewhere where people can actually live, work, and shop. Nothing hip or cool here, this is just a good old-fashioned New York neighborhood. Much of this part of the Upper East Side is known as Carnegie Hill, named for the Carnegie Mansion on 91st and Fifth Avenue (it's now the Cooper-Hewitt Design Museum). --- THE NEIGHBORHOOD: The "Museum Mile" is just 3 blocks away on Fifth Avenue, next to Central Park, a mere 5-7 mi
notes: . **** NO SMOKERS, DRUNKS OR DRUG ADDICTS. Those are all the restrictions :O)  If you have more questions please contact me. Also, Please note that ONE SET of fresh and soft linens and towels are included for your use, as well as body wash, shampoo, and a hair dryer. No need to pack any of that! ;-) LASTLY, I just decided that if some need more space, I'm willing to book the WHOLE APARTMENT -- sometimes; especially if I am traveling for Christmas, etc. My room is currently being renovated and is almost done! It will be ready in October...  The listing for that space is... https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/6609871
transit: .  --- TRANSIT: The apartment is easy to get to from any airport by cab or subway/train and, since it's w/in a block of a gas station, catching a cab is remarkably easy.  I'm just 2.5 short blocks (220 meters) in one direction and 4 blocks in the other direction (350 meters) from the "6-train" subway line and there is an "express bus" right outside my front door (both on Lexington Avenue). Basically, that means 10-15 minutes to Grand Central Station by train ...and Grand Central Station is just 3 avenues from Times Square OR you can take a quick shuttle ride on the S-train.  …or... cabs are easy to catch from here and they'll take you anywhere. ;-) Unlimited metrocards are the way to go for the majority of your travel. They work for both the bus and the subway! To purchase them, every subway station in Manhattan has a metrocard machine.   I provide detailed instructions on how to get here from the airports/train stations/port authority and car (via bus, train, subway, cab, etc). Airbnb

Just a 10 minute walk to Central Park and close to Columbia University, Manhattan School Of Music, Jewish Theological seminary, Barnard College, Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture and the historic Abyssinian Baptist church.

neighborhood_overview: West Harlem is the new star of the city, hundreds of places opened in the last years making west Harlem and morning side a very interesting place. Just 19 blocks away from Central Park. The neighborhood is very well lit, and is very safe, located between the universities of Columbia and CUNY which makes this area a mixture of cultures and ages. There are several supermarkets around, different types of businesses and some very good restaurants like. Maison Harlem, Max Soha, Dinosaur BBQ (the best barbecue in town) Harlem tavern among others. The apartment is not a walking distance from midtown and most tourist places, you will have to take a train and will take you 12 to 15 minutes to be in Time Square.  I want to provide a 5 stars experience, location included. The neighborhood is racially eclectic,  a mix of black, Latino, whites and many university students. This is NYC and we live, love and respect our differences. "IF YOU ARE AFRAID OF BLACK, LATINO PEOPLE, OR SIMPLY  YOU ARE  RACI
notes: When you arrive, you will have your own key to the apartment, to enter and leave whenever you want.

You can also take the "1" train  4 blocks away and also a little further the "2"&"3" 8 blocks away. there are also very convenient buses going downtown and crosstown Common travel times:  To here from-  JFK Airport: 50-65 minutes  LGA Airport: 20-35 minutes  EWR Airport: 1 hour  Port Authority & Penn Station: 25 minutes a taxi cost from JFK will be around U$S 65 take the ones in the taxi line, not in the street unless you called a service. and from La Guardia U$S 35 make the line and take the legal cars, don't take cars without identification. From here to-  Times Square & Midtown: 15 minutes  Wall Street & Downtown: 25 minutes  Central Park: less than 10 minutes Directions from JFK: take the air train to Jamaica station, change to the E

Times Square is only 3 stops  on the Q train which is only a block away! Organic Health food store for those that are vegan, vegetarian or gluten free, is a block away. One of the top vegan restaurants in the country is only a few blocks away!  All major banks are either across the street or a block away. neighborhood_overview: Hell's Kitchen has some of the best dining and nightlife in the city. The apartment is situated in walking distance of hundreds of bars, Restaurants, vibrant nightlife, Times Square Theater District, Lincoln Center, the Intrepid Museum, Central Park , Hudson River Park and much more.   From Air BnB: "Come explore an excitingly trendy neighborhood; Bursting with energy and devilish charisma, Hell’s Kitchen continues to evolve as high-rises move in and it is constantly growing. This classic New York City neighborhood is near it all—theaters on Broadway, green lawns in Central Park, and revered mom-and-pop culinary mainstays. As a storied NYC haunt, Hell’s Kitchen lives up to its unmistakable mystique.  This area has to be one of the most exciting areas in Manhattan for dining and outing. There are thousands of NYC top restaurants with all kind of different cuisines, popular bars and clubs, and also supermarkets, delis, pharmacies, natural stores, farmers market and Starbucks within steps

No guests allowed outside airbnb. No toothpaste spots on the mirror please. Every time you go out or go to sleep, turn off the lights. Every time you go out turn off the air conditioner. If you use dishes, cups or glasses, rinse them and put them in the dishwasher.

neighborhood_overview: My place is conveniently located near many of the world-class NYC museums like the Guggenheim, and the Metropolitan Museum. There are Madison Ave galleries and shops, and plenty of movie theatres. The Museum of Modern Art is an easy subway ride to E 59th St.  You can also explore Rockefeller Center, shopping on Fifth Ave, and the Apple Store.  Times Square is also an easy subway ride only 30 minutes. Central Park is one of the major attractions of living uptown.  The top of Central Park offers some of the most stunning nature in all of Manhattan including the Harlem Meer and Conservatory Gardens (btw E. 106 to E. 110 Sts).  Discover biking, as well as running, hiking or bird watching along the trails in the gorgeous North Woods.   ** More on the Neighborhood *** My apartment located in East Harlem or more accurately, Spanish Harlem or El Barrio.  This is a historic neighborhood in the north-eastern part of the New York City borough of Manhattan. East Harlem is one of the largest predom
notes: I live with a small short hair cat, she is friendly and sweet, and mainly stays in my part of the apartment. I clean and vacuum the apartment every week, and have had friends with pet allergies stay no problem when taking allergy-relief medication.  However, this is not a recommended stay for anyone who is extremely allergic to cats.
transit: In terms of public transport, I am super close to the Lexington Ave subway line (4-5-6) which runs downtown on the east side of Manhattan.  My apartment is only two blocks walk to the 6 local train, with an easy transfer to the 4 or 5 express (email hidden).  Depending on the time of day, you can be at midtown or Grand Central/United Nations in about 15-20 minutes, to Union Square/Greenwich Village in about 20-30 minutes and to the bottom of Manhattan to visit attractions like the Freedom Tower, 9-11 Memorial or Statue of Liberty/Battery Park, in under an hour.   Getting to west-side attractions is also convenient.  It is an easy walk to Broadway express trains, 2 or (email hidden) and Lenox, or an easy transfer from 6 local train.  Travel time to Columbus Circle-Lincoln Center or Times Square is about 40 minutes by subway.  There are several public buses nearby that run downtown, or across town including to Columbia University.  My place is also in walking distance to the M60 bus that
interaction: My priority is to make sure that my guests are comfortable and can enjoy their privacy. However, I am also at their service to offer helpful advice or tips on local bars or restaurants, or any tourist questions that might arise.  Guests are also free to text me with questions or problems.
house_rules: I will try to be as accommodating as possible, if something does not meet your needs, kindly feel free to ask in a polite and friendly manner. I ask that guests are courteous and respectful of my home and the things in it.  If you break or damage something in the apartment, make sure to let me know.  You will be charged if the value of the item is greater than $15.00 including linens.  Please keep the private and shared places clean.  If you eat or drink in your room, do not leave dirty dishes or left over food in the room.  Unclean dishes and food can attract pests that neither of us will want to deal with.  All guests are responsible for washing their own dishes and cleaning up after themselves.  This is a non-smoking building, so no smoking inside the apartment.  It is fine to invite guests over, however, please refrain from loud or raucous partying.  My neighbors have young children, so please be respectful.

neighborhood_overview: The East Village is the best neighborhood in Manhattan. We are surrounded by many of the coolest bars, restaurants, cafes, and shops in the city (see our guest guide book for recommendations). It's a community comprised of artists, families, students, musicians and everyone in between. One stop away from Williamsburg and walking distance from the LES, West Village, SoHo and Union Square. Sunday Farmers Market one block away and one in Union Square Mon/ Wed/Fri/Sat.  A Little EV History.  The East Village’s reputation as a haven for counterculture has also drawn some of the most  influential artists, musicians, and writers of their respective generations to the neighborhood, including W.H. Auden, Allan Ginsberg, Keith Haring, Madonna,  Charlie Parker, Lou Reed, and Andy Warhol, just to name a few. According to the  Visitor Center, in the early 1950s, the East Village was home base of the Beat poet-writers—Ginsberg, Jack Kerouac, and William S. Burroughs, among others—as well as the emer
notes: Our private guest Studio is located on the 4th floor of a beautiful pre-war walk-up building. You will need to carry your luggage up/down 3 flights of stairs. Family owned building with friendly neighbors (please say hello if you see them in the hall). We can arrange luggage storage before check in and after check out.  We are NOT able to offer bathroom access prior to check in or after check out.
transit: EASY SUBWAY ACCESS: 3 blocks from 6 train @ Astor Place - 4 blocks to the W/R @ 8th St and Broadway Ave - 6 blocks to L train @ 14 St and 1st Ave - 6 blocks to F train @ 2nd Ave.  NYC SUBWAY: The subway costs $2.75/ride when you purchase multiple rides; otherwise it costs $3 per ride. Pay-Per-Ride MetroCard is available in $ (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) , and $ (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) denominations . Unlimited Ride MetroCard passes are also available. The 7-Day Unlimited Ride MetroCard costs $33. Free subway to bus and bus to bus transfers within 2 hours.  UBER / LYFT / JUNO: All ride apps work well in the NYC area.  CITI BIKE: Citi Bike is NY's bike share program, with 10,000 bikes and 600 stations across Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens and Jersey City. It was designed for quick trips with convenience in mind, and it’s a fun and affordable way to get around town. Pricing: 1 Trip - $3 - single 30-minute ride on a classic bike - Day Pass -$12 -unlimited 30-minute rides in a 24-ho
interaction: We likely will not meet but will be next-door during your stay and happy to answer any questions you may have about the neighborhood or city. We cannot be present for guest check-in, but if you like we are happy to coordinate a time to meet in person to answer any questions and offer recommendations beyond what we list in our guidebook.
house_rules: No smoking in Studio or in building
