neighborhood_overview: Very centrally located while still far enough away from the craziness of mid-town. Has the feeling of a true NYC neighborhood. Chelsea is a very centrally located, safe, and trendy neighborhood. It's full of restaurants, bars, coffee shops, art galleries, and some great high-end/boutique shopping. Also, we're steps from the Highline (look it up - it's pretty amazing!), Chelsea Market, West Village, Greenwich Village, Hudson Yards, and Meat Packing district.  Quick 5 minute subway ride to Times Square (about 20 min walk). 20 min subway ride to Financial District.
transit: The C/E and 1 trains are all 2 blocks away, while the A, 2/3 & L trains are 7 blocks away.  Also within walking distance of Pennsylvania Station ( 11 blocks away) where you can get NJ Transit, LIRR and Amtrak.
interaction: It depends on the guests. I've had guests that I've had drinks with and others that choose to be more private. This is your experience and I am happy to be as involved in it as you would like.
house_rules: No more than 1 guests per booking (also - no parties please).  No smoking or drugs inside the apartment.  Sorry - but as much as I love them, no pets allowed. :-( Please keep common areas (kitchen and bathroom) free of dirty dishes and clean up after yourself. If you'll be cooking, please be respectful of kitchen supplies. Also - smells travel - so please no cooking of potentially potent smelling foods (fish, curries, etc.)  This is a quiet building so music and other noises should be kept low/to a minimum between the hours of 23:00 and 07:00. I am all about mutual respect and privacy and would ask for the same in return.  Enjoy your experience. If something is not right, let me know and I'll do whatever I can within reason to make it right.

neighborhood_overview: The area is extremely safe with five 24 hour doorman buildings on the block. Only a seven minute walk to the metro / subway and 2 blocks from the United Nations.  Located at the crossroads of some of NYC's finest and most convenient neighborhoods including Turtle Bay, Beekman, Sutton and Midtown East. Prime location, safe and accessible to everything. In walking distance, you will find some of the finest restaurants and shopping in NYC. The ease of access to Broadway Shows and Times Square just across town makes this unit a wonderful starting and ending point for any holiday or business trip.  Whole Foods is just 7 blocks away and 2 local supermarkets are within 2 blocks. The East River Promenade is 1 block away, having one of the city's best dog runs, water views and running paths. We look forward to your stay!
notes: For your additional comfort, we have also supplied a HEPA Air Purifier with UV-C which offers multiple levels of cleaning to help improve the indoor air quality.  It features multiple levels of cleaning including HEPA, UV-C and charcoal. This air purifier captures 99.97% of particles down to .3 microns in size.
transit: This furnished apartment is only 4 short blocks from the 6, E and M subway lines. The crosstown bus is located on the block just a few steps from the apartment.

neighborhood_overview: Between Gramercy Park and Union Square is Irving Place, one of New York’s oldest and most historic streets. Central Village, East Village, NYU, The Flatiron, Chelsea, Madison Square and Curry Hill surround you. West Village, The High Line, Times Square, the Upper East Side, Soho, the Lower East Side and Tribeca are all within 10 minutes using the buses, subways, and taxis in Union Square, one block away. Enjoy the Union Square farmer’s market, movie theaters, jazz clubs, shopping, sports bars, concert halls, top restaurants, Little India, the NYU campus around Washington Square, and the elegance of Lower Fifth and Park Avenues, all within easy walking distance.
notes: Not wheelchair accessible. And not suitable if you're seeking absolute quiet. Irving Place, while not loud like most streets or avenues in New York, is right beyond the balcony, so you'll hear street life and the conversations of passersby on occasion.  Photos reflect true proximity.
transit: Get in and out of the city easily via Grand Central Station or Penn Station,  the Train-to-the-Plane at all three airports, or Uber, Lyft, Via, and other car services.  Subways:  4/5/6/N/R/Q/L are a block away in Union Square B/F/D are 2 avenues away 1/2/3 are 3 avenues away
interaction: Happy to greet you on arrival, or keys left nearby if I can't. I'm available by text, email, or mobile phone anytime for help, advice or tips.
house_rules: No food or drink on or around the piano, please.

neighborhood_overview: Harlem was originally settled by the Dutch in 1658, but was largely farmland and undeveloped territory for approximately 200 years. As New York's population grew, residential and commercial expansion moved northward, and development of the Harlem territory was inevitable. Today Harlem is a bustling cultural mecca in Manhattan with lots to offer.
transit: 1 short block to the subway and short ride to Midtown and most tourist attractions. Plenty of taxis, Uber, Lyft and other transportation including Citi Bike. Walking distance to markets, drugstores, cafes, etc.

neighborhood_overview: East Village, Alphabet City, or Lower East Side (L.E.S) in Manhattan Four blocks from Tompkins Square Park and it's Sunday Farmer's Market, loads of fantastic restaurants, coffee shops, bars and shopping. Walk to Soho, Nolita, Lower East Side, Chinatown, Little Italy and even to Brooklyn.  Just a 10 minute walk to the Williamsburg Bridge. To the Eastern side of our block- we have the East River Promenade! It is picturesque looking over the Williamsburg Bridge, great for a run or to enjoy the scenery. There are plenty of amenities including a running track, baseball field, basketball court, bike/running path, playgrounds and gardens. The building is between two local community gardens.  We have some of the highest rated restaurants in the city and are located near prime shopping locations such as Soho, Nolita, and Union Square. It's also very easy to get to all of New York's tourist attractions one could hope to visit. The Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building, Wall St, all of our Mu
notes: Keywords: clean, sunlight, tree lined, east village, wifi, hardwood floors, yoga, kitchen, bath, air conditioning, bright, shopping, restaurants, cafe, bars, gardens
transit: We're minutes to many subways and steps away from buses that go all over the city. Nearby buses: M8, M9, M14A, M14D, M15, M21 Nearby subway: 4, 5, 6, F, L, N, R
interaction: We will be in touch as much as needed up to the day you arrive to organize key exchange, directions, etc. If we don't end up meeting you on arrival day, we will be in touch to coordinate.   During your stay, you can always reach me by email, SMS, and phone. I am happy to answer any questions about the apartment and make suggestions for great places to eat, drink, and hear local music.
house_rules: We love our apartment and travel frequently and want to give people a chance to enjoy New York, our beautiful space, and treat it like their home. Just leave it as you found it and give us any tips on how to make our home even better for people to have a great time in New York. If you could kindly water the plants to keep them green and alive it would be greatly appreciated.  They are succulents and do not require a lot of attention. - No street shoes in the apartment. - Cooking is fine and encouraged, but please keep things tidy and wash all your dishes. - Please strip the bed linens and put the towels in a corner on the floor - Please take out the trash and recycling when leaving  Regarding check in & check out times - for days I have same day turnover, the check in/out time is fairly strict so it allows time for us to clean the apartment and get it ready for the next guest.  However, we try to accommodate all, so please email with any questions.

neighborhood_overview: Washington Heights is a quiet, residential community with an ethnic, urban feel. There is free parking on the street, and a parking garage just 4 blocks north of us. We are close to several amazing parks, including Fort Tryon Park, the Cloisters, Riverside Park, Hudson River, and 15 minutes to Central Park. We are just 2 blocks from Columbia Presbyterian Hospital, home of Columbia Med, and love welcoming doctors and medical students, as well as patients and loved ones. We are just blocks away from grocery stores (Gristedes, Fine Fare), liquor store (Columbia Wine), restaurants and cafes, fast food, and the 1/A/C train subway station.
notes: Our apartment is blessed with TWO full baths, so to clarify, our guests enjoy a private bathroom all to themselves. With the beautiful private bedroom, kitchen, living room and bar on top of that, this is a great deal to stay so close to the heart of Manhattan.  All guest have their individual needs, please let us know how we can meet yours.
transit: Our home is 1 Block from the 168th St  A, C, and 1 train station.  These lines can take you to most of the most popular spots in the city, including Times Square/Theatre District (4 subway stops, 20 minutes), Central Park/Lincoln Center/Natural History Museum/Bethesda Fountain/Strawberry Fields/Dakota Building (3 stops, 15 minutes) Harlem/Apollo Theatre/Columbia University Campus (2 stops, 10 minutes), Penn Station/Empire State Building/Chelsea (25 minutes), Greenwich Village/NYU (30 minutes), and the Freedom Tower/September 11th Memorial and Museum. Also easy access to all NYC airports. If you prefer to arrange a cab service for your stay, we are happy to assist you, and of course, give you directions and tips to go anywhere!
interaction: Maureen and Becca are performing artists!!  We are often in and out of the Apartment, but will help with directions, attractions, etc.  Love music of all styles, just not between the hours of 10pm-8am!  Very easy going, and clean.  We ask all guests to be considerate and respectful of our home.  And of course, enjoy our space and city!  Contact us with any further questions.  We don't bite!!  If you have parties of more than 2, please inquire. Arrangements can be made.
house_rules: Please lock the front door.  Please no smoking, drugs, Hookah, loud music or unannounced guests.  We love having guests in our home, especially families, who are in NYC for sight seeing, school events or work.  But If you plan to experience the NYC night life (aka party), please choose another listing.

neighborhood_overview: Chelsea is a unique neighborhood filled with many restaurants, bars, coffee shops, and galleries (see the map for recommended ones). Chelsea is on the border of the trendy Meatpacking District and West Village neighborhoods, the Flatiron district, and the shopping-filled Herald Square. The neighborhood is also a convenient walk, bike or subway ride, or taxi trip to Times Square, Brooklyn, Museum Mile and more - just ask for recommendations!
notes: I'm an avid traveler and Airbnb lover. I've designed this studio to have all the essentials you need. I have plenty of suggestions for things to do nearby - just ask me!
transit: 3 minute walk from the C/E and 1 trains. 5-8 minute walk to the L, A, 2/3 trains. 15 minute walk or 5 minute taxi ride to Penn Station. There are also many bus stops and Citibike stations nearby.
interaction: We're available to answer questions you have and give recommendations in the neighborhood or elsewhere (Brooklyn, Lower East Side, etc.).
house_rules: Guests are expected to respect the space as if it were their own and make sure all doors are firmly shut, ac/heat is turned off, dishes washed, and apartment is orderly upon exiting the building. No pets are allowed. No smoking, vaping or e-cigarettes of any kind are permitted.

neighborhood_overview: We are right in the center of Manhattan, yet our street is quiet and residential. You won't be kept up at night by the sounds of traffic, yet walk 5 minutes and you are in the city's biggest tourist attraction.  Our neighborhood has a huge array of bars and restaurants. You can get a bite to eat at anytime of the day or night. Almost every kind of cuisine is represented in a few block radius. We are also right by the Theatre District, and seeing a play or concert is very convenient. There are also 2 movie theaters nearby which play late night movies, independent films, and all the big blockbusters.  Not only does our neighborhood have it all, but its incredibly safe and close to almost all the tourist attractions.
transit: We are near Port Authority bus terminal (with buses from and to every major airport and nearby city), Penn Station (with trains to neighboring states, and Long Island), and almost every subway line (A,C,E,7,S,N,Q,R,1,2,3). It's a breeze to get into other Burroughs.
interaction: Me or my husband will let you into the apartment, give you the keys and help you settle in. We will be around to give suggestions and direct you or be completely out of your way! Your choice. You will have my personal phone number and I will be available in case you need any help.
house_rules: Please be mindful of noise. No smoking or hosting.

And if you're feeling adventurous you can rent a citi bike on the block. Thanks for taking a look!

neighborhood_overview: Harlem is very diverse area in Upper Manhattan with a rich cultural history. My building is located right between the Sugar Hill, Hamilton Heights, and Central Harlem districts. With lots of students, artists, musicians, actors, dancers, community activists, young professionals, families, and seniors, Harlem has a very lively atmosphere. With plenty of foot traffic, the neighborhood is quite safe (a police station is at the corner). Plenty of cafes, bars, parks, restaurants, shops, churches, and small businesses abound. People are always out and about walking their dogs, coming home from or going to work, or going out for a fun time. The proximity to Midtown and Lower Manhattan is great. The subway will take you to Times Square in under 20 minutes and downtown in under 30. Coming home late at night is not an issue at all, even on the weekends. Cabs will always bring you if you don't feel comfortable taking the subways after a few drinks.
notes: There is a laundry room in the basement of the building. We recycle. Oreo is usually very quiet, but sometimes he can bark. We have extra towels, pillows, blankets and umbrellas. You are free to spend as much time in the home as you like watching TV or reading books.
transit: Down the block are 4 major subway lines that will whisk you to Columbus Circle/Midtown is under 15 minutes, the West Village in 30, and the Financial District in 40.
interaction: We work full time during the day and will completely respect your privacy. Always open to chat and offer tips on conquering the city. In the evenings during the week we spend a lot of our time next door cooking and watching TV with the dog so you will have plenty of privacy. Weekends we tend to relax a bit in the living room and read or go to the park with Oreo.
house_rules: Please don't bring back any strangers to the apartment. If you have a friend you'd like to invite over for a bit, please ask first. LGBTQ and dog friendly are nice. Please take your shoes off when entering the apartment. Please ask about recycling, laundry, storage, and anything else you may be curious about. Don't let the front door slam. It is very heavy and loud. Please do not smoke in the apartment. If you are the only one in the apartment when you leave, please make sure the lights, fans, and air conditioner are turned off.

neighborhood_overview: My Harlem neighborhood is a lively area filled with much pedestrian traffic from transient students, to older neighborhood locals, young families, and the everyday New Yorker. Restaurants are lined-up along the streets featuring many types of cuisines and price ranges for dining or delivery. There are also a lot of bars, coffee shops, small businesses, local stores, and grocery markets. Three parks located west (Morningside Park), east (Marcus Garvey Park) and south (North Central Park) are within walking distance. Many religious venues in the area that offer prayer services and mass. Columbia University is a few blocks west and City University of New York is two subway stops north. Major shopping area located on 125th Street is within walking distance, featuring major retailers such as Old Navy, DSW, H&M, Whole Foods, and Marshalls to name a few. Other destinations located in midtowne or downtown are easily accessible by subway and bus. Get a better idea of tourist attractions by chec
notes: 1) Cooking: For stays less than two weeks, the gas is turned off to prevent any leaks. The stove is older, so the ignition flame is always causing more carbon monoxide emissions than usual. There is still a fully-operational kitchen with basic cooking needs. Please inform me in advance if cooking is essential for your stay. The stove is very safe, but needs to be monitored when the gas is turned on. When cooking, both the stove top range AND oven pilot lights must be ignited because the gas is running. Since I am gone often for work and rarely buy groceries, Delivery and Seamless are great mobile apps for ordering meals. Also, Frederick Douglas Boulevard and its surrounding streets are street-lined with many different restaurants. 2) Fall/Winter: Heating is controlled by the building and CAN NOT be adjusted. According to state law, heat must remain on while outside temperature reaches a specified degree. 3) Summer: Located on the top floor of the building, the apartment can get very ho
transit: Apt is one block north of local subway stop (B & C trains), and eight blocks away from express subway stop (A & D) at 125th. Near several bus lines, as well as walking distance to 1, 2 & 3 subway stops which are west and east of Frederick Douglass. Easily accessible to Amtrak, New Jersey Transit, and Long Island Railroad stations located at 34th Street NY Penn Station, as well as Port Authority in Times Square.  John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK), Newark Liberty International Airport (EWR), and LaGuardia Airport (LGA) are all within one to two hours away, depending on the mode of transportation used.
interaction: I will meet guest(s) at the apartment for key exchange. If my work schedule does not permit meeting at time of arrival or departure, other arrangements will be made in advance.
house_rules: Please make sure to: 1. Keep noise level down because it is a local neighborhood with quiet tenants, so no loud music or large parties; 2. Smoke only outside the building; 3. Wash any housewares used. Cleaning items are available in the kitchen and extra items are stocked under the kitchen sink; 4. Empty trash bins. Trash bins are located at 117th side of building in black closed-off containers. Recyclables are also separated with mixed papers and other recyclable items.

neighborhood_overview: I love this neighborhood and to prove my point I have lived here since the 70s. It's the REAL DEAL. Only two New York avenues to the Broadway Theater District and the Broadway theaters.  The well groomed parks and piers of the HUDSON RIVER are only 2 1/2 avenues away - walking distance.  There you will find the Circle Line boats which offer many trips including a full circle tour around the island of Manhattan.  Also at the pier is the Intrepid Museum, an original American Navy aircraft carrier taken out of service, with all kinds of exhibits.  There is a walking and biking pathway along the Hudson River (with no cars) going from Midtown all the way to Battery Park in Lower Manhattan as well as going uptown to Riverside Drive, the boat basin, and other attractions along the river.  There are also restaurants on some of the piers and one outdoor restaurant only a few blocks from my apartment where you can watch the sunset over the Hudson River. If you like to walk and I do the following
notes: I have been extremely happy here since 1976.  It's location, location, location.  And before booking please understand this is not a hotel.  It's my home where  I live.  It's an old building with high ceilings and thick walls.  It's a one flight walk-up (no elevator).  It is not a luxury building but a safe, clean, and comfortable building in a fabulous location.   I do not provide breakfast but I do provide complimentary wine.     No excessive cooking. But I also would like to emphasize that I have a microwave for heating things up and microwave safe dishes. A small pot for boiling eggs, etc.  A toaster that can toast regular bread as well as bagels. A full size refrigerator with a freezer compartment. I also have a coffee maker and coffee filters.   I live in an area that has so many restaurants it's quite unbelievable and some are open 24 hours a day so that's why I say no excessive cooking in the apartment. There's also a market a block and a half away that has just about every foo
transit: It's walking distance to many subways including the A, C, E, 1, 2, N, R.  Also buses.  It's 6 blocks away from The Port Authority (bus station), about 15 blocks from Penn Station (train station), and a little further to Grand Central (train station).  There are shuttles from all 3 airports to Port Authority and also public transportation (buses and subways) that come directly to midtown Manhattan. Parking is difficult in this neighborhood so coming with a car would require finding a parking lot.   PLEASE NOTE I DO NOT PROVIDE TRANSFERS FROM THE AIRPORTS BECAUSE I DO NOT HAVE A CAR HERE IS INFO ON DIFFERENT WAYS TO GET TO AND FROM AIRPORTS. NYC Airporter Bus to and from JFK and LaGuardia to and from Port Authority Bus Terminal (6 blocks from my apartment) Since I am not allowed to put phone numbers or websites on this description, I suggest googling to get the information. From LaGuardia via public transportation Take the  Q70 Limited or Q47 buses.  Connect to the E train on the New Yor
interaction: You control the amount of interaction with us that you are comfortable with.  I have  a broad knowledge of New York City acquired from living here since the artist loving 50's.  I'm a working actor and playwright and know a lot about the theater scene especially Off-Broadway and Off-Off Broadway. And my co-host is also a working actor. I do have to enter the Annex occasionally because a lot of my costumes and props are in there but I will never invade your privacy.  I will always call or text or email if I have to enter. Thank you for your understanding on this. We would like for you to come to us with any problems or requests and we will do our best to meet them with solutions.  If I'm out, you can text or call me or my co-host  24/7.  Likewise, we will give you feedback if anything seems to be misunderstood.  This gives both guest and host the opportunity to work things out instead of negative reviews posted on line which can only be detrimental to both parties.  I also ask that you
house_rules: No smoking. Maximum number of guests is 4.   There are 2 double beds appropriate for one to 4 people.  If there are only 2 people the second Murphy bed converts to a beautiful table. Even though the Annex has a full kitchen I don't allow excessive cooking.  Boiling water for tea is fine.   And there is a microwave for heating up take-out food. Why cook when I live in a neighborhood with hundreds of amazing restaurants and an excellent market 1 1/2 blocks away. Guests may come and go as they please at any time of day or night as I live in a 24 hour a day busy neighborhood. Trash cans for trash are located outside the building.  Trash cans inside the building in the front hallway are for recycling - one for mixed paper and one for plastic. Only toilet paper in the toilet.  Everything else in the waste basket.  Thank you.

neighborhood_overview: We're in the heart of Harlem and the rich cultural history is reflected everywhere: Elegant Brownstone blocks, churches that rock with gospel singing on Sunday morning, restaurants up and down Lenox Avenue such as the top-rated southern-cuisine Sylvia’s or Red Rooster, and down at the corner of 120th fine dining aficionados enjoy sidewalk seating at Settepani and Barawine. Some must-see attractions include art museum The Studio Museum of Harlem and legendary live performance space The Apollo theater. My favorite café, where I'm a weekend regular, is Lenox Coffee at 129th, but there's also a great breakfast café a half block away on Lenox. Marcus Garvey Park is across the street, and if you're keen there's a swimming pool in the recreation center. Shopping is plentiful along 125th St. and you don't have to walk far to find Old Navy, Marshall's, or H&M. Whole Foods is opening its newest Manhattan store on the corner of 125th and Lenox, but my favorite grocery store is still Wild Olive Ma
notes: I want to assure anyone new to New York City that Harlem is a safe and friendly place. Our lovely, pre-war building is newly renovated, brightly lit and inhabited and cared for by friendly and responsible residents. Most of the residents, like myself, own their apartments. The building, like the neighborhood, is safe. Still, we should be careful not to leave the downstairs front door open, and not to let people we don't know into the building.
transit: We are close to express trains that can get you to Times Square in 10 minutes and Greenwich Village in 20. On Lenox Ave. the 2,3 trains at 125th or 116th will take you up and down the West side of Manhattan. There are crosstown buses at 125th or 116th and one on 125th that goes to La Guardia airport. My favorite bus on weekends stops right across the street and goes all the way down Central Park on 5th Ave. to the East Village. Hop on and off for your visits along Museum Mile, or stroll into the beautiful Central Park. I like to walk to the Park (only 10 minutes), make my way for a visit to the Metropolitan Museum, then continue my stroll across the Park for lunch on the upper West Side. When I'm ready to head home I hop on the 7 bus at 85th and Amsterdam Ave. The bus lets me off at the corner of Lenox and 120th and I'm home!
interaction: As a teacher, I go bed early and leave early in the morning, so chances are I will hardly see you. But I hope you'll communicate with me via text or email if you need to.  I am gone for long weekends and academic vacations, and rarely have visitors. I request that you not invite friends over to the apartment unless you've checked in with me first and I'm ok with it. Thank you!

neighborhood_overview: Harlem is a vibrant neighborhood with great music, delicious food, and convenient shopping. We have several jazz clubs all around us, including one on our block, and a few just around the corner. Great food is represented by restaurants like Red Rooster, with its celebrity chef Marcus Samuelsson, Soul Food destinations like Sylvia's and Amy Ruth's, and many others. Stores nearby include H & M, Bed, Bath & Beyond, Marshall's, Whole Foods, and many others. Parks abound, with Central Park just over a mile away, and Morningside Park and St. Nicholas Park just blocks away.
notes: We are a multi-ethnic, multi-lingual family who love to travel and explore every bit of our surroundings; besides English, we are comfortable with Lithuanian, Chinese (Mandarin, some Fukienese and Cantonese), and some Malay. Our home is a safe space for all people.
transit: We have access to buses just steps away from the house, and two subway lines (2/3) a block way, and two more (B/C) just a few minutes further. Taxis and Limos pass by frequently and are easily hailed.
interaction: We can interact as little or as much as you would like. We love meeting new people, and would be happy to introduce you to things to see and do in the neighborhood and in NYC, but we do respect your desire for privacy.
house_rules: - No shoes in apartment. - Smoking allowed in patio and garden.   Common sense and courtesy.     Clean up after yourself and let us know if we can help with anything.     No parties or events.     Please take off your shoes inside the apartment. It helps to keep it clean.     We have a very friendly (and hypoallergenic) 'golden doodle' (cross of a golden  retriever and a poodle) and 2 polite cats. They will love it if you show affection to them,  but if you are neutral to pets, they will be happy to keep their distance.     Because some of us are slightly allergic to pet hair, our home  has only wooden floors and leather and wood furniture and is relatively allergen-free.

There is countless restaurants, plenty of bars and grocery stores all within walking distance. There's a laundromat less than a block away and two trains within walking distance. The natural museum of history is a couple stops away and central park is only one block down the street.
notes: This is a place for travelers who don't care about share the spaces with the others.

I love having  people at my place and trading our cultures. if we have time free if that comes go out and spend a really good time together, introducing with some of my friends if that would be necessary. neighborhood_overview: Residential neighborhood with many excellent restaurants.
notes: The New York State Multiple Dwelling Law (MDL) establishes the standards for all buildings containing three or more dwelling units. The MDL flatly prohibits unhosted rentals of less than 30 days in “Class A” multiple dwellings—building occupied by three or more families living independently.  The MDL does not prohibit short-term rentals, whether hosted or not, in “private dwellings”—one-and two-family homes. Rest assured, our property is a private dwelling.
transit: NYC subway and buses are the best way to get around.   It is usually possible find street parking however alternate side street-cleaning rules are in effect during the week.
interaction: We live in the apartment upstairs. Available anytime by phone, text (preferred) or email.

neighborhood_overview: Harlem - Morningside Heights, this is the heart of the Gentrification/Revitalization of Harlem. Everything you know of Harlem is right around the corner. The Apollo, Columbia University, Magic Johnson Theater, Cotton Club, Grants Tomb, National Jazz Museum, the famous Red Rooster restaurant which is one of the favor restaurants of Obama, the chef Marcus Samuelson has been invited to White House to make national Gala dinner for many time, and the list goes on.  To make it even better, the area is bursting at the seems with new restaurants, markets, coffee shops, wine stores etc, most of them are in walking distance. The area is very safe to walk around, we worked around in the middle of night and always enjoyed the safe and charming neighborhood.  You can walk to Columbia where you will find a bustling campus and more places to eat and check out. That is also where you find the "Seinfeld Diner" and yes, it is open so you can go in and check it out. We are also a couple of blocks away fr
notes: We are an international couple and love to travel. We traveled all over the world and brought back multicultural memories back to home, you definitely will taste the different flavors during your staying. We have friends and family come to visit and stay with us. So we set up this room to welcome our guests to stay with us, and also give them their private space to enjoy themselves. We joined Airbnb was because we love the culture of it, we also like to share our passion for multicultural with our guests. There is a note book on the desk for you to write down your thoughts of your stay. Hope to see you soon and look forward to having you back to visit us again.
transit: Walking the neighborhood gets you to shopping, eating and Columbia University. Three blocks uptown (that means the short end of the block) is the Subway. This is the 125th St Station. You can get the A Express-  one stop and 6 minutes to 59th st Time Warner Center and Lincoln Center and then heading all the way to JFK Airport. The D Express one stop - 6 Minutes to Time Warner or Lincoln Center and then 4 Minutes to Rockefeller Center. Then there are the B and C Locals, They go down Central Park West and stop at every station including the Museum of Natural Art and 72nd St best know for the Dakota Building, plus this is the heart of the upper west side. All Trains continue down the island stopping at Times Square, SOHO, China Town and eventually battery Park. bottom line is this is a great location to live in the city.  There is also free parking on the street, we do observe alternate side parking rules but if you time it right and get the good side as I usually do, you can leave your c
interaction: We only interact if there is a reason to or you need something. Once we give you the key you can come and go on your schedule. You are welcome to ask in person or call us if you have any questions or you need tips on the city, etc.
house_rules: Generally what you would expect in any house. Be respectful of noise and what time it is.  Keep the outside doors  locked at all times Do not block the hallways Turn off appliances, AC, Lights etc when not in use. No Smoking and No Pets and no parties. NOTE: if you are staying more than a week or are making a reservation for an extended stay there may be additional cleaning charges depending on the length of stay and services needed.

neighborhood_overview: The West Village is one of the most beautiful neighborhoods not only in New York City, but anywhere. It is legendary, a national landmark. It is at once historic and always brand-new, re-inventing itself constantly. The architecture, the people, the shopping, the bars and restaurants, all seem to conspire to seduce you and make you fall in love with this area. It is magical.
notes: The Waverly Inn and The Village Vanguard, two classic, long-standing nightlife traditions, are a few steps in either direction from the front door. Some of the best and most famous dining and entertainment in the City are within blocks.
transit: All West Side subways (1, 2, 3, A, C, E, and L trains, 14th St. station) and busses are within a few steps, a block away. Seventh Avenue is a also a few steps away, with a constant flow of taxis available. The Village is one of the best neighborhoods in the City for walking. And, of course, there's always the Über and Lyft apps with cars always minutes away. So, it's easy to get around from here.
interaction: I will be present during your stay, but will be as discreet as possible, to afford you all the privacy you desire.
house_rules: Welcome! I like to maintain a sense of relaxed livability and mutual respect for space and privacy. This apartment is a refuge of security and solace from the amazing 24-hour city outside its doors. You will find it to be uniquely peaceful and comfortable. I'm a non-smoker. But, as my guest, smoking is allowed at open kitchen window or, preferably, outside. Thank you so much for your inquiry and consideration.

neighborhood_overview: Townhouse 436 is located in Harlem, New York City, between Amsterdam Avenue and Jumel Terrace, and is within walking distance to Columbia Presbyterian Hospital, Columbia university, museums, arts venues, supermarkets, restaurants on Lenox Avenue, parks, book stores, retail and the Yankee Stadium.  This neighborhood rich in history -- this is where George Washington, Paul Robeson, Duke Ellington, Thurgood Marshall, Count Basie, Gershwin and Joe Lewis once called home. Today,  the literature, art and music scene is still very much alive and tremendously vibrant.  Townhouse 436 is around the corner from the Jumel Mansion, which is the oldest house in New York City!
notes: Townhouse 436  having had only four owners and  has been painstakingly cared for, and the scene for movies, documentaries, and tour highlights. Treat yourself here!
transit: Travel to mid and lower Manhattan from Townhouse 436 via C train at 161-163 rd street  which is right on our corner, or A train on 168th street (express - Times square in 15 min ride!) or the number 1 trains at 168th street. The trains are easily accessible and fast! Car service is also available.  Walking is also fun!
interaction: We will interact with guests if they would like us to be more involved with helping to get around New York or have any questions…we aim to be helpful. However, we will also completely respect a guest's privacy and independence.
house_rules: Please no smoking inside , or pets. Prior notification of any guests not on the reservation which can be charged extra.  Extra cleaning fee is at renters expense.

neighborhood_overview: Surrounded by many great Italian, Greek, Turkish, Japanese, Mexican, Thai Restaurants & American Dinners.  Bars and pubs, 24 hour stores and Open-Late restaurants.   Heart of the City, Center of Hell's Kitchen, and true origins of Midtown culture.
notes: If you wish to book for three people, please contact me to properly accommodate. Please read the description, and discuss with me before booking. I invite all to read the reviews posted about me and this accommodation, and I welcome all guests to my location! Feel free to ask any questions. I am a Med-Student and I work part-time, so I have to see if I can confirm the dates.
transit: All major subways A/C/E, R/Q/N, 1/2/3, 7, S - 6/5/4 trains only blocks away!  Many buses that can take you around town.  Port Authority only few blocks away. The best way to get to know New York is walking, and I am a strong advocate of this. Much of the main attractions are within walking distance. When walking can be too much, or the weather isn't at its best, the train (metro) is the next best option.
interaction: We are more than happy to give any recommendations, suggestions, and tips when it comes to sightseeings in New York, or with help finding a true New York experience.  Also whenever guests are in need of certain assistances, we are more than ready to help.
house_rules: No Smoking!!! Social Drinkers Only. No Guests. Please be Clean. No Recreational Drugs!

neighborhood_overview: We live in the Gramercy/Flatiron area of Manhattan. It is a lovely mix of quiet residential streets, delicious food options (Eataly, Curry Hill, and the swanky NoMad restaurants), and shopping. Happily for us, it is much less crowded than Midtown or the Village. We are just blocks from Gramercy Park, Madison Square Park, the East River Promenade, and the Flat Iron Building. We are also very close to the East Village, Union Square and Chelsea, for more fun places to explore.
notes: As a born-and-raised New Yorker, I have lots of advice on how to get the most out of the City. And as members of New York's thriving entertainment industry, we can offer lots of pointers and discounts to catch the best shows in town!
transit: Public transportation from our apartment couldn't be easier. We are three blocks from the 6 Train on Park Avenue (8-minute walk) and five blocks from the N/R on Broadway (10-minute walk). 23rd Street is a major crosstown street with a bus running across and a bus stop just outside the building.
interaction: A new NYC law requires us to be present for the duration of your stay with us - please contact us for more information! Either my husband or myself is always available for any questions or concerns that come up during your stay.
house_rules: There is plenty of storage for you on shelves in the loft and a closet below the loft. We ask that the closets in the hallway be reserved and locked for our own personal items. You are welcome to use the kitchen freely.  Please do not discuss Airbnb with building employees or neighbors. I’m happy to discuss this detail with you.

neighborhood_overview: So many great Restaurants, Comedy Clubs, Jazz bars and various types of Entertainment all at your fingertips. 24 Hour grocery store right around the corner. The neighborhood is amazing as it has a great energy and is in the heart of Greenwich Village and walking distance to so many great places! You are just a 1/2 block walk to Washington Square Park!
notes: There is a kitchen that has everything you need to make a gourmet meal if you choose to cook. There is also a hair dryer, iron and ironing board available. There are 2 closets and a dresser to store your clothing.
transit: Walking distance to East Village, West Village, Soho and great shopping and restaurants. Just 3 small streets to the West 4th Street Subway
interaction: I have lived in NYC all my life and can make recommendation for attractions and great restaurants. I have a list for you with great places( restaurants, bars, jazz clubs etc. right in the neighborhood and also throughout NYC.)
house_rules: No smoking allowed in apartment. Also, please do not wear your shoes in the apartment. There is a bench when you walk in to take off and on your shoes.

neighborhood_overview: I love the interactions with people in this neighborhood. Central Park is just on the corner, and the area has more of a neighborhood feel as opposed to being busy, and impersonal. Welcome to New York! Expect some sirens, and bit of outside noise. Central Park is only a 15 second walk, and there are people from all over the world living in this neighborhood. Don't be surprised if encounter, French, German, Spanish, Russian, and Italian speaking people all in the course of a few seconds.
notes: European Blow Dryers for the hair will not work with voltage in the States.  I offer my guests a safe and loving space to feel comfortable. Check out is at 11AM.  Make sure you have everything before you leave the apartment.  Place any items that you do not want such as paper or food into the garbage. Unfortunately I can not hold your luggage when you check out and you want to return to pick it up again. I will not be available for you to re-enter to get your things. I do highly recommend leaving your luggage at a luggage storage facility such as CBH Luggage Storage which only charges $2-$10 USD for your luggage and is conveniently located near Times Square. CBH Luggage Storage, 43 W. 46th. They are open from 7am- 12am. I also recommend Vertoe luggage storage service. Depending on where you are you can easily find a luggage storage location. Here is the link (Website hidden by Airbnb)  Another service I recommend is Bounce luggage storage. (Website hidden by Airbnb)    Other places I h
transit: 2, 3 trains (7 minutes by foot) and 6 trains (7 minutes by foot) M1, M2, M3, M4 buses on Fifth and Madison Avenues. There is ample parking for vehicles just around the neighborhood. If you are arriving from JFK, take the Airtrain to Sutphin Boulevard/Archer Avenue. Transfer to the E Train and take the E train to Lexington Av/53. Walk to 51 St (about 3 mins) and take the uptown 6 train to 110th Street. My place is then about a 7 to 8 minute walk. If you are arriving from LaGuardia Airport, take the M60 bus to 125th Street and Lexington Avenue. From there you can take the downtown 6 train to 110th Street Station. If you are arriving from Newark Airport, board the Air Train in Newark and go towards Newark Liberty international airport. Get out from the station and walk to Newark airport railroad station. take the New Jersey coastline towards New York Penn Station. Get out from the train, and walk over and take the "UPTOWN 'number 2, or 3 express train to Central Park North 110th Street.
interaction: It depends on the date, time and interest of the guest. I've gone with guests to restaurants, bars and also entertained guests in the Moroccan living room complete with music, friends and food.
house_rules: Cleanliness is very much appreciated! I am happy to share my living room, kitchen, and bathroom with all my wonderful guests. All I ask is that you respect my home by keeping it clean. *BEDROOM* Please do not keep open food, dirty cups and plates in the sleeping area. Please pick up extra clothing, paper and garbage from the floor of your room.  Kindly keep personal towels in bedroom, not in the bathroom, and do not leave wet towels or clothing on the furniture or floor. Hang your towels on the back of the bedroom door. Do not hang clothing on, or in front of the window in your room. There are hangers in the closet. *BATHROOM* Please make sure to remove any hair from drain after showering. Feminine products should be wrapped in tissue and placed in the garbage to the left of the toilet; not flushed down the toilet. Please clean the bathroom sink if you do indeed expel phlegm or mucous from the throat. *Do not place anything on top of automatic toilet lid, it will damage the mechanism.

neighborhood_overview: Harlem has an ever-growing collection of bars, restaurants and shops. Our apartment is located on 126th street, one block from Lenox Avenue and its Red Rooster, Corner Social, Sylvia's. Bread and pastries are at Lenox Sapphire on 127th street. Grocery store is on 129th street.
transit: The 2 and 3 trains are one block away, Times Square, MoMa are at less than 20 minutes. Central Park is one mile away!
interaction: Since we live upstairs, we remain available for any advices or recommendations.
house_rules: This is a strictly smoke free apartment.

neighborhood_overview: Our home is located right in the middle of a Historical Harlem Landmark district, conveniently situated next to amazing restaurants, bars, attractions, and landmarks.  We thoroughly enjoy living in Harlem due to the neighborhood culture, space, and access to the rest of Manhattan.  All that NYC has to offer is a quick walk, train, or bus ride away.  Please see our guidebook for a ton of recommendations in Harlem & all of NYC! ~Necessities~ There is a grocery store & drug store 4 blocks away, about a 3-4 minute walk.  If you are looking to clean clothes, there is laundry mat is 2 blocks away. There are 2 convenience stores each located about a 1 minute walk away.  Two more convenience stores are located within 2 minutes of the house. ~Getting out into the Neighborhood~  NYC is a great city to walk around and explore.  That being said, there is much to see and experience!  We strongly encourage you to utilize the trains and buses as a way to explore NYC in addition to walking.  As we kno

Our house provides extremely convenient access to public transportation due to its central Harlem location.  Subway/Metro Details: 2/3 Trains: 3-5 minute walk away 4/5/6 Trains: 10-15 minute walk away A/B/C/D Trains: 10-15 minute walk away Bus Details: M1/2 Buses: 3-5 minute walk away (These buses can take you to the Guggenheim, Metropolitan Museum, and MOMA) M7/102 Buses: 1-2 minute walk away M116 Bus: 3-5 minute walk away  JFK - John F. Kennedy International Airport By Train:   Take the AirTrain to the A/E Train to the 2/3 Train (Least expensive)        or Take the AirTrain to the LIRR to the 2/3 Train (Moderate cost) By Car:       Airport Shuttle service like Super Shuttle (Moderate cost)       Taxi Drive from JFK -  flat fare of $52 plus tolls & tip (most expensive) LGA - LaGuardia Airport By Bus:      SelectM60 Bus Service from LGA for $2.75 By Car:        A cab will cost around $35 + tip EW
interaction: The bathroom and kitchen are shared with Atlantis who aims to keep the space as clean as possible. Other than that there is little interaction with Atlantis as she is often on the go.  Carmen lives on the 2nd floor which is the floor below where you will be staying.  Both Atlantis and Carmen are available at any time for help with directions, travel suggestions, or questions/concerns. Carmen speaks fluent Spanish and can understand some Italian, French, & German  Axel (The Dad of the house) speaks fluent German  Atlantis speaks English and can understand Spanish and German
house_rules: We have lived in our Harlem home for over 40 years and love meeting & welcoming people into our family home.  All we ask is that guests be considerate in following a few house rules so that we can keep a clean charming home. We try to keep our home peaceful in the midst of bustling NYC so we ask that you be mindful of your noise levels.    Please quietly close doors within the home as to avoid slamming noises.  Food & Cooking: Please do not eat food or keep food in the bedroom. There is a dining area in the kitchen as well as space to store food. Due to garbage disposal (so we avoid rodents) and food smells, please do not cook meat/fish in the kitchen past 8:30pm/20:30. You are still free to use the kitchen for anything else :) We appreciate you being mindful of us keeping a clean &  rodent free home.  Other: Please turn off lights when they are not being used.  We ask that you unplug flat irons and chargers/adaptors when leaving the house. We are an Eco-friendly house so we recycle an

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a safe and vibrant neighborhood on a block that is typical of the UWS charm you hear about so much in movies and books.  The architecture of the surrounding brownstones and Golden Age apartment buildings are a feast for the eyes.  A quick walk to Central Park and its West Side highlights like the Bethesda Fountain, Strawberry Fields, and Delacorte Theatre (Shakespeare in the Park), make this location ideal for travelers in search of respite in the busy city.  Ballet and opera lovers will find the five-minute (less, if you can walk like a New Yorker!) walk to Lincoln Center extremely appealing. Lincoln Center is also home to The Vivian Beaumont, a large Broadway theatre as well as the New York Philharmonic. On its campus is Fordham University and the Juilliard School, and Damrosch Park which hosts the Big Apple Circus and NY Fashion Week, among other events.  Outdoor cafes, restaurants and independently owned boutiques add to the UWS' charm. Centrally located, you ca
notes: This is a quiet residential building.  I ask that you respect my neighbors and their privacy while in the common areas.  Once inside the apartment you are free to make yourself at home. I have my apartment listed on trip advisor as well.  I have many references and reviews.  Please take a look.
transit: Taxis are easy to come by in NYC, especially in this neighborhood. On-Call car services such as Lyft, Uber, Gett, and Via, are available.  The apartment is accessible by Subway via the 1, 2, 3, A, C, E, B, and D lines.  Bus lines in the vicinity are: M (Phone number hidden by Airbnb)
interaction: I love NYC and want you to also.  I will make any arrangements you would like prior to your visit, I will greet you upon arrival personally and be available to you throughout your stay.
house_rules: No pets. No smoking inside the apartment but there is a huge outdoor area. No soliciting.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is filled with families who have been here for generations. There are  inexpensive bodegas that churn out the famous giant sandwiches New York is famous for 24 hours a day. And the pizza and bagels nearby? Fuggedaboutit! We are sandwiched between Central Park and Riverside Park, jam packed with outdoor activities and the best people watching in the world.
notes: There's a queen sized bed in one room, bunk beds in another, and a large couch which sets up as a single bed for extra guests.  Strong preference is given to families.
transit: There are a myriad of subway and bus services within a 3 minute walk of the apartment. Getting around is a breeze!
interaction: I am available at all times for questions or concerns at your convenience.
house_rules: Pets will be allowed on a case by case basis. Service animals are always welcome.  Please be respectful of the families that live here by keeping the noise level at a reasonable level during appropriate hours.

neighborhood_overview: Fantastic location! Centrally located in one of the best areas of the city. Just steps to Lincoln Square, where is the Opera, Ballet, Philharmonic, and Central Park. Walking distance to Time Square. Very convenient for transportation.
notes: Free WIFI and Cable
transit: Subway: 1, 2, 3, A,B,C,D. Crosstown bus to East Side. Excellent restaurants and Cafes in the area. Walking distance to Midtown.
interaction: You have the entire space for your self. You are not share it with other.  I am available any time by phone, text or e-mail for questions about the apartment and/or for things to do and places to see in Manhattan.

neighborhood_overview: Close to Central Park, Riverside Park, subway lines to Times Square (10 minute commute), famous restaurants, grocery stores and pretty much everything else you need. Tourists love to visit the Seinfeld Diner and Cathedral of St. John the Divine as well.
transit: You can walk 2 blocks to the subway, rent a bike right outside or grab a taxi right outside the apartment. Parking is all along the street. It can be a little tricky to find open spots so you might have to wait 3-5 minutes but someone will eventually move.
interaction: If you need to arrive during the morning, afternoon, or late evening just let me know. I can be flexible getting you checked in. I know some of you coming in on international flights have to arrive at awkward times.
house_rules: I'd prefer to have non-smokers. I've had a couple guests who kindly smoked outside but it carries into the apartment and sticks to the room for a couple days. Sorry folks! These NYC apartments are too small for stinky.

neighborhood_overview: The location is at the nexus of 4 great neighborhoods: Little Italy, Soho, Nolita, and Chinatown. There is no end to the great restaurants and history in the neighborhood.  Some of my favorite places within just a couple blocks:  -McNally Jackson's Bookstore - fantastic and hip independent bookseller with nearly nightly author events and small cafe to browse and drink coffee.  -Randolph Beer on Broome- for the after work brew.  -The Mulberry Project- hidden basement speakeasy with secret patio.  -Aux Epices (Malaysian-French Cuisine)  -Epistrophy (Italian food- live Jazz on Sundays)  -Great coffee shops: Happy Bones, Two Hands, Saturday's Surf.
notes: To Note:  -The room can really accommodate only one traveler unless an exception is needed.  -The bed is a standard twin bed and is ideal for one person.
transit: Convenient to nearly every subway line!  2 minutes walk to Spring Street 6 Line. Less than 5 minutes to B,D, N,Q,R, J,Z.  10 minutes walk to 1,2,3, A,C,E, F,M. But with all the options around here, it's tough to leave...
interaction: I tend to work long hours, so most of the time as a guest you have the space to yourself and I encourage you to make yourself at home.      I do like sharing the occasional meal/ drink in the evenings and love to hear stories from fellow travelers.
house_rules: Pet-free (building rules unfortunately) and no smoking, please.

neighborhood_overview: The East Village and Lower East Side neighborhoods never fails to keep the excitement going long after other neighborhoods hit the pillow. Join the foodies, dive bar enthusiasts, and vintage-hunters to the east end of Manhattan, where head-turning street style is the norm. Are you considered too avant-garde at home?  In the East Village you will fit right in and be celebrated.   THE NEIGHBORS An eclectic mix of NYC newcomers and long-time residents. This is an racially and economically mixed area.  The african-american finance guy shares his morning with a puerto rican feminist artist at the hip spot that is owned by a jewish lesbian couple.  WHAT TO EXPECT A lively neighborhood with an adventurous spirit that defines downtown living. Bargain shopping is still possible here with our many vintage and consignment stores.  There is also a plethora of innovative designers with shops in the area.   Young chefs are providing innovative foodie experiences and the cocktail is an art form next
notes: 1. I request that the primary booking guest have their gov ID verified by Airbnb by the time of their stay. If it is not verified, I may request to see your ID at check-in and make a copy in case of an emergency. 2. There is construction in the lot next to my building.  It has been relatively quiet but I cannot promise they will not startup again.  When active, they normally work from 8AM-4PM. I do work from home and I have not found it disruptive at all. 3. If staying out all night and sleeping to mid-afternoon every day is your idea of a great vacation, I may not be the best choice of places to stay. I work from home and will not guarantee I can remain quiet past 10AM ever day, including the weekend. If it happens once, it is not a problem. 4. The Building is a walk-up and there are 2 flights of stairs to my apartment. You need to be able to carry your luggage yourself.
transit: I am only 1.5 short blocks from the F subway line.  There are many more options about 4 to 5 blocks away such as the B, D, J, M, Z,4,5,6,.  Also the M15 stops on my corner, which is a great bus to bring you right to the ferry for the Statue of Liberty. On the other corner is the M14A which can take you across 14th street to the Chelsea food Market and the Highline Park. There are also other bus options close by. I always recommend my quests use the MTA Tripplanner app while in New York. The NYC Bus and Subway system is a very complicated system that no one, not even a native New Yorker has all the schedules memorized. It has the most up to date scheduling and can give the most accurate directions between 2 points.  Best of all, you do not even need to know where you are starting from, it will use GPS to get your starting point. This is a handy feature when you are lost! If you prefer traveling by car, I would use Uber and Lyft.  I prefer the Lyft share ride service as it tends to be ch
interaction: I am happy to give you all the guidance you want. I am a native New Yorker and have surprised myself since I started hosting with how much I know about New York City. I can suggest some activities and places to see that are off the beaten path and I can definitely tell you where to shop! I know what museums are free and how to see the Statue of Liberty up close for free. I probably won't be giving you a personal walking tour but I can get you set-up for a great one to take on your own. If you would prefer minimal interaction, just let me know.  I am home a lot but I am very good at just "being" in my own personal space.
house_rules: Did you know it is a requirement by Airbnb to READ and AGREE to the Host House Rules prior to a confirmed booking? I know, how demanding!  HELEN’S HOUSE RULES: 1. T!he Living Room/Kitchen access is limited between 8PM-8AM, if you need access to the refrigerator or water, you may enter but it is not the time to start cooking or watching a movie. Please knock and wait for permission before entering. 2. CHILDREN - Children are welcome to stay, they are usually fun guests  but I have a few rules for the parents. A - If you have a minor child(under 16 years old) with you, they can never be left alone in my apartment at any time without an adult present, no exceptions. I can be that adult but you must ask before leaving. B. You are the parent and are responsible for all discipline. Having said that, please refrain from any corporeal punishment while in home. 2. NOISE - Please be respectful of my neighbors and me, by keeping the noise volume low. All sound in the hallways echo much louder tha

neighborhood_overview: First, you couldn't be anymore centrally located with literally everything at your doorstep.  I also love the convenience the neighborhood offers. In the end staying here will save you money on taxi's and subways because you can walk to everything. Also, everything is open 24 hours a day.  Cant sleep because of jet lag?  Great, go get something to eat at 4 am!
notes: Also, some of my neighbors have begun to complain about the traffic in the building.  Therefore, if anyone in the building asks you anything you can tell them you are staying with me etc., just don't mention Airbnb specifically.  I want to keep that private. I am doing nothing wrong but I still want to avoid any attention in my direction. This is of note; many people who don't live in a congested city like New York think or feel that the apartment is small.  Although this is my dream apartment I totally get where this is coming from because I am from the suburbs of Ohio originally.  I think what makes the apartment seem small is that I am in what would be called the living room (keep in mind there is a door separating the space so it feels very private to me and for you too) but this lack of a living room makes the space feel 'tight'.  Ultimately, I don't think this matters because you are only here to sleep and shower (and maybe have a cup of tea or some fruit for breakfast).  Of cour
transit: The apartment is only a few minutes walk from all the sights of NYC: Times Square, Broadway and Theater District, Columbus Circle and Central park, Rockefeller Center, and near all major subway lines in the city (A, C, E, N, R, 1, 2, 3) and transportation hub (34th st Penn station LIRR NJTransit, Path, 42nd st Port Authority). From airbnb neighborhood description, and other hosts:  Head to Hell’s Kitchen to explore an excitingly trendy  neighborhood; Bursting with energy and devilish charisma, Hell’s Kitchen continues to evolve as high-rises move in and it is constantly growing. This classic New York City neighborhood is near it all—theaters on Broadway, green lawns in Central Park, and revered mom-and-pop culinary mainstays. As a storied NYC haunt, Hell’s Kitchen lives up to its unmistakable mystique.  This area has to be one of the most exciting areas in Manhattan for dining and outing. There are thousands of NYC top restaurants with all kind of different cuisines, popular bars and c
interaction: This is an opportunity to experience life in the city as a local, which if you have used Airbnb successfully, you know already how different it is from standard hotels. This is what I experienced using Airbnb and this is the experience I feel committed to convey to you. I will be available for you before and during your stay for advice, information, or other things you may need. And if you're interested, I will give you some info beyond the "tourist guide" stuff you can't easily find for yourself. Please feel free to ask for any piece of information you're interested in that does not appear here. I am glad to help.
house_rules: Just to insure a smooth and easy visit.  Here are a few things I want all guests to be aware of. I am perfectly within my right to do Airbnb but I want that to remain private.  If any neighbor should ask, you can say you are staying with me, just do not mention anything about Airbnb specifically it is not something I want my neighbors to know. Be considerate of noise and do not draw any attention to yourself especially when you have your suitcases with you in the hallway or in front of the building. Please feel free to communicate anything that you find different or not to your liking.  If I can fix it I will. What is important is if you don't communicate to me while you're here how can I then make it better? Now that it is summer I do not mind the air conditioning being left on when you are not here but please before you leave just turn it down to low/economy. This doesn't happen often but some guests have taken to sleeping with their door either open or ajar but because your room is

neighborhood_overview: Historically, the Lower East Side was a stopping ground for immigrants who just arrived in NYC and was filled with tenements. There is an awesome Tenement Museum now on Orchard street, not far from my apartment. The Lower East Side has, in my opinion, two identities. The eastern side is very residential. The western, more in part is a hip, night time destinations with many bars, restaurants, galleries, cafes, independent shops, etc. My apartment is a couple of minutes from the hip part.  My particular street is very much in transition definitely going through gentrification. My block has now three renovated buildings, including mine and I suspect in a few years, will be completely different.  My immediate neighborhood is a mix of people - a real reflection of NYC diversity - Asian, Latin, Jewish, Black, young professionals, hipsters, artists, etc. It's a cool mix. The street is urban for sure but very safe. My building is filled with young professionals, creative types - one married co
notes: This is my personal apartment. It's not a business. It's not a hotel. It's not perfect. I host often and keep up with my place because of that. I try to keep it as clean as possible. However, it does have imperfections like anyone's home. If you expect perfection, it's best you book a hotel. :)
transit: F train, East Broadway stop is seconds away, very convenient and per my reviews, one of the things people love about my place.  The East Broadway stop is the last stop in Manhattan before it heads to Dumbo in Brooklyn The F train also goes up the center of Manhattan and can take you to the East Village, Soho, West Village, Chelsea, Time Square, Rockefeller Center and the southern part of Central Park. It's the best train! :)
interaction: As we will be sharing the apartment, interaction is a given. I will definitely give you as much privacy and quiet time as needed, but I am also always available for pleasant conversation and if have time, up for beers and hanging out.
house_rules: No smoking. No pets in apartment. No guests, especially overnight.

Historically protected the wide boulevards offer great skyline views and multi cultural exchange.  Famous gospel churches near fashionable restaurants near unique shopping and the Apollo Theatre.  So convenient and fun, yet quiet accessible and more
notes: This a beautiful place to gather together with friends and family to create wonderful memories.  The kitchen is well equipped, the linens are top quality.  There is museum quality art deco furnishings and art work.  Every detail has been addressed for your comfort.  It is convenient to everything there is to do in NYC and offers access to many other unique Harlem experiences.

interaction: I offer all my guests a complimentary walking tour of Harlem and a personal tour of the house.  I offer complimentary coffee,artisanal teas and all city tips for great things to do and directions.  I am a long time New Yorker and Harlem resident since 2005.

neighborhood_overview: Harlem's historic Sugar Hill neighborhood is still home to international jazz greats.  Quiet, tree-lined streets, gorgeous rows of 19th century townhouses, fast subway access to downtown attractions, short walk to Yankee Stadium. Walking distance to restaurants, cafes, supermarkets, Riverbank State Park (olympic-size pool, sports fields, winter ice-skating), as well as several playgrounds and basketball courts.
notes: We know several neighborhood babysitters.
transit: We are less than 5 minutes walk to 5 subway lines: #1, B & C local trains and A & D express trains. 15 minutes to midtown.  Several city buses also stop on our corner.
interaction: We want to help make your visit perfect and we are always reachable via text, cell phone and email.

Its a relatively quiet block, a lovely tree-lined street, and a short walk to either of these neighborhoods. Also just steps from the HighLine, hotspot Meatpacking District, and close to several subway lines (A,C,E, 1, 9,)
notes: Its a great apartment. I love it and I hope you will too. All essential amenities come with it.. towels, linens, plates, glasses, cutlery, iron, ironing board,  hairdryer, etc.

neighborhood_overview: THIS IS HARLEM, The Barrio, Spanish Harlem.   It's a safe, residential, gentrified neighborhood. Hispanics, African Americans, & Caucasians live here. Travelers should be open to various cultures in this area. It's not a fancy neighborhood. This is what's great about NYC, you experience the different neighborhoods.  Spanish Harlem has authentic Mexican, Dominican & Puerto Rican food that's delicious & cheap.  You can also get cheap good sandwiches & coffee at the Hispanic delis that play spanish music!  I'm 4 blocks from the The Upper East Side where there's a Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Le Pain Quotidien and Central Park! Everything you need...food, grocery, laundry, coffee, subway, bus, pharmacy, museums are close by.
notes: PLEASE READ DESCRIPTION & REVIEWS.  Please include "LIFE IS GOOD" in your booking message so I know you read this. If you're EASY GOING, this is the place for you!  The apartment faces the street, you will hear noise occasionally & people hang out in the street, talk & listen to music at night in the summer. DO NOT BOOK IF YOU WANT A: fancy neighborhood  luxury building new building hotel experience light sleeper action or nightlife
transit: 6 Green Line Train- 4 blocks-96th street 6 Green Line Train- 3 blocks 103rd Street if you want to visit The Bronx/Yankee Stadium  Bus stop @ E 96th street takes you to the West Side of Manhattan Bus stop @100st-the corner of my apartment takes you down town on the East Side
interaction: Available for questions through Airbnb.
house_rules: Maintain area clean and leave apt clean to avoid mice and roaches. No smoking in the apartment, no smoking out the window.  If I smell smoke I will keep $100 deposit.  Do not bring people stay over. I will ask you to leave the apartment with partial refund. No parties. Full deposit will be kept for loss, damages and if rules are not followed. Thank you!

neighborhood_overview: The West Village is one of Manhattan's most sought after neighborhoods to live and visit. Historically preserved, tree-lined with beautiful garden plantings and just a 5 minute walk from Hudson River Park with beautiful sunsets, historic Washington Square Park and Bleecker Street shopping. WV is also known for the hippest restaurants and clubs.
notes: This space is quintessential historic NYC.  This means the building is old and is a 3rd floor walk-up. While large for a  NYC rental, I still get the occasional guest displeased and unprepared for this urban experience. So please carefully consider before you make your reservation. You may reach me at (phone number hidden).
transit: The West Village is one of Manhattan's most sought after neighborhoods to live and visit. Historically preserved, tree-lined with beautiful garden plantings and just a 5 minute walk from Hudson River Park with beautiful sunsets, historic Washington Square Park and Bleecker Street shopping. WV is also known for the hippest restaurants and clubs. Street parking is usually easily available on the weekends and hit or miss during the week. There is paid garage parking a block away.
interaction: I live in the apartment in my own private room. I work full-time often long hours so I respect that guests may also have full schedules and may enjoy their privacy. However, I've hosted dozens of guests and have experienced that there are those relaxed moments when it feels natural to engage. I've met some of the most wonderful people this way.
house_rules: Please take shoes off when walking on rugs Kitchen is for lite meal prep rather than cooking meals - refrigerator for leftovers, microwave for leftovers, sink for drinking water, coffee and tea. I'm sorry that kitchen is not meant for stocking groceries  and cooking meals Due to the fact I work until 5:30pm outside of my home, early check-in and early bag drop-off and post check-out bag storage is not possible.  There is a luggage internet service with lockers located throughout the City  - it's called LuggageHero I cannot accept parcel deliveries for you in advance of your stay

transit: NYC Subway is less than 5 minutes walking at the Penn Station and 23rd Street stops, but if you're like us, you'll find yourself walking almost everywhere Taxis are easy to flag down everywhere in NYC, and we usually do it on 30th St & 9th Ave.  You might also want to try Uber.  They usually pick-up in less then 5 minutes, and UberX is now cheaper than NYC Taxi We also suggest getting a weekly CitiBike pass for $25.  Getting around NYC on a bike is quick and easy, and there are Stations near us on 29th St & 9th Ave, and 31st St & 8th Ave.  Get the CitiBike App for your smartphone for easy location listings
interaction: We are always available via phone, text and e-mail before and during your stay, and would be happy to help you with anything and offer recommendations to our favorite places
house_rules: 1.  Please respect our apartment.  It is our home, and we keep it very clean.  We do not charge a cleaning fee, so please try to leave everything the way you found it. 2.  No shoes inside the apartment!  NYC is an interesting place and we do everything we can not to track outside dirt into our house.  Please use the conveniently located shoe closet at the entrance hallway.  Slippers are available to you in the shoe closet. 3.  No smoking inside.  If you need a smoke, please go outside or on the roof.  To access the roof simply continue up the stairs to the 6th floor door that leads to the roof.  It is not locked. 4.  Have fun!!!

neighborhood_overview: There is simply no better place to explore NYC than from this gorgeous apartment. The building is super quiet and upscale, but you're able to walk to everything you'll want to see, including:  Times Square The Intrepid  Broadway shows Rockefeller Center Carnegie Hall Central Park Columbus Circle St. Patrick's Cathedral DeWitt Clinton Park Museum of Modern Art Top of the Rock Radio City Music Hall Lincoln Center Madame Tussaud's Wax Museum Gotham West Market Bryant Park  Eugene O'Neill Theater Best Buy Theater NYC Tourist Center and more! There are also hundreds of amazing restaurants right outside your door - within a few blocks alone, you'll have your choice of: German, Italian, French, Israeli, Ethiopian, Thai, Indonesian, Portuguese, Brazilian, Spanish, Mexican, tapas, Chinese, bubble tea, pizza, falafel, Indian, Egyptian, Greek, sushi, and so much more.
transit: The following subway lines are proximate:  1, 2, 3, A, B, C, D, E, F, M, N, Q, R Ubers arrive within 2 minutes.  Also, the taxi garages are nearby, so you'll always get a ride - no waiting for hours during rush hour!
interaction: I love personally meeting with my guests, talking over your plans and helping you pick the best mix of sightseeing, restaurants, bars, museums, shows and fun things to do!

notes: Please make yourself at home, enjoy the Big Apple and I am at your disposal for any questions you might have! I hope you enjoy my place and please respect it as if it was yours! Thank you!
transit: The subway is two blocks away and so is Penn Station. The High Line starts right on West 34th! The Hudson River trail is two blocks away. You can reach any location very quickly!

neighborhood_overview: The Lower East Side is one of the most desirable neighborhoods in all of the five boroughs. There are outstanding restaurants and amazing nightlife options all within a few minutes walk.  You can walk to Chinatown, Soho, and the East Village and West Village in a matter of minutes as well. To many, the Lower East Side is the "definitive" New York neighborhood. The Lower East Side is just a 10 minute walk to shopping in Soho and it’s even closer to some of the best restaurants, lounges and nightlife in the city. It’s also a short ride in a taxi or on Citibike to Williamsburg, Brooklyn.   With gourmet markets, shopping, galleries, cool bars, music venues, and a range of restaurants nearby, the Lower East Side has a diverse community that will help you have an amazing NYC experience. To many New Yorkers, the Lower East Side is the "definitive" New York neighborhood with a storied past.
notes: I will do everything I can to make sure your stay is as comfortable as possible, and that you get as much out of New York as you want.
transit: The apartment is just a couple of blocks from the 2nd Ave. subway stop (F train) and the Delancey/Essex street subway stop, which services the J, Z, F and M trains.   It's about 10 minutes ride on the train to Union Square and 20 minutes to Central Park.  You can also take the M train to JFK which takes a total of 1:15 door to door.   Taxis, bus and Citibike stations are everywhere, and you’re a few minutes walk from the foot of the Williamsburg Bridge, which in 20 minutes walk can get to the hip Williamsburg neighborhood in Brooklyn.  You’re also 15 minute walk from the newly renovated East River Park where you can enjoy sunrise, great river views and fitness track and tennis.
interaction: It is entirely up to you and you can have complete and total privacy during your stay.  I usually stay elsewhere in the city and can assist with any questions or concerns you might have,  If you are coming to New York for either work or holiday and need privacy, you will get both here.
house_rules: It's an apartment in the heart of the Lower East Side, very old school New York.  Just take care of the apartment, the same way you would take care of your home. I'm really easy going but simple rules apply: No smoking and no parties and be conscious of noise that might disturb the neighbors who range from elderly to young.  And please leave the apartment as you find it (as much as you can).  That is pretty much it!   I'm very welcoming and generous with whatever I have and I am very happy to  host courteous people. You are welcome to any food items you need such as tea, coffee, cereal, cooking oil, herbs, spices, etc. I only ask that you do your best to clean up after yourself. Aside from that, consider my house your house! I understand that, on vacation, there will be the occasional late night (Lower East Side is legendary for nightlife), and I'm okay with that. Just please don't bring the party home with you. I must keep the neighbors happy! :)

neighborhood_overview: Alphabet City is a great nieghborhood within the heart the East Village in downtown Manhattan. Walking distance to the Lower East Side, West Village, SoHo, NoHo, Chinatown and Tribeca. Short commute to Times Square area and Williamsburg Brooklyn. Too many restaurants, bars, coffee shops, nightclubs, live music and comedy venues, and all other forms of entertainment withing steps to list. One block from Tompkins Square Park and East River Park, and several community gardens and galleries open to the public for you to visit.
transit: Bus stops and CitiBike (public bike share station) within a block. 15 minute walk to multiple subway lines. Or you can always take a bus directly to subway and make a free transfer.
interaction: I've lived in the neighborhood for nearly 12 years, so I'm happy to help with any suggestions, advice or directions. I live in the room downstairs from you, along with friendly pup Niko. Niko has never been in your room, and has no access to it. Not a dog person? If you'd rather not interact with him during your stay just let me know, I'm happy to keep him in my room when I'm not home. I work a lot and stay very active, so chances are you won't see much of me.
