neighborhood_overview: This area has gotten quite a facelift over the past 10 years or so. There are plenty of very good restaurants within 2 or 3 blocks of the apartment and we are just a 5-7 minute walk to the theater district. Beautiful Bryant Park is just a 10 minute walk from here, there are three multiplex movie theaters just a few blocks away. We are also barely a 10 minute walk to most major shopping - Macys, H&M, Abercrombie & Fitch, Zara etc... We ar also known as the Fashion & Garment Center so watch out for those sample sales that can pop up anytime ; )).  If you're going to a concert or sporting event, than Madison Square Garden is just 3 short blocks away.
notes: There are 1 1/2 bathrooms. The main bathroom, which we will share, is a full bathroom with a shower. The other bathroom does not have a shower, however it is larger and has an old fashioned bathtub. This bathroom is located just outside of the space. We used to have a cat, Samantha, but unfortunately she passed away about a year ago. We have looked for another but have not found the right one just yet.
transit: We are very centrally located so it is very easy access to most trains and buses with Penn Station just 3 blocks away south and Port Authority Bus Terminal just 3 blocks north. Times Square is less than  5 minute walk as well.
interaction: I live and work from here so I will be around most of the time should you have any questions about the area. I am always happy to offer recommendations for restaurants, parks, etc...
house_rules: All I ask is that you please be respectful of my home. Please cleanup after yourselves as best you can. Thank you in advance.

neighborhood_overview: Our home is located in the Morningside Heights neighborhood of Harlem. The neighborhood is very safe and quiet, and it is constantly patrolled by the City College campus security, as well as the NYPD.  We are centrally located to Columbia University and City College of New York.
notes: We have been Airbnb hosts for 3+ years.  As frequent Airbnb travelers ourselves, we have been guests in some of the best Airbnb listings, and we've brought our favorite decor into our New York property.  Our commitment is to make each of our guests feel like they're staying in a 5-star hotel.
transit: We are located about 3 blocks from the A and D express subway lines, which connect you to Times Square and midtown tourist attractions in about 10 minutes. We are also near the M60 bus to LaGuardia Airport, and the M104 to Columbia University.   If a car is more your style, Uber is a great option that can pick you up right at the apartment.  If you have a Zipcar membership, Zipcars are available about 3 blocks away.
interaction: You will be met upon arrival, and we will be readily available throughout your stay, in person or by phone, to answer any questions you may have.  Convenient self check-in is available as well, for guests planning on checking in late at night.   I'm Jimmy.  I work in small business marketing.  My partner Shaun, is a restaurant manager on the Upper East Side.  We are both passionate about hospitality and food, so we know a thing or two about exploring all of the great dining options that our city has to offer!  If you have any questions, or need advice on where to go to see the best of the best while you're here, we'll be happy to assist.  We also have a precious miniature pinscher puppy named Peanut.  She is very well trained, and is not allowed in our guest rooms.
house_rules: - We hope that you enjoy your stay, and we will be ready to take any questions by phone or text during your visit. - Keys are always handed to you at check-in. We will be waiting at the apartment for your arrival, unless we notify you differently.  ** Standard Check-in is after 4pm.  Earlier check-in can be arranged for a $40 early check-in fee, billed via Airbnb.  Please let us know if you'd like to check in early.   **Check-out time is at 10am.   **Late check-out after 10am (before 4pm) will be billed at $50 cash.  If the room is empty by 10am, and you need us to hold luggage until later in the day, the bag storage fee is $25. If you wish to have an early check-in, or a late check-out, please let us know when you book. - Master key lost is $125 cash for a replacement.  - For the safety and security of our guests and neighbors, only the registered Airbnb user will be authorized to enter the apartment. neighborhood_overview: What can I say about Hell's Kitchen? Its the coolest neighborhood in NYC... Its right next to Times Square, the busiest brightest intersection anywhere...this is where the ball drops on New Years eve etc.  But the beauty of HK is that while it's right next to all the hustle and bustle, it still has some quiet and funky side streets, like 45th Street where the apt is located.  The restaurants and bars are the best in town. Casual or more upscale...there's something for everyone. I'll tell you all my favorites.
notes: Its a great space in a great neighborhood. I love it and I hope you will too!
transit: Every Subway and bus in NYC runs through Times Square. You are just a few blocks from all of them.
interaction: I'm usually staying with a friend downtown, or at my other property. You can reach me via cellphone just about anytime with needs or questions.
house_rules: No stringent rules...but neighbors will appreciate general respect in terms of noise. Its certainly not a stuffy place either... Be comfortable and have fun!

neighborhood_overview: Best neighborhood in NYC. Celebrity & model sightings are common. Fun, exciting, cool. Great reasonable restaurants within walking distance. Rite-Aide 24-hour convenience store a block and a half away. The West Village is the most exclusive and sought after neighborhood in Manhattan. 2 blocks to Bleecker Street designer shopping, Marc Jacobs, Burberry & more. 10 minute walk to the Meatpacking District, The Hudson Waterfront, Apple Store, The Highline, New Whitney Museum.
notes: NOTE: Full kitchen is SHARED and is not on the same floor as the apartment. It is on the 1st floor of the townhouse. There is a Microwave, Nespresso coffee machine and small refridgerator INSIDE the apartment.

neighborhood_overview: It' s a safe neighborhood for our family and it will be for yours  . The house is located in a quiet street (for New York ) , away from Midtown commotions,  with a lot of restaurants , bars , shops nearby.  A very large supermarket is 5 minutes walking distance from home , with train station just in front of it . 3 minutes walking distance from City College , and 2 train stop from Columbia University. 2 train stations are very nearby ,  5 minutes walking distance , another one 8 minutes .  With Express train , you need only 10 minutes to be at Columbus Circle ( main entrance to Central Park) , 15 for Times Square , 17 to Madison Square Garden , 20 Minutes to Wall street & Battery Park , Statue de la Liberte and Liberty Island Pier . It s an historical neighborhood with numerous preserved buildings and houses , including the famous "Brownstone" houses in the streets all around .
notes: Prior any booking request , you MUST be verified by Airbnb with your passport or id .  No verification , no booking.
transit: Very convenient with easy transportation to the most interesting places ! Subway red Train Line 1 , 5 minutes walking distance .( local or express from 96 St , with 2 and 3 lines) . Subway blue train Line A, B, C, D (Express et local)  8 minutes walking distance. A lot of Bus and Taxis on Broadway & Amsterdam Avenue
interaction: We are a french couple , quiet and friendly . We are living here on first floor which is loft style  and second floor , with our bedrooms and private bathroom.    We will be here for you if  you need help or informations !

neighborhood_overview: The East Village is full of culture and very heterogeneous in terms of its inhabitants. There are at least 3 cinemas I can think of that are in walking distance (10 minutes). There are so many great restaurants, you might get overwhelmed by the choice. Subway and Bus are right there. The East Village abuts the Lower East Side (lots of clubs, entertainment, bars). Tompkins Square Park is a 5 minute walk from the house (outdoor movies in the summer), and remember we have Citibike now so guests can go anywhere by bike. I have two helmets that you can use.
notes: The aesthetics of the house are lovely. I'm big into interior design. I want you to feel welcome in NYC. NYC can be a very intimidating and overwhelming city. I hope I can help you effectively navigate so you can have a fruitful trip. I am a consummate traveler, lived all over the world and understand what it is like to come to a strange place. I hope my home can be a pied-a-terre welcome respite from your explorations of the cities many, many cultural opportunities and goings-on. Welcome!!!
transit: L train is a 10 minute walk from the house. Bus 14D goes across town (2 minutes from the house); And we have citibike: two stations 1-2 blocks from the house.
interaction: Always greet in person on arrival unless in the case of emergency ( I am a midwife), in which I will have a friend greet or leave key in the lock box. My wish is to interact as often as guests need face to face and by phone or the app, if I"m out working or not home. I am working Tuesday and Thursday out of the house until early afternoon and Wednesdays in my office, in the apartment. Out some evenings, can't say with certainty which days of the week.
house_rules: No smoking indoors. (Sorry). No single men.

neighborhood_overview: I've lived in Harlem for over 5 years now and it has been nothing short of amazing. The vibrant culture, friendly neighbors, and historical landmarks in the neighborhood is a crucial part of New York City's multicultural fabric that makes the city great. If you're familiar with the Harlem Renaissance in the 1920s, you'll enjoy the fact that you'll be in walking distance to the famous Apollo Theatre and Savoy Ballroom.  We are also located next to Columbia University, one of the most prestigious universities in the country. There is a bus that brings you to the steps of Morningside Park which is the park that separates the school from the rest of the city. Obviously, safety is one of the main concerns for newcomers to New York. To those that come from suburbia, it is common for there to be many loiterers, especially during the summer months. Being part of the community this long, I can attest that it is as safe as the rest of Manhattan. It is important to remember that no matter where y
notes: Please do not lose the key cards to the building. Replacing it is expensive! I'll have to charge $50 for each missing key card. On days when there will be a guest checking in after you, I ask the guest that is leaving to do check out by 10 am so the house cleaner has adequate time to thoroughly clean for the next guest. I also ask the next guest to check in no earlier than 2 pm. On days when there is no overlap of guests, we are completely flexible about check-in or check-out times.
transit: Most transportation methods get you to the apartment easily. We're conveniently located a few blocks from the 4/5/6 line, 2/3 line, and Metro North. There is also an express bus to and from La Guardia Airport. A few minutes from our doorstep are some of Harlem's favorite eateries: Red Rooster, Chez Lucienne, Barawine, and 125th St shopping (Marshall's, Old Navy, and a plethora of others). There's a gym located two blocks away and they have day passes if you're looking to work out during your stay. Otherwise, you can run along the East River along the esplanade which is a few blocks east of the building. The best form of travel around here is your feet! You are probably in some of the world's most walkable cities (unless bad weather). Many enthusiasts walk down to Central Park and spend the day biking around the most famous park in our city. Citi Bikes can be a fun way to explore the city as well, again if the weather is okay. It is easy to set up and I can help you with that. Airports-
interaction: I work nearby so I can always come by if there are any problems and I am available via text 24/7. I also work in my bedroom that's across from the Loft bedroom, sometimes during the daytime on weekdays. I love meeting new people, sharing experiences, as well as showing off some of Harlem's best restaurants. Harlem gets a bad reputation, but it has so much to offer. Sometimes I'll be too busy with work, but I will do my best to find time to hang out with you in the area for a drink if you stay more than a night or two.
house_rules: Please respect the furniture and building. Quiet time after 12AM. To ensure quick and easy booking, please make sure your Airbnb profile is complete with description and picture on which the booking guest is clearly identifiable, especially if this is your first reservation on Airbnb. According to Airbnb policy, I may have to decline your request if the information requested is not provided. Lost keys are expensive, they will cost $30 each to be replaced.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is reminiscent of old-school Europe. In the early 1800s the area was a major port, and the building use to be a warehouse for the storage of spices. All around there are cafes, pubs, and restaurants that line cobble stone streets, and the nearby park offers a refuge from the concrete jungle life. While there is a lot going on, the apartment is quiet, which is unusual for NYC. Steps away from the East River this apartment offers a prime location for getting to and from the 4th of July Macy's Firework display, easy access to the trains for Thanksgiving Day Parade, and blocks from the Statue of Liberty.
transit: Most major subways (1, 2, 3, N, R, 4, 5, J, & M) are 3 blocks away. It takes 15 mins to get anywhere in Manhattan.  Central Park (where I work) takes 20 mins on a workday.  The A, C, E trains are 6 blocks away at Fulton Street. We are very close to the west side highway bike path as well and CitiBike is located just around the corner. Cabs are always available right outside the door.
interaction: There is no check-in before 3:30 PM.  I am available 24/7 via phone/email for any issues or questions. Early baggage drop off can be arranged.
house_rules: The number one rule is that you do everything you can to make the best of your stay! I'll do everything I can to help with that. I'm a strong believer in the Golden Rule: do to others as you would have others do to you! Please treat my home as if it were your home. PLEASE let me know if there is anything missing or have any problems! This is very important. We have a zero tolerance disturbance policy. This means if we hear anything, we will come and ask that you check out immediately. This is strict. Please respect our neighbors and neighborhood, and please be quiet and keep to yourselves in the stairwell. The space, while large, is not for parties. If you host a large gathering in the space, you'll be asked to leave immediately. We appreciate your understanding in our considerations for our neighbors and our property. Before you leave, we ask that you: • Wash any used kitchen items  • Turn off the air conditioning and any heaters • Leave your trash by the door or in the closet • If th

neighborhood_overview: East Harlem is a vibrant and thriving part of New York City, characterized by its diversity and most notably authentic and incredible Latin and Puerto Rican cuisine. In other words, the food in this area is OUTSTANDING!  The apartment is situated next to a top Pizzeria (Neapolitans) and Fire House (so very very safe). Locals are very friendly and the restaurants and cafes all carry a very homey and "local" vibe. Most notable is the coffee shop Dear Mama (109th street between 1st & 2nd Ave) - it's packed with locals who will be happy to give you travel and food tips. And the coffee is delicious!  Cascalote and El Paso are both must try Mexican/Latin restaurants in the area - they have some of the best Mexican and Latin cuisine in all of NYC and I'm a tough critic! I highly recommend checking out Cascalote's brunch. If you do, the huevos ranchos are a must try!
notes: Night doorman/security guard  Linens provided  Bathroom amenities (towels, shampoo, conditioner, bath wash, blowdryer) provided
transit: The apt is located 2 blocks from subway, making it the very convenient to get around. There is also a bus stop 1/2 a block away. Central Park is just 5 blocks away! Happy to provide more specifics upon your stay.
interaction: I will not be home when guests are around. Interaction will be limited to key hand-off, or in most cases guests will be required to pick up the key for the local coffee shop (Brothers Bakery Cafe).
house_rules: I pride myself with a pristine and clean apartment and expect guests to leave it that way during their stay and upon departure.  ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING IN THE APT. If smoking on balcony, you MUST use an ash try. Do not under any circumstances throw buts off the balcony.  No guests other than those listed on the booking are allowed in the apartment.  Appreciate if you can take off shoes while in the apartment. I have a very nice white rug that would benefit from you going shoeless :)  Please put all dirty dishes in dishwasher. Please empty trash in trash chute.  Please hang towels on rack in bathroom upon departure.

neighborhood_overview: We’ve lived in harlem for almost 10 years and we've experienced the many great changes take place right before our eyes. It’s true, Harlem is going through yet another renaissance and we are just happy to be a part of it all. Our neighborhood has a diverse mix of ages, cultures and personalities, but it’s certainly safe and friendly. You might receive a friendly "hello" from the super that works on our block. His name is Al and he's’ great. As we mentioned before, tons of new great shops and restaurants are opening up all the time. Access to downtown manhattan is a breeze and we are always eager to give you recommendations on the hottest new spots and old faithfuls in the hood. We love it here and we can’t wait to share what we know with our guests.
notes: We have a house keeper that comes during the day to clean and water plants. She and her son help maintain the space but please be respectful and clean after yourselves.
transit: Our apartment is a few blocks away from the 1 Train (red) and two blocks away from the express A/C (blue) D/B (orange) subway lines. There is also a cross town bus 5 blocks  from us. We are a 7 min subway ride to Columbia University. You can be in Times Square in 16.5 minutes by subway (I timed it).
interaction: We’re a very active family so we’re not always going to be home, but we live in the apartment upstairs. We will always be accessible to answer any questions you may have or give recommendations about what to do in the city. Hopefully in person, but if we are not around feel free to text or call us (our cell numbers will be provided once you arrive).
house_rules: Please be polite and clean up after yourself- tidiness is a MUST especially in the Kitchen and Bathroom areas. If we have to clean your dirty dishes, crumbs off the counter or your hair from the drain you’ll politely be asked to leave. JUST KIDDING, but you will have to answer Celine :-) ( you don’t want those problems) Please no shoes in the apartment and no feeding Maya (no matter how cute of a face she is putting on for you). She is allergic to most human foods and feeding her will leave her stomach in shambles. Smoking is allowed outside only. Singing in the shower is encouraged. Souvenirs from other countries are accepted! No walking naked (keep your undies on please) and no booty calls, unless you want to sleep in the garden for the night. Other than that, enjoy yourself, the city and you stay in our wonderful apartment!

It's super close to East Village, five-ten minutes walking distance to SoHo, NoHo, Little Italy, and Chinatown, 15 minutes away form Greenwich Village, Tribeca, Battery Park and Financial District. Just one stop away from Williamsburg, so you can even enjoy a lovely walk through the bright.
notes: We have a friendly puppy living with us. Lula is white dog, a sweethearts and won't bother you!
transit: The closest subway station is Essex/Delancey with F, M, J and Z lines.
interaction: We are usually around, always ready to help, so you can ask as anything! Couple our guest are our good friends now and decided to stay in the neighborhood. We like people. :)
house_rules: We are easygoing and flexible, so please just treat our place as you would your own. Our house is also a non-smoking place. Thanks and enjoy!

neighborhood_overview: Harlem - Columbia University, this is the heart of the Gentrification/Revitalization of Harlem. Everything you know of Harlem is right around the corner. The Apollo, Columbia University, Magic Johnson Theater, Cotton Club, Grants Tomb, National Jazz Museum, the famous Red Rooster restaurant which is one of the favorite restaurants of Obama, the chef Marcus Samuelson has been invited to White House to make the national Gala dinner many times, and the list goes on.  To make it even better, the area is bursting at the seams with new restaurants, markets, coffee shops, wine stores etc, most of them are in walking distance. The area is very safe to walk around. You can walk to Columbia where you will find a bustling campus and more places to eat and check out. That is also where you find the "Seinfeld Diner" and yes, it is open so you can go in and check it out. We are also a couple of blocks away from the famous historic the Cathedral Church of Saint John the Divine.
notes: We are an international couple and love to travel. We have traveled all over the world and brought back multicultural memories back to our home, you will definitely taste the multicultural experience during your staying. We have friends and family come to visit and stay with us, so we set up this room to welcome our guests and give them their privacy (and ours). We joined Airbnb was because we love the culture of it, we also like to share our passion for travel and the multicultural experience with our guests. There is a notebook on the desk for you to write down your thoughts of your stay, please leave a note for us and future guests. Hope to see you soon and look forward to having you back to visit us again. Cheers, Sarah and Tom
transit: Walking the neighborhood gets you to shopping, eating and Columbia University. Three blocks uptown (that means the short end of the block) is the Subway. This is the 125th St Station. You can get the A Express- 6 minutes to 59th st Time Warner Center and Lincoln Center and then heading all the way to JFK Airport. The D Express- 6 Minutes to Time Warner or Lincoln Center and then 4 Minutes to Rockefeller Center. Then there are the B and C Locals, They go down Central Park West and stop at every station including the Museum of Natural Art and 72nd St best know for the Dakota Building, plus this is the heart of the upper west side. All Trains continue down the island stopping at Times Square, SOHO, Chinatown and eventually battery Park. bottom line is this is a great location to live in the city.  There is also free parking on the street, we do observe alternate side parking rules but if you time it right and get the good side as I usually do, you can leave your car in it's spot from Thur
interaction: We only interact if there is a reason to or you need something. Once you check in you can come and go on your schedule. You are welcome to ask in person or call us if you have any questions or you need tips on the city, etc.
house_rules: No Cooking; This is for safety and smell. There is a kitchen with a stove, the stove is only there because it is part of the house, You may use it to heat or boil water. If you do cook and we need to clean and or deodorize the unit there will be an additional $150.00 cleaning fee charged, No Exceptions. If the odors are extremely bad there may be additional charges for lost revenue.  There is a tea kettle, toaster and  a microwave for reheating items.  Be respectful of noise and what time it is.  Keep the outside doors  locked at all times Do not block the hallways Turn off appliances, AC, Lights etc when not in use.  No Smoking No Pets No parties NOTE: if you are staying more than a week or are making a reservation for an extended stay there may be additional cleaning charges depending on the length of stay and services needed.  Thanks you for your cooperation Tom

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is on a quiet tree-lined street but just a half block from Broadway where everything is at your fingertips.  1 block west is one of the best parks in NYC - Riverside Park - which has amazing biking, running, walking trails, gardens, and sunsets over the Hudson River.
notes: This is a third floor walk up so make sure to take that into consideration when packing. There is no elevator in the building.   Also, during winter months, as it’s an old pre-war building, the heat is controlled by the building and when it clicks on  - sometimes in the middle of the night - there may be some knocking of the pipes in the living room for a few seconds.  The seasonal rate reflects this inconvenience.
transit: 2 blocks from 1/2/3 express stop at 96th street.  Citibike station 1 block away on 92nd and Broadway
interaction: Feel free to text me for any information - I'm happy to help.  I love NYC, but am back and forth between there and Toronto.
house_rules: No smoking or animals - I'm allergic.  Must be quiet as it is a small building - no loud music, parties, etc.

neighborhood_overview: The East Village is socially and culturally diverse without being pretentious. New York's immigrant origins, 70s punk scene, and current food renaissance all energetically coexist in the East Village like nowhere else in Manhattan. You can seriously get Michelin-rated sushi or three-dollar PBRs within 50 feet (15 m) of the front door. Its residents, an unlikely mix of businesspeople, artists, laborers, designers, and nomads anachronistically make themselves at home among Old New York's Gilded Age and Pre-war brick-and-stone architectural hand-me-downs. Midtown's steel-and-glass landscape and the West Village's yuppie homogeneity haven't invaded the East Village...yet.
notes: I usually wake up around 8am. If I have time to make coffee or breakfast before work, I will always make extra for you. I cook pretty well, though I can't compete with the excellent breakfast places nearby, which you should also explore. Also note that this is an apartment share. Airbnbing an entire apartment is currently illegal in New York City, though whole-apartment rentals can be found. But since we're obeying the law, no need for you to sneak in and out of the building past disapproving neighbors.
transit: Subways are a short walk in any direction. The N, R, 6, and F Trains are a 5-minute walk away. The B, D, M, L, 4, and 5 Trains are a 10-minute walk away. Also, you can rent a CitiBike one block away.
interaction: As this is an apartment share, I am always available for my guests. I often work from home. You'll have privacy in your bedroom, but you're always welcome to join me for conversation/questions/coffee/beer in the kitchen or living room. And you're always welcome to tag along with my friends and me if we have any outings planned.  I know New York very well and have lived here for close to 20 years. I'm happy to show you around this neighborhood, which has a special place in my heart.
house_rules: Please treat the home like it's your own. Help yourself to any food or drink in the fridge. Feel free to cook. I usually grind and brew my own coffee in the morning and will make extra cups for you if I do.  I'll provide you with towels, washcloths, and soap. If you need any other toiletries, help yourself to mine in the bathroom.  Please be respectful of our neighbors. While it's a lively neighborhood, it's a generally quiet building. Also, if any of the neighbors are making too much noise, let me know or report them by calling 311...or just invite yourself to the neighbor's party. It's that kind of neighborhood.

neighborhood_overview: I’m bias of course but I honestly feel it's the best neighborhood in all of New York. Very quaint, quiet and extremely safe tree lined street but just a block away from all the action you love about New York City.  Everything you need is accessible.  And the best part is that you're so close to both Central Park and Riverside park. It’s also an area of New York City that truly feels like a neighborhood.
notes: If you have any questions at all, please let me know and I will get back to you ASAP but this truly is a one of a kind apartment in quite honestly the best location in the whole city.
transit: Just one block away to the Subway and there is a crosstown bus one block away too!  Few stops away on the subway from Times Square and just steps away from some of the best spots in all of New York City. I will also provide you promo codes to use for Lyft, Uber and Via so you can get some free rides if you don’t want to take the subway or walk. There’s also a few Citi Bike ports within three blocks of the apartment.
interaction: Will always be available to you by phone or email but you have the apartment all to yourself.
house_rules: Please take care of this unit as you would your own.  No loud music or noise at all, as I do have neighbors so please be respectful.  No extra guests, no parties, no pets.  This is a very quiet and friendly building and I am very respectful of my neighbors and appreciate you being so as well. Thank you.

neighborhood_overview: Our block, between First and Second Avenues is completely residential. In most of Manhattan, and especially in this neighborhood, the nearer one stays to an avenue or on an avenue (rather than on a street), and the nearer one stays to transportation centers (here Lexington and 116th and 125th Streets) the greater the noise level and the denser the traffic and crowds. I urge you to read the reviews from prior guests to gain their appreciation of the neighborhood.  I do suggest that guests might feel more comfortable if they use a taxi when returning after about 11:00 pm. People here and in NYC generally are very friendly and will go out of their way to be helpful.
notes: PRICING--IMPORTANT: The price you will be quoted by AirBnb already includes a discount for stays of 7 nights or longer. Also, I have been asked in several inquiries to provide the total cost for a stay. I AM UNABLE TO DO THAT, BECAUSE: (1) if you are inquiring from within the United States, your cost will be shown in US$. However, that cost includes a commission that you pay to AirBnb. I do not know what the commission rate is and I have no control over the amount of that commission. (2) If you inquire from outside the US, I believe your total cost is shown in your country's currency. I have no idea what exchange rate AirBnb applies and no control over that exchange rate. Also, as said above, I have no control over the rate or amount of commission AirBnb charges you, as a guest. On my end of the transaction, I see only the gross amount in US$ that I will receive based on my daily or weekly rates; AirBnb also deducts a commission from that payment to me before depositing money to my acc
transit: I will provide a neighborhood map on arrival that locates bus and subway stops as well as shopping highlights. The walk to the nearest subway stop is about 8 minutes. Buses are available within a block and half. Please research NYC or Manhattan transportation so you have an idea of the subway network. The nearest line is Lexington Ave (Green line on the maps, I will recommend the number 6, the local train, on the Green Line) which runs the entire length of Manhattan and is one of the most convenient methods of transport you will find in Manhattan. Also the 7th Ave or Red line (numbers 2 and 3 trains) has a station nearby at 116th St. and Lenox Ave. and runs down the west side of Manhattan. The 2 and 3 trains also run directly from the concourse of Pennsylvania Station. I have many maps and sight-seeing brochures to aid you in coordinating your activities. Many guests have purchased packaged tours and activities including subway & bus passes. This can be done beforehand and I recommend
interaction: The degree of interaction is entirely up to you.  We are happy to provide a light breakfast or even simple meals to enjoy in the apartment for the first day or two until you are settled in and acclimated to our local time if you are travelling from outside the US.  We have a small Maltese dog, "Lady Windermere." She appears in one of the photos, though her favorite spot is on my shoulder. As you may know, the breed is hypoallergenic and does not shed. She is sweet and lively and may bark until she comes to know you. By the time you leave, you may want to take her with you, but we will not allow that. On the other hand, you need not see her or us for your entire stay if that is your wish. I do communicate with you before your arrival regarding transportation to and from the house. And, I do check in on you during your stay to make sure everything is to your satisfaction. I am always available to answer questions.  Please read the reviews to gain an impression of me and my hosting style.
house_rules: No smoking, drugs or partying in the Apartment. A complete list of Apartment procedures is available on booking.

neighborhood_overview: This apartment is a beautiful, private, quiet retreat with fast transportation (A express train) to the hustle and bustle of midtown NYC. The neighborhood has a lot to offer including a gorgeous park with great views of the Hudson River and George Washington Bridge, lots restaurants, bars, and parks. Seven minute walk to Columbia Presbyterian Hospital. Great retreat to get a solid night's rest for med students or friends/family visiting someone in the hospital.  Sunny private bedrooms with air conditioning in large 2 bedroom apartment.  Fort Tyron Park and the Cloisters Museum are a 10 min bus ride or 20 min walk north of the apartment.
notes: Check in and out times are flexible depending on your travel plans and my availability to greet you and give you the keys.
transit: The A express train 175th street station is two blocks away. Two different bus lines also two blocks away. It's a 7 min walk to 168th st station where you can catch the A,C and 1 trains.
interaction: ALWAYS available to answer questions or assist guests via phone, text, email, Airbnb messaging.
house_rules: No smoking in the apartment. Shoes off at the door please.

neighborhood_overview: Upper East Side / East Harlem (quote from the Not for Tourists guide): ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Whew, finally a break from the chaos. This part of the Upper Upper East Side is a place for families, young, old, black, white, Latino, rich, poor--it just depends what block you stumble upon. Head above 96th Street for some of the best Mexican food on the planet, or head west to Central Park, where you'll find kids and adults playing soccer, softball, and football (Not touristy Central Park). Get some culture at the neighborhoods museums, get some knowledge at a lecture at the 92nd Street Y, but most importantly, get ready to be somewhere where people can actually live, work, and shop. Nothing hip or cool here, this is just a good old-fashioned New York neighborhood. -------------------------------------------------------------------
notes: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------THE NEIGHBORHOOD:  The "Museum Mile" is just 3 blocks away on Fifth Avenue, next to Central Park, a mere 5-7 minute walk away. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  Museum Mile incorporates the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum at 88th Street, The Met (Metropolitan Museum of Art) from 82nd to 86th Streets, as well as El Museo del Barrio (104th St), Museum of the City of New York (103rd St), Jewish Museum (92nd Street), Cooper-Hewitt National Museum of Design (91st St), National Academy Museum and School of Fine Arts (89th St), and Goethe House German Cultural Center (82nd St) ...all on or near Fifth Avenue (a short stroll away)! -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  The Central Park Conservatory Gard
transit: TRANSIT:  The apartment is simple to get to from any airport by cab or subway/train and, since it's w/in a block of a gas station, catching a cab is remarkably easy (and there is always lyft or uber). neighborhood_overview: Flatiron is in the very heart of Manhattan. Blocks from Union Square, Chelsea, West Village, NoMa, and Time Square. The iconic Flatiron Building, a beautiful park and amazing shops, are right outside!
transit: Free parking in front of building after 7pm, everyday. Paid parking lot across the street. Paid parking on streets around block. Two subways one block away. Very easy to get cabs.
interaction: My dedicated team of hospitality professionals aim to make guests feel appreciated and at home from the moment they arrive. My insurance requires that events of five or more guests have one of my staff present during entire event. Staff are included in rental price.  I have a small team of female hostesses and supervisors that I have worked with for years that know my space and will make each of your guests feel at home. They will help you set up for event, answer all of your questions during set up of event (music, WiFi, lighting, TVs, supplies, AC/heat, parking, rooftop access, etc), buzz guests into building and up elevator, check jackets, fix and serve drinks, manage food stations, clean during and after your party. We do all the work so you can enjoy your time with your guests.
house_rules: No more than 65 guests. No smoking inside - smoking allowed on patio only. No one under 21 unless supervised by adults. No storage of personal belongs for guests.

neighborhood_overview: Our Washington Heights is a wonderful multicultural mix of families, artists, kids, professionals, musicians, doctors, scientists, students, locals, and world travelers. This narrow leafy strip of land by the river is an architectural gem with access to miles of walking trails. Come stay in a wonderful safe green enclave just a few short blocks from the subway, with quick access to all the amenities of New York City.
notes: We are full of ideas for unusual interesting things to do and places to go. It's really easy to get around NYC from here and we have loads of off-the-beaten-track suggestions if you are interested.
transit: You will be three short blocks from the 1 train, which takes you to Lincoln Center in 20 minutes, Times Square in 25 minutes, with stops for Central Park, MoMA, and the Museum of Natural History along the way. The 1 can take you all the way to the Statue of Liberty and Staten Island ferry without requiring you to change trains (phew!). The A and C trains are nearby as well, and the Bx6 stops outside and takes you straight to Yankee Stadium.
interaction: One of us will meet you or you can pick up/drop off keys at the (fantastic indie) coffee shop down the street. We'll be around if you need us, and we love helping.
house_rules: The door must remain locked at all time - it's a safe area, but it's still New York City!  No pets, no smoking, no parties. Light kitchen use only. We are vegan (well except for eating honey) so please don't cook any meat, fish, or dairy. it's fine if you keep butter or milk in the refrigerator but we prefer not to have them in our cookware. Be respectful of the neighbors. Use the dishes, towels, and sheets provided for you.

There is also the Path train to New Jersey on Christopher street between Washington and Greenwich streets or 9th street and 6th avenue. Buses run along Hudson street and stop between Perry street and West 11th or between Bleecker street and West 12th street

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is unique because you are just a few blocks away from the West Village and are in the heart of the Meatpacking district with all the new amazing restaurants, Chelsea Market, Apple Store, the Whitney Museum, incredible shopping and the High-line just steps away from the apartment. If you head one block North you find yourself in Chelsea with all its fabulous art galleries and restaurants.
notes: The apartment was recently renovated and decorated and is very cozy. It truly feels like a home away from home. It has one queen and one full bed and the pull out couch turns into a queen size bed. For families traveling with small children we can provide a cot, children's flatware and a changing cushion.

neighborhood_overview: Best hood ever!  You are a block away from the famous Shake Shack and Madison Square Park (MSP) and within walking distance from Flatiron, Gramercy, Chelsea, Murry Hill, East Village and even lower Midtown from this perfectly-located Manhattan apartment! In the immediate vicinity, there are always activities going on in and around MSP: Concerts, lounging on the lawn, and Madison Square Eats food tents in the summer and fall.  Eately is also across the street from MSP and you can purchase some of the freshest ingredients to cook in your huge kitchen or eat in their amazing mini restaurants or those in in the surrounding neighborhoods.  If you want some awesome dining recommendations then head over to Irving street in Gramercy, just four blocks away.  My absolute favorite is Casa Mono.  Pete's Tavern is also a great place for burgers and beer.  There is also Ichabods and Yama sushi.  Molly's on 3rd ave. is also an very old authentic Irish Bar that you should check out for a beer or to es
notes: We have a keyed elevator for security.  Nobody can access our floor except for those who live on it.  The key is a pain to replace so if the keys are lost, there will be a $50 replacement fee.  So try not to loose those keys:)
transit: One of the best benefits of this centralized location is how close you are to public transportation that will easily get you to anywhere in New York City. You are steps away from the 6 train at 23rd street.  The 6 will get you everywhere on the east side.  If you just walk to Madison Square Park at 23rd you can jump on the N and R trains which take you up and down central Manhattan and the upper west side.  Union Square is walkable and from there you can get on almost any train going anywhere.  Take the L from union square to the bedford stop to explore Williamsburg, Brooklyn or take the L to 8th avenue to explore the meatpacking district in Manhattan.
interaction: I live next door and Im around to help out with anything under the sun and can also assist with tenants getting acclimated and acquainted with the City to the extent that it's helpful but I will otherwise stay out of your hair.
house_rules: Our building is somewhat small with very few neighbors who live in the building year-around.  I just ask that you are respectful of others during your visit.  ***Please let me know in advance of your arrival and departure times.  Early check in and late check out must be arranged in advance***

neighborhood_overview: The building/apartment is located 5-minute walk from the A Express (JFK direct) or #1 subway lines, on a pretty leafy street, but just a block from Broadway, in the Hudson Heights area, which is small, quiet, safe and upscale portion of bigger Washington Heights, adjacent to breath-taking Fort Tryon Park given to the city by Rockefeller in 1930's. The world-famous Cloisters Museum in the middle of the park is a true gem (it is part of the Metropolitan Museum of Arts). Most of the buildings were constructed in the 1920s through 1940s. The Art Deco style is prominent, along with Tudor Revival. Notable complexes include Hudson View Gardens and Castle Village. It has the highest natural point in Manhattan, located in Bennett Park (265 feet (81 m) above sea level. Hudson Heights is one of the few neighborhoods left in Manhattan with that real old New York feel - a wonderful multicultural mix of families, artists, professionals, students, and locals with old European roots.  The larger Washi
transit: It takes 10-minute subway (A or #1) ride to Columbia University, 20 minutes to Columbus Circle, Central Park, and Lincoln Center, 25 minutes to 42nd Street or Time Sq., 30 minutes to Chelsea or Greenwich Village, 35 minutes to SoHo, 40 minutes to Tribeca or Financial District, 50 minutes to Brooklyn Heights. It is 20-minute slow walk to Columbia Presbyterian Hospital/Medical Center or Yeshiva University. 3 subway stations are only a short walk away and typically runs 24 hours, 7day a week, 365 days (please check MTA website for up to date status) – only 5 minutes to 1 train (191st stop) or A train (191st stop or 180th stop). It is also a block away from Broadway bus stop (Bx7 and M100) and few blocks away from Fort Washington Avenue bus stop (M4). Also George Washington Bridge NY/NJ Port Authority Bus Station just ten blocks away provides easy access to transportation to New Jersey (including busses to major Shopping Malls). Metro North stations with trains to Up State New York or Gran
interaction: We are glad to help you plan your stay in NYC and answer any questions you may have! Upon arrival, we will help you with the basics questions of NYC living so that you can hit the ground running to find your own Adventures (Information on MetroCard, good shopping areas, restaurants, comedy shows, fun Straight/LGBT bars, and clubs).

I can offer you to wait and relax in my room or store your luggage while you explore the area while I make up your room.

notes: Copacetic co-existence is key. In order to avoid misunderstandings please keep in mind that's no visitors or additional guests! I only host ONE PERSON.

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is right in between Alphabet City and the LES. Alphabet City is one of the hippest neighborhoods in NYC boasting numerous bars, restaurants and cafes all within walking distance of the apartment. The area also is well-known for its quaint public gardens, and our apartment is right next to East River State Park.
transit: The F Subway line at 2nd Ave is a 10 minute away. The apartment is only one block away from the 14D bus, which is a short ride to Union Square. There you can transfer to multiple train lines reaching all of New York's sightseeing destinations. Both busses and subways in NYC work with the same "Metrocard".
interaction: I give guests their privacy and space, but can offer any recommendations or answer any questions you have during your stay.
house_rules: Please keep the bathroom tidy.  Limited use of the kitchen and microwave are allowed, but no cooking, as the common area is a small space and the noise carries into the bedrooms. Bikes cannot be stored in the apartment.

neighborhood_overview: Amazing neighborhood, all the charm of midtown without the having to fight your way through crowds on every block. There is countless restaurants, plenty of bars and grocery stores all within walking distance. There's a laundromat less than a block away and two trains within walking distance. The natural museum of history is a couple stops away and central park is only one block down the street.
notes: This is a place for travelers who don't care about share the spaces with the others.
transit: Two trains within walking distance, one about 5 and the other about 10 minutes away. Both will get you into the heart of the city (time square/mid-town) within about 10 minutes. Conveniently situated between 2 subway stations (103 Street & 110 Street) on the B/C line. They are 3 blocks away, which is approximately a 5-minute walk. The 1 (red) line is located on Broadway and 103 Street, which is about at 10-minute walk from the apartment.
interaction: I've set up the room so that you have most everything you'll need inside it. So while me will be at the house you can spend as little time with me as you like. Also free boats, lunch specials, happy hours, discounts for musicals and concerts, all the information that the travelers should know to have more fun and save more money. neighborhood_overview: My apartment lies at the edge of the classic East Village neighborhood, which boasts a variety of restaurants and bars, a large supermarket, Target store, convenience stores, Tompkins Square Park, St Mark's Place, and much more - not to mention a full service laundromat and dry cleaning facility at the ground level!
transit: There is normally street parking around the apartment, if you plan on driving in. The L subway at 1st Ave is conveniently located two blocks west of the apartment on 14th St and 1st Ave. This train provides access to all of Manhattan and surrounding boroughs so it's extremely convenient. It runs very often as well so you'll never have to wait more than a few minutes for it. There is a crosstown bus (M14 A & D) that picks up right near the apartment as well!
interaction: I will be available by phone for the duration of your stay. Text message is the preferred method of communication, but if it's an emergency please feel free to call me. I'm in and out during the week as I'm normally busy with work, and on the weekends I like to be out and about with friends; but, sometimes I'll spend a quiet day at home to catch up on reading, cleaning, etc. Either way, you won't see to much of me although you can always count on me to be friendly, respectful, and available for assistance if necessary.
house_rules: Please keep all living areas as clean as possible and kindly remove shoes at the door. You will be sharing the space with myself, but because I work most of the day and workout at the gym afterward, I am really only there to eat dinner and sleep. I will need to use the bathroom/shower to get ready for work in the mornings but I can provide more specific details regarding timing upon your arrival.

neighborhood_overview: Merry Hill offers wonderful restaurants at competitive prices. There is also 34th St. one of the main shopping hubs as well as the Empire State Building. And depending on your mobility you can walk to fifth Avenue for some of the best shopping in the world.  You have the option to take a car service, such as Lyft, Juno, Uber, Via, regular yellow cab, Citibike, subway, or  bus. The best way is walking though. You’d be surprised at all there is to see, and how fast you’ll arrive,  without the aggravation of city traffic.
notes: There's wireless as well as wired Internet service cable TV with HBO,  gym access, coffee maker, free Nespresso, bottled water, ice maker with filtered water and a full kitchen.
transit: The M 34 bus is one block south which covers the entire city (east to west). From the M 34 bus you can access the 6 train (or 6 minute walk). N, R, Q, 1, 2, 3 and A, C, & E trains as well (to go north and south). In a short walk six blocks you can access Grand Central Station to go to further destinations such as Westchester or the botanical gardens.
interaction: The owners  are available for any questions you might have all through your stray from the time you pick up the key till the time you leave.. This is done through text messaging or email if you prefer.
house_rules: Guests should be aware that this is our home and as such we expect you to leave the house the way you found it. Guests are not allowed in main home downstairs (except for using the 3rd floor bathroom if needed) and the gym in the basement. We don't expect other guests staying other than yourself or you and your guest.

neighborhood_overview: Apartment is located on a charming tree lined street walking distance to the Central Park, major museums, 5th Ave and Madison Ave.  Charming cafes, restaurants and bars surround. Banks, markets, convenience stores are right next door. Starbucks across the street. We are also steps from the East River Promenade, a lovely park and gorgeous river views. Close to 4,5,6 subway to get you downtown to 911 memorial and Statue of Liberty in minutes.
notes: The apartment is very convenient to everything. Starbucks, 24hour convenience stores, laundries, banks, cafes, and restaurants are just steps away from the building. There are three grocery markets within a block and a fresh fruit stand around the corner.  I am happy to give you as many suggestions as you like as well as my favorite spots and restaurants. There are several inexpensive and affordable good eating spots close by including a great diner and cafe on our corner. I have a kitchen with stove but ask that you do not cook meals beyond breakfast eggs, soup or similar, and boiling water for tea.  The kitchen is a compact area and there are too many fantastic food options outside including three grocery markets around the corner; 2 minute walk. You can store your purchased food items in the guest cupboard or refrigerator. Light breakfast of coffee, tea, biscotti.  In the U.S. the first floor/ floor 1 is the ground entrance floor. Our apartment is three flights up in a walk up build
transit: Public transportation in the neighborhood, and in the City in general, is fantastic.  We are closest to the subway stations at 2nd Ave and 83rd Street (Q train) and at 77th Street and Lexington Ave (4,5,6 trains). Bus lines on the corner will take you to Central Park, Midtown, Upper West Side,  and generally anywhere you want to go.  We are on the same street as the Metropolitan Museum! About a 15 minute walk to the Met and Central Park.   Wonderful Madison Ave is even closer.  There are parking garages on all corners. Uber, taxis and shuttles can easily get you to and from the apartment and JFK/LGA.  Grand Central Train Station is a 10 minute cab ride away and also conveniently accessible by bus, from there you can take trains to Boston, Washington D.C., Connecticut, etc.
interaction: I am friendly and laid back and will be available should you have any questions while allowing you your privacy. I am rarely home as I work a lot. If you book the entire apt, I will be away during your stay but accessible. Please use instant Airbnb messaging to contact me at anytime. I am always easily accessible to make your stay a fantastic and memorable experience!
house_rules: Only guests on the reservation may enter the apartment building. Pls no smoking in apt or in front of building, illegal drugs, candles/incense, or disruptive behavior. Pls do not give out/share our keys or our address or download illegal or pirated content via wifi. Unfortunately can't accommodate medical or mobility issues. No animals or pets. We usually are unable to accomodate guestsMoo luggage after checkout time. No cooking please. Lock door always, going out and coming in. Deliveries, please check with host first. Please use Airbnb messaging to contact me at anytime before or during your stay! Thank you :)no

neighborhood_overview: Vintage Manhattan!  Harlem's historic Sugar Hill neighborhood is still home to international jazz greats.  Quiet, tree-lined streets, gorgeous rows of 19th century townhouses, fast subway access to downtown attractions, short 18-minute walk to Yankee Stadium. Short walk to restaurants, cafes, supermarkets, Riverbank State Park (olympic-size pool, sports fields, winter ice-skating), as well as family-friendly playgrounds and basketball courts. After a hectic day of site-seeing you'll enjoy returning to the serenity of our lovely neighborhood.
notes: Our house was built in 1886 and we have mostly original wood floors and staircases — very beautiful and also very squeaky. You'll hear us walking above you very clearly!  Check-in is 4pm or later (ok to leave luggage in the hallway from 12noon), check-out is 10am or earlier (ok to leave luggage in the hallway until 1pm).
transit: Extremely convenient subway access via the A, B, C, D and #1 subway lines, as well as bus service on both corners.
interaction: I've prepared a detailed guide book with local restaurant, cafe and food delivery options, and I'm also available via the Airbnb app for questions and concerns.
house_rules: Our block is quiet and residential so no parties or late night noise.  Also no pets, smoking, drugs or unapproved film/video shoots. Thanks!

neighborhood_overview: The East Village/Union Square/Gramercy are the greatests NYC neighborhoods Manhattan has to offer. Anyone can go see lights in times square but all true NY'ers want to live downtown Manhattan because it's the true heart beat of NYC and makes you feel alive. I've lived here for just over six years and I absolutely love it for its vibrancy, good vibes, endless supply of restaurants and bars, fantastic local shops, great coffee, etc.
notes: There are umbrellas to borrow and NYC/Brooklyn/NY State guide books to use. Check In: after 4pm - 24 hours (lock box) Check Out: by noon Please ask about early/late check in & check out. transit: Our apartment is very conveniently located in between the Third Avenue and Second Avenue on 15th street, a 3 minute walk from Union Square, where there are a multitude of transportation options (7 different subway lines (N, Q, R, L, 4, 5, 6) and buses). neighborhood_overview: The Soho Neighborhood covers Canal St. to Houston St., Lafayette St. to Hudson River. Great bars, restaurants, and retail. Bustling during the day, relatively quiet at night, expensive all the time. "New Yorkers of all designations—young, new, native and salty curmudgeon alike—are famously passionate in both their enthusiasms and their critiques. If they dislike a book, movie or restaurant, you'll know about it. But if they love it, they'll shout it from the rooftops and over social media feeds, extolling the spot until it becomes a sensation. At the moment, the cronut—an ingenious hybrid of a croissant and a donut—has taken top position on the tastemaker hot lists, and, perhaps unsurprisingly, this dream confection lives in SoHo."    * nycgo SoHo has often been the epicenter for New York City trends, eliciting no small amount of both praise and excoriation from the locals. The neighborhood is characterized by Belgian block streets and cast iron–facade buildings with enormously high ce
notes: We can be flexible with check-in & check-out times but must be discussed after your itinerary has been made.  Additionally an early check-in (11 am & earlier) & a late check-out (after 4pm) will require an additional day rate.  The apartment comes with a microwave, toaster, coffeemaker all the necessary tools to cook meals.  There are no pantry items.   The apartment itself is fully renovated but the quaint Greek Revival townhouse contains quite a bit of history since its two centuries old. Please note that we do not allow children under 12 yrs old to stay in the apt.  The apt. does not have safety gates on the windows and the terrace railing isn't fully integrated to keep children in.   Also we do not allow parties of any kind.
transit: Public Transportation: Most major bus lines and subways run right through Soho and there are Citibike stations throughout the neighborhood.  Our home is one block from the C/E and 1 trains, and a short walk to the F/D/B/Q/A/2/3/N/R and 6 trains. Taxis: Taxis and Uber cars are everywhere in SoHo. By Foot: New Yorkers love to walk and, especially during the mild weathered months, taking a stroll through SoHo is the best way to see the area. Walk through our tree lined streets and discover welcoming cafes, restaurants, art galleries and shops.  The guest book includes bus & subway maps for you to use during your stay.
interaction: As our guest we want you to enjoy an uninterrupted personal experience. We live downstairs and can be available to help you settle in once you arrive.  We are happy to help with any tourist info or restaurant suggestions during your stay. We are always available to be reached by cell phone, text or email with any inquiries.  There is a guest book to help with instructions & recommendations.
house_rules: The following are NOT allowed in the apartment:  smoking, pets, shoes, small children, parties, loud music or tv.   Quiet hours are from 10pm - 9am.  No rearranging of furniture.   Smoking on the terrace is not allowed but the public park out front has charming benches for people watching and your smoking pleasure.   Please be courteous and polite to the neighbors in the building. If something is lost or broken during your stay you will need to pay for it's replacement.

neighborhood_overview: This is a very elegant part of town, the Lenox Hill Historic District. Ours is one of a select few in this area on Airbnb.
notes: Please note that this is the most luxurious part of New York City, a relatively quiet and stately area in the midst of shopping, museums and right next to Central Park. We strive to make you feel very at home in this exclusive area, and our reviews show that so far we are doing a good job of that! We are honored to have hosted honeymoons, anniversaries, gallererists - and many return guests!

neighborhood_overview: The historic Striver's Row neighborhood is named for the upper middle class families that lived in these rows of brownstones in the early 20th century -- literally striving to make a better life for themselves. This is a great location from which to explore Harlem and the rest of NYC. You will find yourself blocks from several prestigious art and cultural sites like the Schaumburg Museum. You are close to famous Harlem attractions like the Apollo Theater, the Cotton Club, the Red Rooster Restaurant, Ginny's Supper Club and the Corner Social. Not to mention the famous Sylvia Restaurant.
transit: Looking to get downtown?  Take a short walk to the number 2, 3, 6, or A/B/C subway lines for easy access to mid-town, the WTC, Wall Street and Soho neighborhoods.  The Harlem Experience is the perfect place to get to know historic Harlem while having the rest of the city at your fingertips.
interaction: If you need anything, feel free to contact me with any questions.
house_rules: Maximum 3 people.  Absolutely no smoking allowed.  Be respectful of the neighbors - no loud noise after 10:00 pm

neighborhood_overview: This home is on a beautiful, residential, quiet tree-lined block, yet there is easy access to tourist attractions and nightlife.  Located close to Central Park, the room is within walking distance of Riverside Park, the Museum of Natural History, The Children's Museum, the Beacon Theater, Lincoln Center, Symphony Space, and Columbia University. The Metropolitan Museum and the Guggenheim Museum are directly across Central Park, a lovely walk away. We are close to restaurants, retail shops, grocery stores, delis, cinema multiplexes, and pharmacies. Citibank, Chase, TD Bank, Commerce Bank, Capital One are all within a 2-block radius.  We are in close proximity to West Side Highway and the George Washington Bridge. The Upper West Side is an affluent, primarily residential area with many of its' residents working in more commercial areas in Midtown and Lower Manhattan. neighborhood_overview: Here are some of the local attractions that are just a few blocks from us: Bars/Restaurants- Inoue, Tio Luca, Yuzu, Red Rooster (live music), Babbalucci, Sylvia's Soul Food, Jacob's Restaurant, Ginny's Supper Club (live music), Lenox Sapphire, Chez Lucien (live music), Corner Social, Cove Lounge, Gin Fizz (live music), Chaiwali, Cheri (live music), Harlem Shake, Blvd Bistro, Barawine (live music), Settepani, Sexy Taco-Dirty Cash, Astor Row Cafe, Minton's (live music), The Cecil, Harlem Tavern, Maison Harlem, Ponty Bistro, The Shrine (live music), ... Plus many, many more that are just a few blocks further and too plentiful to list here!  Culture- National Black Theatre, The Apollo, Maysles Cinema, Studio Museum of Harlem, National Jazz Museum, MIST Harlem, American Legion Jazz Club, The Shrine... to name a few! Grocery stores, bodegas/delis, coffee shops and many shopping options are also located nearby.  New places open every day...Harlem really is the place to be!
transit: We are conveniently located by two major subway lines: the 2/3 on the West side and the 4/5/6 on the East side.  Both are a 5-7 minute walk from our house and both will quickly get you to any other part of the city that you wish to explore.  Times Square and the Theater District are just 20-30 minutes away!  We are also a 5 minute walk away from the Metro North train line, which will take you anywhere North of the city.  Taxis are easily flagged on the avenues surrounding our block, and Uber and other local car services are always just a phone call away.
interaction: We live upstairs from the garden rental apartment and are always available via phone/text/email if you need anything!  We try to meet you in person when you arrive, and if we're available we will also check you out when you depart.  Otherwise, the keys are accessible via a lockbox in on the entrance gate to the apartment.
house_rules: No smoking in the apartment or in the garden area just outside the apartment.  Please step out to the curb if you need to smoke, as we do not want it to bother our neighbors.  Sorry, no more than 4 people!

neighborhood_overview: The Neighborhood: Sugar Hill and Hamilton Heights are a lovely neighborhood of elegant row-houses in an area that once served as the country retreat for the city's wealthy, at a time when the city included just southern Manhattan. Alexander Hamilton. a prominent statesman in the 1780s, built his country home, The Grange, on his estate just south of where 145th Street is now. Today The Grange is part of the National Parks system and can be visited at the north end of St. Nicholas Park. When the train lines were extended north to this area in the 1880s the land was developed into elegant townhouses. During the Harlem Renaissance in the 1920s and 1930s, African Americans made their mark on NYC as they had never been permitted to do so before. The north end of Hamilton Heights was known as Sugar Hill, for the sweet life available to those who could afford it. The neighborhood is full of magnificent architecture in a variety of turn-of-the-century styles on quiet tree-lined streets dotted w

Some of the local favorites include; The Cloisters/Fort Tryon Park (be sure to check out the MET's medieval collection here), George Washington Bridge, Hudson River Greenway and many other historic destinations (don't forget your camera). neighborhood_overview: Historic West Harlem neighborhood with some of the most beautiful brownstone townhouses in the world. Also across the street is the beautiful St. Nicholas park with rolling hills, a gorgeous bucolic college campus (City College of New York), and a beautiful wooded area. Abyssinian church and Founding father Alexander Hamilton's House, a U.S. National Landmark, is a 5-minute walk from your doorstep.  At the edge of Harlem and Hamilton Heights, this quiet corner of New York is still one of its best kept secrets. Steps away from a beautiful walk in St. Nicholas park or City College, or a stroll down Striver's Row, you can enjoy dinner at The Grange or breakfast at the Edge, only 3 blocks away.
notes: AMATEUR NIGHT at the APOLLO is a must! This is the theater where many stars were born. The Jackson Five, James Brown, Ella Fitzgerald, Billie Holiday, Stevie Wonder all launched their careers here! The Apollo is a place where talented performers sing their hearts out in the hopes of becoming a star.
transit: A fantastic spot for transportation. The apartment is conveniently located half a block from the B & C trains at 135th street station and there are many buses available right on St Nicholas avenue. Make sure you purchase an Unlimited Weekly pass for $32 from the subway station, which allows you to ride buses and use the subway as many times as you like. It takes just 10 minutes on the train to get to midtown, and it's a 20-minute trip from LaGuardia and 45 minutes - 1 hour from Newark and JFK via taxi - See above description for details

neighborhood_overview: This historic neighborhood is called Marble Hill and has an interesting history as a marble mine and revolutionary war site.  It is actually the northern most neighborhood in Manhattan, even though it is attached to the Bronx, because the river used to go above Marble Hill but was re-routed in the 1910s.  (URL HIDDEN)    Our neighborhood borders Kingsbridge and Riverdale in the Bronx, with dozens of restaurants and shops to explore, along with the beautiful Van Cortland Park, which is great for hiking and even has horse stables.  (URL HIDDEN) The neighborhood has many residents from Latin American, Cuba and the Dominican Republic and thus has great Caribbean restaurants with rice, beans and roasted chicken.  The area also has a large number of big box stores like Target, TJ Maxx, Sports Authority and Marshalls if you need to do any shopping.  Our favorite grocery store is called Garden Gourmet (Broadway and 233rd) for its fresh fruit and vegetables and huge variety of take-out prepared
notes: You will not be disappointed with this beautiful space, but please note there are two queen beds and one fold out couch, so ideal for families who can share. Please be aware that our house is built on a hill and has three stories of stairs, so please do not reserve unless you can handle stairs.  Also, we have a very friendly dog in first level of the main house, which you walk through to get to the private apartment. ID required upon check in!
transit: The best thing about living here is the many choices of transportation to the center of town.  We have the Marble Hill Station of the Metro North Commuter Train which is a five minute walk from the front door. This service gets you to Grand Central Station on 42nd and Park Avenue in 20 minutes.   You can also choose the subway, which runs 24 hours a day in New York.  The “1" subway is one of the best lines because you don't have to wait longer than 5 minutes for a train.  The 225th Street stop is also five minute walk from our front door.  This train runs all the way down the west side of Manhattan and takes you eventually down to South Ferry and the boat to the Staten Island or to the Statue of Liberty.  If you are in a hurry, you can walk 15 minutes south on Broadway from our house to the first stop of the “A" subway line, which is an express train that can take you all the way to JFK Airport or to Brooklyn. neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located on a beautiful tree-lined street that is protected by the NYC Landmark Commission in the heart of New York's most historic neighborhoods, the Hamilton Heights district on the Upper West Side of Manhattan including Alexander Hamilton's historic home which is one block away. (The building is located on grounds that once were Alexander Hamilton's 35 acre farm.) Because we are in the middle of a landmarked district, commercial development is limited – the wonderful advantages of that are lovely tree-lined streets filled with beautiful townhouses and small apartment houses that were built in the 1800's and early 1900's and no tall modern skyscrapers obstructing the natural light and the views. Some of our streets are a little hilly but many feel that only adds to their charm and to the views – from the corner of our street, you can see the beautiful skyline including the Empire State Building.
notes: You can easily get to Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts and the fabulous Museum Mile, including the Metropolitan Museum of Art, The Whitney Museum of American Art, the Guggenheim, The Museum of the City of New York, etc. The Museum of Natural History is readily accessible, as is the NY Historical Society with its fascinating exhibits. SoHo and Tribeca, with their unique, interesting shops and galleries, are a quick subway ride away.  New York's famous and unique Fairway Market is a cab ride or 15-minute walk away. Virtually every store and restaurant in the area delivers to your apartment. Both Central Park and Riverside Park have biking/walking paths that are closed to traffic.
transit: The apartment is just steps from several bus lines (1/2 block), and four blocks away from two of the three major subway lines in the city making all of the city's wonderful attractions easily and quickly accessible. Cabs are always readily available as well.
interaction: Harriet and I live on the upper floors and are available to assist guests in any way.
house_rules: As you would expect others in their own home space.

neighborhood_overview: We are located in a landmark district surrounding Manhattan's oldest home, the Jumel Mansion. You can take a yoga class for $5 most Saturdays and Sundays. Yankee Stadium is a 20 minute walk over the Macombs Dam Bridge.  Another highlight is the newly renovated High Bridge. Other nearby highlights include the Hudson River, Columbia Presbyterian Hospital and Medical School, and the Hispanic Society. This historic neighborhood has everything you need!  You are steps to the train and to midtown in 20 minutes.  You are around the corner from supermarket, laundromat, parks, and other businesses.

neighborhood_overview: While getting all around New York from this apartment is a breeze, some of the best of New York is right in the neighborhood.   Whether you're looking for Michelin starred dining like that of Dovetail, Telepan, or Jean George.  Or perhaps NYC's culture is what you seek. Amazing museums like the Museum of Natural History, the New York Historical Society, or the Children's Museum of Manhattan are all nearby. Of course, some people come to New York just for Broadway, but don't forget about Lincoln Center.  Home to some of the best dance, music, film, opera, and theater in the world and just a lovely walk away. Perhaps the icons of the small and big screens are what bring you here. The settings of some of your favorite TV shows and movies can all be found within blocks.  Annie Hall? You've Got Mail? Seinfeld? All took place on the Upper West Side.
transit: The apartment is located just steps from Central Park, and a short stroll from both the B and C trains at 86th Street as well as the 81st Street Museum of Natural History Subway Stop.  Just a bit further is the 1 train accessible from either the 79th Street or 86th Street Stations on Broadway.   If you prefer busses the crosstown M79 & M86  busses are both nearby, as well as the North/South busses M10 (on Central Park West), the M7 & M11 on Columbus and Amsterdam Avenues, the M104 on Broadway, and the M5 on Riverside Drive.  Of course, this being New York City, taxis as well as Ubers are readily available.   If biking is your thing, a Citi Bike station is located on the block.  Fancy a day trip outside the city? A variety of rental car companies have office just a block away on 83rd Street.
interaction: My office is just downstairs and my home is just a few blocks away.  So I'm usually pretty easily reached in case your need or anything, even if it's just a restaurant recommendation.
house_rules: Please no smoking, no drugs, and no big parties. Please treat my place as you would treat your own home.

neighborhood_overview: The area is extremely safe with five 24 hour doorman buildings on the block. Only a seven minute walk to the metro / subway and 2 blocks from the United Nations. Located at the crossroads of some of NYC's finest and most convenient neighborhoods including Turtle Bay, Beekman, Sutton and Midtown East. Prime location, safe and accessible to everything. In walking distance, you will find some of the finest restaurants and shopping in NYC. The ease of access to Broadway Shows and Times Square just across town makes this unit a wonderful starting and ending point for any holiday or business trip. Whole Foods is just 7 blocks away and 2 local supermarkets are within 2 blocks. The East River Promenade is 1 block away, having one of the city's best dog runs, water views and running paths. We look forward to your stay!
notes: or your additional comfort, we have also supplied a HEPA Air Purifier with UV-C which offers multiple levels of cleaning to help improve the indoor air quality. It features multiple levels of cleaning including HEPA, UV-C and charcoal. This air purifier captures 99.97% of particles down to .3 microns in size.

neighborhood_overview: The neighbor is lively and has very active night life and plenty of diversity of cultures and food. The back yard of the apartment, is Isham Park and Inwood Hill Park and also there's Bruce Reynolds community Garden. This garden honors the memory of, a Port Authority Police Officer, who on the morning of September, rushed from his post at the George Washington Bridge into the inferno of the World Trade Center, sacrificing his life to save others.  Community garden and Most visitors get their first glimpse of the neighborhood when visiting the area's best known cultural attraction, The Cloisters in Fort Tryon Park. This branch of the Metropolitan Museum of Art is devoted to Medieval art and culture, and is located in a medieval-style building, portions of which were purchased in Europe, brought to the United States, and reassembled. Whether the museum itself is actually located in Inwood depends on one's definition of the neighborhood boundaries but its tower dominates the skyline of th

Nevertheless the apartment, is marvelously clean and perfectly in order.
