neighborhood_overview: Hell's Kitchen is the pinnacle example of what New York is: There are hundreds, maybe even a thousand different types of restaurants in this neighborhood, you expect anything from Afghan to Zimbabwean. Do expect to hear at least one hundred different languages spoken, and to see people of all shapes, sizes and color.  Times Square is at most an 8 min walk from the accommodation, numerous train (metro) stations are within walking distance and even Central Park is only a 10-15 minute walk. Surrounded by many great Italian, Greek, Turkish, Japanese, Mexican, Thai restaurants and American dinners.  Bars and pubs, 24-hour stores, pharmacies and open-late restaurants. There are even some discotheques nearby.
notes: I would like to mention that this is New York – not Townsville, Alabama – sometimes there will be loud noises coming from the streets, cars honking or traffic at 03:00 (AM), for the most part, however, Hell's Kitchen is a rather quiet and calm neighborhood with welcoming arms to all travellers of the world. Please read the description, and discuss with me before booking, I like to get a feel for all my travelers and provide them with the best possible service.  I invite all to read the reviews posted about me and this accommodation or the reviews of my other listings, and I welcome all guests to my location :)  Feel free to ask any questions.
transit: The best way to get to know New York is walking, and I am a strong advocate of this. Much of the main attractions are within walking distance. When walking can be too much, or the weather isn't at its best, the train (metro) is the next best option. All major subways A/C/E, R/Q/N, 1/2/3, 7, S - 6/5/4 trains only blocks away!  Many buses that can take you around town.  Port Authority only few blocks away.
interaction: I understand that some guests prefer their privacy, while other guests love to get a more authentic feel for the city and ask me for tips, suggestions and even a tour – I interact with guests as much as guests are willing :)  The first day I give an entire explanation of the accommodation and sometimes a small tour of the neighborhood to help guests settle right in. I live in the same building as this accommodation, so I am always within arm's length and I'm always happy to share a cup of tea or coffee :) I am constantly studying and preparing for examinations, but I am more than happy to give any recommendations, suggestions and tips when it comes to sightseeings in New York, or with help finding a true New York experience.  Also whenever guests are in need of certain assistances, I am more than ready to help. I am always with in reach, easy to contact and in the event that I am not physically available I always leave either my older brother or mother mindful of guests.
house_rules: Please, no Smoking. No parties. No drugs. No guests. I welcome all guest to stay at this accommodation, I simply ask to treat this home as if we're your home. This is not a place for partying. I also ask guests to refrain from allowing their own guests from staying.

neighborhood_overview: This home is on a tree-lined block close to public transportation,  upscale boutiques, hospitals, neighborhood restaurants Bloomingdales, and Grace's market. It is three blocks from Madison Avenue shopping.
notes: There is a washer dryer in the kitchen area for your exclusive use. This is a four floor walk-up but there is an elevette for your luggage and it is worth the climb. This apartment is not handicapped accessible.
transit: The apartment is two blocks from the Lexington line 6 train, and 7 blocks from the M/F trains, one block from the new Q train and 10 blocks to the R/N trains. It is on a cross town bus route and  five blocks from Central Park. Uber, Via and taxis also work well. Several 24-hour parking garages are within a block.
interaction: We both live and work out of the townhouse which is a small doctor's office within the home.  We are here to make sure your stay is pleasant, private, and serene.  Cleaning services and babysitting can be arranged.
house_rules: Due to NYC and NYS sales tax requirements, at the time of check in, we are required to collect sales tax of approximately 16% of the amount paid to us through AirBNB.  This amount is to be payable in cash or travelers check. This is a private home with a doctor’s office.    Please respect our privacy and tranquility of the house, the patients and other guests.   Most guests walk up to the apartment through the house stairs, but there is also a small Elevette which you can use for privacy or if you are tired after a busy day in Manhattan.   Please keep the house quiet and peaceful when traversing the stairs both during office hours and if the hour is late.   We also expect our guests to be discrete and respectful as they walk through the house.

neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Harlem! The neighborhood is much quieter than downtown locations but is still active at all hours with plenty of bars and restaurants in the area.  You can rest assured in this safe area across from a quiet park and college campus. The area is home to many students and has a number of unique restaurants with great ambience. Explore this area with so much history.  Alexander Hamilton's house sits preserved in the park just across the street and the famed Apollo Theater is just a few streets down.
notes: (This listing is currently for the entire apartment and I will not be sharing the space as usual) This listing is for a private room in a two bedroom apartment. Your host Matt will share the space with you and stay in his own private room on the other end of the apartment. The apartment is a 5th floor walk up. No elevator, so please be prepared for the climb. I am happy to coordinate with you to assist in bringing up your bags. This apartment is located in uptown Manhattan, in the neighborhood of West Harlem. While it is well connected to midtown and downtown via the express trains just a few streets away, it is not within walking distance of those areas. Occasionally, guests will require a late check out.  I'm happy to accommodate when possible. Please reach out so that we can look into this for you.
transit: There is an express train station just 4 streets down from the apartment which will take you directly into midtown with one stop—about fifteen minutes. There are also local trains at this station which can take you south to the Museum of Natural History or north to Yankee Stadium. The station name is 125th Street and can be accessed on both 125th St and even closer on 127th St.
interaction: (This listing is currently for the entire apartment and I will not be sharing the space as usual) Im happy to allow privacy and offer you a more independent stay.  But I'm also very friendly and social and would love to enjoy some time with you! I am pretty good at intuitively adapting to whatever your expectations may be. I work 10AM to 6PM during the week and am usually around in the evenings and on the weekends.
house_rules: All guests should be cleared with the host before arriving and be included in the booking. The rooftop is good for smoking. Please no smoking in the apartment. Tea and coffee is provided and spices are free for guest use—please ask your host about any other food and drink in the apartment. When in doubt, just ask! We're here for you and want you to enjoy your stay.

neighborhood_overview: Welcome to Hell's Kitchen, one of the most exciting neighborhoods in Midtown Manhattan. Surrounded by lots of coffee shops, restaurants, fancy rooftops, bars, clubs, amazing night life and entertainment. The apartment is very close walking to many major touristic attractions, like Times Square, the Theater District and Broadway Shows. Very close to Lincoln Center, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Moma Museum, Metropolitan Museum and much more. Shopping areas like, Columbus Circle, the 5th avenue & 57th Street, Herald Square 34th street etc Only two avenues away from the Hudson River, with amazing views of New Jersey, stunning sun sets, beautiful green areas, restaurants, outdoor concerts. Different activities by the river, like kayak or puddle surf. Circle Line Sightseeing Cruises and the chance to go by bike end to end, from lower manhattan to upper manhattan.
notes: This is a private bedroom in my two bedroom apartment, with living room, kitchen and bathroom to share with me (host and other guests). I'm in the 3rd floor of a walk up building. So reservations for 3 guests is perfectly fine, but please notice that the third guest will sleep in a sofa bed in the living room which is a common area. The private bedroom and living room are in one side of the apartment, my bedroom is in other, so you'll have plenty of privacy.  Important: Sofa-bed included only in 3 guest's booking. neighborhood_overview: Honestly, the best way to understand what our street feels like is to watch Russell Brand’s film “Arthur”. Yes, it is usually pretty calm area, but there is an above ground subway just like in the movie, and it can be loud. However, for many it is actually part of the charm and the real New York feel, and is literally just like in the movie we were featured in. However, we are sound-proofing the entire place using the services of Acoustical Surfaces Inc., to make it better for guests so you can tell your friends you were in the real New York without dealing with real New York problems :). So while it can be loud, having the train so close is a great thing, because you get to the very center of Manhattan faster than from most places in central Manhattan. Plus, we are around the corner from Broadway where you can get so much amazing food, and see how social and multi-cultural this part of New York is. We are basically right in between the two hottest new neighborhoods in the city - posh
notes: DIRTY CLOTHES? Accidents happen, and weather can be unpredictable, so we understand that sometimes you might need extra things from us. Luckily, we have some extra clothes in case you didn't prepare for the weather, umbrellas to protect from the rain, laundry machines to wash and dry dirty clothes, and a hair dryer for those who need it.
transit: As we mentioned, we are on the same street as the "Broadway" stop on the N or W line. It takes 10 minutes from there to arrive to the entrance of Central Park on 5th Avenue. Alternatively, you can rent a car and park it on the street or inside our garage.
interaction: WE ARE HERE FOR YOU! You should consider the fact that we live downstairs in the 1st floor a blessing - because you have your own private apartment, but we are always close by if you need help or questions answered. Before booking, it is best to give us all the details on your needs, such as the type of guests in your group (family and/or friends, young and/or old, small and/or big), and what amenities you absolutely need. Occasionally, when there is down time, we can take a tour of the neighborhood or chat. We are very friendly people who enjoy making sure that you have the best stay in NYC.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is called "Sugar Hill". It got its name in the 1920s when the neighborhood became a popular place for wealthy African Americans to live during the Harlem Renaissance. You will find the beautiful mansions where these prominent figures lived. The neighborhood has many trendy restaurants and bars. You will find near you national historic landmarks such as: The Yankee Stadium which is 10 minutes away. The Riverbank State Park where you will find the famous "Red Lighthouse" only 10 minutes away. Also, the "Morris-Jumel Mansion" located on 160 street which is now a museum.
notes: Please remember this is not a hotel. We do not have a 24/7 check in/check out. Please communicate your approximate arrival/departure time so we can plan our day accordingly.  Please clean up after yourself. All common areas will be cleaned once a week. The wifi signal is not as strong in this room because the apartment is big. However, you will have access to all common areas of the apartment for faster connection.  A small basket of toiletries is provided, It includes: shampoo, conditioner, shower gel & toothpaste. If any of us is home the day of your arrival you can check in earlier than 2pm but please ask before you reserve to ensure someone will be home to receive you. The bed can not hold more than 400lbs total. If you and your guests weight more than this please do not book my place because the bed will brake.
transit: You will have the ABCD trains 2 minutes away and the 1 train 7 minutes away. Also, there are buses right next to the trains. We are 20 minutes away from Time Square on the express train and 15 minutes away from Columbia University on the 1 train.
interaction: We are a respectful, quiet and helpful family of four adults. We will be gone most of the day but once we get home we are available to help you in any way and answer any questions you may have.

neighborhood_overview: Located in Manhattan, just north of Morningside Heights and southwest of Harlem with a variety of restaurants, bars, convenient stores and is located within walking distance. The neighborhood is safe, friendly and lively. The neighborhood is filled with Columbia students.  The apartment is centrally located between 2 subway lines which makes getting nearly anywhere in Manhattan easy. In addition, there's an app that allows you to travel to anywhere within Manhattan and certain areas in Brooklyn and Queens for just $6. Ask me for more information.
notes: Laundry: There's no laundry in the unit, but there's a free pick up/drop off (usually takes 1 day to wash, dry & fold) laundromat just two blocks away. It costs $1.25/pound. I can give you the contact if you need.

It is centrally located between 2 subway lines which makes getting nearly anywhere in Manhattan easy. The two station names are "125th Street”, which are both 7-8 minutes away from the apartment. Please refer to the map that I uploaded in the photo album.  Parking:  There are street parkings just beneath the apartment. Please refer to the street signs on NYC daily street cleaning.  In addition, apart from Uber, there's an app that allows you to travel to anywhere within Manhattan for $6 that I usually use. Please ask me for more information!

neighborhood_overview: We are located in the heart of Manhattan's Upper West Side -- home of the Natural History Museum, Lincoln Center, The Children's Museum, and the New York Historical Society.  We are 2 blocks from Central Park and 3 blocks from Riverside Park.  I personally love the fact that we are so close to the excitement of midtown (Times Square is a 25 minute walk from our house), but we still enjoy the peace of a family friendly neighborhood.
notes: Your apartment will be cleaned prior to your arrival.  However, if you would like to have the space cleaned during your stay, please give us 24 hours notice and we would be happy to provide you with cleaning services -- simply contact us for prices.  Also, please let me know your time of arrival at least two days in advance so that there someone available to greet you and give you the key...Similarly, please give me 24 hours notice of your expected departure time so that we may prepare the apartment for our next guests.
transit: Our space is very close to many subway stations and bus stops. It allows for a very easy commute all around New York City.  Taxis and Ubers are always easy to find as well, and we have a number of Citibike parking station located less than 5 blocks away.
interaction: When you arrive, someone will be here to greet you and provide you with a key.   Please feel free to contact me with any questions or concerns you may have -- our family greatly enjoys offering advice about our favorite restaurants, shops and destinations around the city. I work from home so I am often available for a coffee when I am not traveling -- feel free to stop by!
house_rules: The garbage needs to be separated into waste, paper, and plastic/metal.  You will find garbage containers for waste (black trash bags), paper (clear trash bags), and plastic/metal (blue trash bags) in the closet underneath the stairs in the foyer of the apartment.  Also, I will need to come into the apartment occasionally during your stay to gain access to the basement.  However,  I will be sure to text you in advance to assure that I am not disturbing you.

Turn left off the stoop and walk until you hit Marcus Garvey Park. Playground, running path and duck pound is 4 blocks west of the apartment. Turn right off the stoop and walk until you hit Morningside Park. Whole Foods Harlem is 2 blocks north on Lenox Avenue. It has a coffee breakfast stand, great salad bar and for pharmacy needs there is a CVS directly across the street.  125 and Lenox is the Time Square of Harlem and has every kind of shop you might be looking for. Turn left off the stoop and walk until you hit Marcus Garvey Park. Playground, running path and duck pound is 4 blocks west of the apartment. Turn right off the stoop and walk until you hit Morningside Park. Whole Foods Harlem is 2 blocks north on Lenox Avenue. It has a coffee breakfast stand, great salad bar and for pharmacy needs there is a CVS directly across the street.  125 and Lenox is the Time Square of Harlem and has every kind of shop you might be looking for. neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is West Soho, a cool area of the City just two blocks from Classic Greenwich Village and two blocks from Tribeca.    It's very safe and convenient to everything.  My building is filled with artists and families.      It's also right near the Hudson River where you can stroll, bike, or jog.  Easy access to subways and buses and surrounded by restaurants, bars, and gyms. If you'd like to map it out, I live across the street from the Children's Museum of Arts on Charlton Street.
transit: The closest subway is the 1 Train on Houston Street or the C/E Train on Spring Street - but just three minutes away.  A large subway hub at West 4th Street is just a little further at under 10 minutes.   Everything is close in New York.   Neighborhood is very convenient.
interaction: Since I live there I'm always available if you need help or advice in the City.  But we like to give our guests space and expect they'll be out and about exploring the city.     If here for work, I'm sure you'll be out doing your work.   But again, we're friendly and welcoming and always available.
house_rules: We want you to have a fun stay and a good time.  We are happy to help in any way with recommendations and advice.    But this is our home.   For the amount of money you are paying, you are renting a room, not an entire home.    NY Hotels are expensive.   Let's not ignore the fact that you are here to save money.  If you want a living room situation, to cook and hang out like this is your place - either rent an entire apartment on this website OR rent a hotel suite.   We are busy professionals so please be respectful of us, our neighbors, and our space.   What that means is: No overnight houseguests.   Honestly, we prefer no social visits either.  I've approved you and only you to be in my home for a reason, not your friends or acquaintances.   If you are in town visiting your friends, this is not the hub to gather before going out.  We don't want or need multiple people socializing in the apartment.  This City is big and lively enough to meet with your friends elsewhere.  If you need r

neighborhood_overview: Harlem is a diverse residential neighborhood in upper Manhattan that is home to the famous Apollo Theatre, Red Rooster restaurant, numerous green spaces and gospel churches. Our house is located in a leafy, hilly, and quiet part of the city.
notes: There are several nice coffee shops around the corner and many good restaurants within walking distance.
transit: 145th St subway station is 3 minutes walk away, giving you access to the A and D express lines (takes you downtown in 10-15 mins) and the local B and C lines that stop at all the local stops down Central Park West. There is also free street parking.
interaction: We live on the top two floors of the house so will be available should you need anything.

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is relatively a quiet area compared to other areas in Manhattan. Since my apartment is on the 12th floor you don't hear that much of traffic noise from the streets. Dave's Gourmet on 1st Avenue in our building is a nice cheap place to grab breakfast or lunch. Other restaurants/bars are located on 94 Street and down 2nd Avenue. There's also a 24 hour grocery store called Cherry Avenue a block away on 2nd Ave and 101 Street. Our area was not hard hit by covid cases.
notes: 24/7 security at our building complex and our building requires masks to be worn when entering or leaving.
transit: The new Q subway line gets you around faster to places like Times Square and Grand Central! This is about a 7 minute walk from our apartment on 2nd Avenue and 96th Street. There's also the 6 train on Lexington and 96th Street. There's a bus line on 97th Street in between 1st and 2nd Avenue in front of the hospital that takes you to Central Park. Here's my rating on (Website hidden by Airbnb) - Walkscore: 92, Transit Score: 95, Bike Score: 80.
interaction: Feel free to send me a text or call me if you need anything and/or have questions about navigating through the city:) There's no curfew to come back to my place and I encourage late fun nights in NYC. The walls here are pretty thick and can't hear people going in and out.
house_rules: Please remove shoes while using bathroom. No smoking in the apartment, but you're more than welcome to smoke on my balcony! *There is an extra $10 fee for early checkin and/or to store luggage before/after checkin time at 3pm.

neighborhood_overview: Forget SoHo and get used to saying SoHa. Otherwise known as South Harlem. It's dotted with trendy establishments with a diverse population, but it still maintains its classic Harlem charm. SoHa is surrounded by parks and greenery. You have Central Park to the south, Morningside Park to the west & Marcus Garvey Park to the east. As someone who walks to work, gym, shopping, movies, bars, restaurants, conferences, etc, I could not ask for a more central and convenient location.  -Feel like a New Yorker and take a run in Central Park  -Walking distance to EVERYTHING!  Wholefoods, Best Yet Market, Fine Fare Supermarket,  Post office, Banks, Starbucks, Duane Reade & CVS Pharmacies, Magic Johnson Movie Theatre, Columbia University, Seasonal Farmer’s Market and the list goes on. -7 short blocks from 125th street, the busy shopping area. Shops include Victoria's Secret, Bath & Body Works, Gap factory, Banana Republic, H&M, Old Navy, Staples, Marshalls, Bed, Bath & Beyond, TG Max, Mac cosmetics,
notes: The apt will be professionally cleaned before your stay.    There is NO Elevator and there are stairs to be climbed.
transit: -2 blocks from the express subway train #2/3 at W.116th St. It’s approximately 12 minutes to Times Square/ 42nd Street. The B & C local subway lines are less than 5 minutes away.  -Numerous buses including the M1 bus is a block away which travels down Museum Mile/5th  Ave, alongside Central Park to the Met, Guggenheim, and other museums. Parking & Car Access:  - If bringing a car, free parking is available on the street. Alternative side parking means between certain hours you must move your car for street cleaning depending what side you've parked on. There are also plenty of parking garages nearby. - For all other transportation needs, Ubers and taxis are abundantly available.
interaction: I will meet and greet you at check in and check out.  My family & I live in the apt below, so we're here to help make your stay perfect and are available to assist you anytime.
house_rules: Please respect this beautiful apartment as if it was your home, keep the space clean and respect the appliances and furniture that we have provided. -Please remove shoes upon entering the apt.  -Absolutely No Smoking inside or outside the building.   -No additional guests.  -No illegal activity. -No parties or events.  -No loud music. -Please take out the trash once full.  -Clean the dishes etc that you have used. Please turn off the lights and the HVAC when you leave the apartment. We provide quality linens for your comfort during your stay. However, we ask that you DO NOT take any of these items with you.  Guests are not allowed to use our address for delivery of goods or online orders  As always, honesty and kindness are always the best policies. THANK YOU :)

neighborhood_overview: lots of restaurants, grocery stores. for those who like to hangout if its clubbing or listen to blues Jazz funk live music there are several options. Whole Food where you can do all your groceries and get prepared food is only 6 short blocks away on 124st and Lenox(5 mn walk). The famous Rooster is only 8 short blocks away; you can go for a drink, dinner and listen to live bands. For people who love to jog, Central Park is only 5mn run way; use entrance on 111th st and 7th avenue.
notes: The hot water might take a couple of minutes to get hot; be aware of it so you won't burn yourself once it gets hot as it gets really hot. Let it run for a bit before you go under the shower. There is access to an outdoor space, the downstairs stoop overlooking the street where the guests can sit and absorb the vibe of the neighborhood.

neighborhood_overview: Our home is located in the Morningside Heights neighborhood of Harlem. The neighborhood is very safe and quiet, and it is constantly patrolled by the City College campus security, as well as the NYPD.  We are centrally located to Columbia University and City College of New York.
notes: We have been Airbnb hosts for 3+ years.  As frequent Airbnb travelers ourselves, we have been guests in some of the best Airbnb listings, and we've brought our favorite decor into our New York property.  Our commitment is to make each of our guests feel like they're staying in a 5-star hotel.
transit: We are located about 3 blocks from the A and D express subway lines, which connect you to Times Square and midtown tourist attractions in about 10 minutes. We are also near the M60 bus to LaGuardia Airport, and the M104 to Columbia University.   If a car is more your style, Uber is a great option that can pick you up right at the apartment.  If you have a Zipcar membership, Zipcars are available about 3 blocks away.
interaction: You will be met upon arrival, and we will be readily available throughout your stay, in person or by phone, to answer any questions you may have.  Convenient self check-in is available as well, for guests planning on checking in late at night.   I'm Jimmy.  I work in small business marketing.  My partner Shaun, is a restaurant manager on the Upper East Side.  We are both passionate about hospitality and food, so we know a thing or two about exploring all of the great dining options that our city has to offer!  If you have any questions, or need advice on where to go to see the best of the best while you're here, we'll be happy to assist.  We also have a precious miniature pinscher puppy named Peanut.  She is very well trained, and is not allowed in our guest rooms.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a beautiful, safe and clean area on the Upper East Side. We have tons of great restaurants, and plenty of services - including a Whole Foods, Fairway marketplace, and The Writing Room. The area and is clean, quiet and peaceful and near public transportation. Enjoy a night on the town, and come home to rest. See the Home Guide for all my favorite spots.
notes: The building is a pre-war walk up (i.e., no elevator) with all the charm of an older building. My interior designer helped me furnish my unit to help it feel modern, but keep in mind the building is older. There are no laundry facilities on premice, but there's a wash and fold around the corner that does same day service for $1/lb. Lastly, I have a home assistant that helps me host when I'm traveling. If there's anything we can do prior to your arrival, we'd be happy to help accommodate.
transit: The apartment is in a prime location for all public transportation and getting around. It's 1 block from the M81 bus stop, 1 avenue from the 2nd street Q line, and 3 blocks from the 4/5/6 Express and local stops.  UberPool pickup stop is 1 block away, and yellow taxis wait right outside the apartment.  Uber convenience.

house_rules: The Golden Rule: Do unto others as you would have them do unto you.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is absolutely fantastic and very safe and friendly. Today’s Harlem is the place to be! It is now full of trendy restaurants (Red Rooster), lively  jazz venues, up-scaled supermarkets (Whole Foods), new condos, and other amenities. This northern part of Manhattan is extremely well connected to the whole city. There are three subway lines within walking distance, buses, loads of taxis, easy parking (free parking on the street and affordable parking garage a block away).
notes: Extra treat for jazz lovers: Quintessential Harlem! On Wed, Thurs and Sun evenings we will either take you or direct you to a very special, secret Jazz joint only a block away! The best fried chicken and shrimp dinner in Harlem $10-$13,  beer or wine $4. Amazing live music! Many guests have called this the highlight of their NY experience. Film projects/event space/ intimate concerts/business meetings: We welcome small insured film companies for limited projects. The house is also ideal for special events such as dinner parties, concerts and business meetings. There will be an additional hourly cost depending on the length of the activity. More info available upon request. We are happy to consult with you! Very reliable public transportation (subway and bus) is a short walk away. Taxis and Uber always available. Free and safe street parking is on a first come basis, reasonably priced (for NYC) parking garage is one block away. For your convenience, there is a washer and dryer in the ki
transit: The People's Brownstone is 5 minutes walking from the main subway lines: A, D, B and C station at 125th street; 2 and 3 at 125th and 135th stations; not far from the 4, 5 and 6 at 125th street. Buses and taxis are available, but also Lyft, Uber, etc. are good services. So you will not have to wait for anything. Shopping places 24/7.
interaction: We will meet and greet you and show you about the house. You will have our phone numbers and contacts to facilitate your stay. We will provide you with tips on where to go, what to visit, how to discover the neighborhood and the city to make your stay truly wonderful. We promise it will be memorable experience!
house_rules: The house is ideal for events and gatherings for and additional fee.

With its busiest sidewalks, great  attractions, countless restaurants, chic bars and largest stores you get the best deal in Manhatan. Recomended food places within 2 blocks (5 min walking max) Cellini restaurant (excellent italian food) Hillstone (excellent but bit pricey american food) LPain Quotidian (excellent open bread sandwiches, french pastries, caffee) Burger Heaven (diner, great for breakfast) Pret-A-Manger (excellent sandwiches) Starbucks Gregory caffee Shopping- Posh 5th avenue and Madison avenue with all the stores you can imagine are just one short minute walk from our place.

neighborhood_overview: It's a very safe neighborhood, conveniently located between all main streets to downtown: Lexington, Park, Madison and 5th Avenues. There's a new craft beer restaurant in the neighborhood, The Rochard NYC, with 32 brews! Also new is Frenchy Coffee and the Lexington Pizza Parlor. It's the newly gentrified area of East Harlem and the buildings still have the color and flavor of "El Barrio". You can get groceries from the stores at 96th and Lexington or just outside the subway at 103rd Street. Great restaurants are on every corner: Thai, Italian,  burgers and Mexican food. It's one block to a Citybike rental hub on the way to Central Park!
notes: Please take your shoes off after you come in and leave your shoes under the bench by the door. There are flip-flops in your room for your comfort if you don't have slippers or socks. For health reasons, please do not spit in the shower or bathroom sink (other than rinsing after brushing your teeth).
transit: Take a Via (use my code when you download the app for a $10 discount on your ride: jackie7q2) or an Ubershare from the airport. There are downtown buses and taxis on the corner and it's one block to the 103rd Street subway station for the 6 train. It's two stops to 86th Street for the 4 and 5 express trains or shopping at H&M, Banana Republic, Loft, Gap, Aldo's, Steve Madden's, Staples, T-Mobile, AT&T, Chase, BofA, movie theaters, everything. But get the Via app for shared rides that are a great way to get around Manhattan for inexpensive, fixed rate rides, and the Citymapper for the best subway/GPS app.
interaction: I'm an actor, screenwriter and new filmmaker just breaking in to the business and never know what my schedule is, but you are free to interact as much as you choose or hide out in your room. My dog, Joey, likes to greet guests with a bark and a wag of her tail. She loves having company, especially if I am working.
house_rules: - Not a lot of rules here, I just ask that you pack your manners, clean up after yourself in the kitchen and bathroom and be discrete about the neighbors. No sleep overs! Only registered guests.

neighborhood_overview: As an American Studies major, I studied Harlem’s illustrious past and materializing revitalization.  Therefore, when I returned to New York City after graduation I was committed to becoming part of this iconic community.   The SoHa area is unquestionably the hottest area in Harlem.  My apartment is steps away from Harlem’s trendy Restaurant Row with over 30 distinctive restaurants, cafes, jazz clubs, and lounges. By staying at my house you are walking distance from Central Park, Columbia University, the legendary Apollo Theater, historical Harlem sites as well as minutes from downtown Manhattan. You can access all your day-to-day needs at the neighborhood supermarkets, drugstores, banks, laundromats, and organic dry cleaner, which are within two short blocks.
notes: Home Sweet Harlem meets New York State housing regulations and is legally authorized to host guests.
transit: It is very convenient to 24 hour transportation: the 2/3 trains are two short blocks away, the B/C trains are also located in close proximity on West 116 St.   There are lots of bike paths, buses, taxis, and car services. A true rarity on the island of Manhattan, street parking is usually available.
interaction: I am the reigning Queen of Errands so, if you need to get something done and require advice on how and where, I am your woman. Send me a text between the hours of 9:00 am and 11:00 pm; I will be happy to share any information that might assist you with the completion of your task and activities list.

Walking distance from a supermarket and bodega, great diners & restaurants, coffee shops, and the massive new Hudson Yards district currently rising a block to our west. We are just a block and a half from the legendary Madison Square Garden, where you can enjoy epic concerts, performances and sporting events.
notes: I have great advice on where to eat, drink and enjoy your time in NYC. You will have a guidebook for the house, the neighborhood and the city at large. You will love the location as we are in the center of the action but peaceful enough for a restful home.

neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is located in the southern-most part of Washington Heights. The Heights is one of the most up-and-coming neighborhoods in the entire city. The area is rapidly getting younger and is now home to plenty of popular restaurants, bars and attractions. If you're in town to get the full flavor of NYC, we encourage you to explore the surrounding area!
transit: We're a 3 minute walk from the C Train, which quickly connects to the A Train. The A Train runs express through the Upper West Side and gets you to Times Square in about 15 minutes. We're also about 5 minutes away from the 1 Train, which quickly connects to other express lines. Upon arrival, we'll also provide tips for traveling to specific places at specific times.
interaction: Our check-in time is extremely flexible. We'll do our best to be available to welcome you to the apartment, help with your luggage and answer any questions you have. Both of us work long, and sometimes odd hours but we're committed to accommodating your every need. When we aren't around, we'll provide all the information you need to have a safe and fun trip to New York City. When we are around, don't be afraid to say hi! We're always up for good conversation.
house_rules: - Free your feet! Shoes off at the door please! There's a shoe rack there, and the top shelf is reserved for guests like you!  - Our kitchen is your kitchen. That means you can feel free to use our pots, pans, dishes, cups, utensils, etc...our only request is, after using, please rinse and place the item in the dishwasher or wash and place it in the drying rack.  - We also have a microwave, Nespresso coffee maker, and seltzer maker. Again you're welcome to use them all. If you're unsure how to operate anything though, please ask us and we'll show you how. And, like the kitchen items, please clean them after using. - Please be gentle with the doors! Try not to slam them.

neighborhood_overview: You are within a few subway stops or walking distance of the following popular attractions:  - Bloomingdales department store - Central Park  - The 5th Avenue "famous" Apple Store - Central Park Zoo - Central Park South  - 5th Avenue shopping - Empire State Building - Rockefeller Center - Union Square  - Herald Square - Times Square  - Eating, drinking, people watching, shopping, exploring, galore! -Q and F trains are right across the street!  -4,5,6,N,Q,R subway trains are located a few blocks South at 59th street.
notes: This apartment is above  a Vegan restaurant, so the hallway will sometimes smell like there's been cooking in the building as they use a lot of spice! It never bothers us, but some guests maybe sensitive to this, so please take note! Additionally, there is a spa on the first level of the building, so there is a mix of residents / spa customers coming in and out of the building throughtout the day. Public guests remain below us on the spa level. The apartment is located on the third floor of the building and there are TWO sets of stairs to traverse before you'll find our entrance. Please keep this in mind. We do not have a microwave, television or a couch!
transit: Parking is NOT available here, with the exception of parking garages. Nearby transportation includes: - The F and Q trains at 63rd and Lexington Avenue, immediately across from the apartment. - The 4, 5, 6 and N, Q, R trains at 59th Street and Lexington Avenue - The newly opened 2nd Avenue Q station at 63rd and 3rd Avenue  Subways run 24 hours, 7 days a week! Grab yourself an unlimited weekly Metrocard (costs $33) and take yourself anywhere your heart desires in the city. The metro card also includes all buses and some ferries.
interaction: Our co-host Emily will personally welcome you to the apartment, giving you a short tour and assistance with anything you might need.  She maintains communication with guests via text message throughout their stay. The apartment is 100 percent private for you, but Emily is always available if you need anything at all.
house_rules: HOUSE RULES - NO parties - NO smoking - NO additional "outside" guests beyond members of booking party - NO photoshoots, filming, art projects, etc.  - NO guests under 18 without parental supervision  - NO animals / pets  Please treat this home as your own! Thank you! ;-)

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is relatively a quiet area compared to other areas in Manhattan. Since my apartment is on the 12th floor you don't hear that much of traffic noise from the streets. Dave's Gourmet on 1st Avenue in our building is a nice cheap place to grab breakfast or lunch. Other restaurants/bars are located on 94 Street and down 2nd Avenue. There's also a 24 hour grocery store called Cherry Avenue a block away on 2nd Ave and 101 Street.
notes: 24/7 security at our building complex.
transit: The new Q subway line gets you around faster to places like Times Square and Grand Central! This is about a 5 minute walk from our apartment on 2nd Avenue and 96th Street. There's also the 6 train on Lexington and 96th Street. There's a bus line on 97th Street in between 1st and 2nd Avenue in front of the hospital that takes you to Central Park. Here's my rating on (Website hidden by Airbnb) - Walkscore: 92, Transit Score: 95, Bike Score: 80
interaction: Feel free to send me a text or call me if you need anything and/or have questions about navigating through the city:) There's no curfew to come back to my place and I encourage late fun nights in NYC.

We are eight blocks away from Penn Station, 1.5 blocks from Eataly and the Flatiron building, and in an easy walking distance from Time Square on the north and Union Square in the south, and the Highline and Chelsea market on the west. The Peloton studio is a block away.  The nearby trains (one to two blocks from us)  quickly take you to: *Penn Station (the 1, E, C), JFK (the E), and LaGuardia Airport (the C) *Times Square, Broadway theaters, Colombus Circle, and Lincoln Center (the 1)  * The Museum of Natural History (the C)  * Herald Square and the 34th St. shops, such as Macy's (the M, F)  * The MOMA, Radio City, and Rockefeller Center (the M, F) * 5th Av at 53rd St (the M) * Bloomingdales (the F, M)  * The SOHO and Greenwich Village (the E, C)  * Canal St. (the 1, C, & E) * The World Trade Center (the E). Of course, connecting and changing trains will take you to any place in the city. *We have
interaction: We are happy to offer help and guidance to our guests throughout their stay.  We will be there as much or as little as you want, accommodating your needs and wishes while completely respecting your privacy.
house_rules: 1. The access to the apartment is via a private elevator that requires a unique key.  Replacing the key is very expensive.  Therefore, in case you forget to return your key, we will have to charge you $300 to replace the key. 2. Our bed is queen size, designed for two people to sleep in comfortably. However, if you want instead to use two beds, we have an airbed we can provide.  In such cases, we charge additional $50 per night, even if there are only two guests.  3.  No guests of our guests are allowed to use the room or to spend the night.  4. Please do not lit candles. 5.  If you need something from our kitchen, please ask us and we will be happy to give it to you.  Our kitchen is not available for guests' use. 6. Please do not cross to the adjacent roof. neighborhood_overview: This unique location is reminiscent of a tree lined street in Paris. Cafes, Boutiques, Bakeries, and Al Fresco Restaurants are steps away.  The Metro or Subway is 2 blocks away on either side of the apartment that can take you anywhere in the City. Or you can walk, everything you desire are steps away. Wireless high speed internet, ALSO: The house is one of the oldest in lower Manhattan (1835), built on land originally owed by Arron Burr America's 3rd Vice-President (and Alexander Hamilton's great Rival) and the building retains some of its original features and charm.  If you love a European/Old-world style this is a great choice for you!  It is an amazing house and people love to stay here! The studio is facing the garden, so mostly quiet, unless the neighbors have a party, then it is loud!
notes: The studio is in our Townhouse. We have 2 kids and a dog!  You might meet them on the stairs. The studio is 2 flights up via stairs. We do not have a tv, but we do have excellent wifi. We have blinds, but NOT blackout blinds! The studio is sunny. The bathrooms is tiny but it has a full tub, a good shower and toilet.  Noise: The apartment faces the garden and is mostly very quiet, BUT if our downstairs tenants have a party or are spending a lot of time in the garden then it can be loud(er). Usually the air-conditioner combined with the noise canceling machine works wonders, and this is VERY sporadic, but it does happen.
transit: Close to most major subways.  A quick trip to most major NYC attractions and an easy walk to some of the greatest shopping and restaurants.
interaction: We are totally available. We live in the Townhouse.
house_rules: The studio is in our home, so it is important the studio be left as clean as you found it. We prefer quiet and family friendly guests. No Smoking. No open flame.

neighborhood_overview: West Chelsea is a growing neighborhood thriving in its own art, restaurant, and nightlife scenes. New luxury residences, boutique business establishments, and "social media worthy" things-to-do are popping up continuously. The foot traffic is light, the sidewalks are wide, and the streets are relatively clean. Not to mention the High Line, the world-renowned, above-ground park/walking path built atop an old railroad that cuts through the heart of West Chelsea. You are also walking distance to some of the most visited neighborhoods in Manhattan such as Hudson Yards, Chelsea, and Meatpacking District.
notes: It's great to be in the center of the action - my apartment is conveniently located in one of Manhattan's most trendy, thriving neighborhoods. Luckily, I am a few blocks removed from all the "craziness" so the foot traffic and noise in thee mornings/evenings tend to be less than other parts of the city. But in NYC...you always prepare for the unexpected :) If you are very sensitive to noise, I have provided disposable ear plugs in the top-most kitchen drawer so you are able to rest comfortably.
transit: Two avenues from the C & E train that will get you to New York City's most popular tourist destinations (Time Square, Central Park, World Trade Center, etc.). Also walking distance to Hudson Yards, Chelsea, and Meatpacking District neighborhoods
interaction: I will be available at any time during your stay to recommend dining, daytime activities, or nightlife. I have a large network in New York City and will be happy to make your stay as memorable as possible.
house_rules: - Before booking you must have at least 3 verifications. Please be prepared to tell me a little bit about yourself including what you do for a living, reason for your visit, etc. (This is my primary residence so I want to build a trusting relationship between my guests and I) - Sofa MUST BE COVERED with sheet set if using it to sleep - If a meal is cooked, all appliances should be thoroughly cleaned after - ALL trash/recyclables should be taken out every 1-2 days and before the end of your stay and placed in the dumpster in the front garden - NO EATING on the bed or couch, only on the kitchen island - I am VERY afraid of bugs so PLEASE keep the space as clean as possible throughout your stay. Please make sure all trash is placed in the garbage container under the sink or in the bathroom before you leave the house - Be respectful to other tenants when you see them in the hallways. There is to be NO MENTION of Airbnb stay

neighborhood_overview: My place is in Manhattan Chinatown. Close to Lower East Side and Dumbo Brooklyn, so it's an ideal location if you are into the local arts scene. It' around 20 mins walk to Soho and World Trade Center. The walk is never boring as you explore amidst the hustle and bustle of downtown Manhattan. Let alone hundreds of restaurants and bars in this area!
transit: Walking distance to Lower East Side, East River, Manhattan Bridge, Brooklyn Bridge, Soho, Little Italy and Word Trade Center. 5 min walk to F train station which takes 15-20 mins to mid town.

But when I am home, I am always happy to talk with guests if they feel like having a chat, or offer some help whenever needed.  I am originally from China and I love New York. A big fan of traveling, music, literature, and arts.

neighborhood_overview: There are few neighborhoods in the world that have had the kind of cultural impact that Harlem has, and our apartment is truly in the heart of it all.  We are a block from the Apollo, a music hall which is credited with launching the careers of some of the most talented African American artists since the 1930s. The amateur night every Wednesday is still incredibly competitive and definitely a fun thing to do in the city.  There are several great jazz bars within a five minute walk, and the Studio Museum (a two-minute walk) is an excellent museum dedicated to showcasing African American art. (The gift shop is also highly recommended.)   We are one block away from 125th street--the main thoroughfare in Harlem filled with lots of shopping (and some of the best outlet shopping in Manhattan), and there are several neighborhood walking tours that leave just minutes from our apartment organized around a variety of subjects, including food, heritage, jazz, and gospel-themed tours. There is als
notes: We are generally very flexible about arrival and departure times, but on days when we are expecting one guest to check out and another to check in, we ask those leaving to do so by 11am and those arriving to come no sooner than 1pm in order to ensure adequate time to fully clean the studio.  On days when there is no overlap of guests, we are completely flexible about check-in or check-out times (because even if we can't be there, we can keep the key in a lock box for you.)  Regardless of whether or not you are overlapping with another guest, you are welcome to keep your luggage in our apartment upstairs, where it will be safely stored until it is time for you to leave. (And if you need to store it while you wait to check in, we bring the luggage down for you so that it is waiting for you when you get into the apartment at 1pm.
transit: The location is pretty amazing for transportation purposes as well. Our apartment is one block away from the 2 (subway) line, 2.5 blocks away from the A-C-B-D line, and 4 blocks from the 4-5-6 line. We are also one block from the M60 (an express bus that goes from La Guardia to Columbia University).  Directly across from the street from the apartment is a private parking garage if you would like to keep your car there overnight, but we have a car that we keep on the street as there is free street parking all around. (It really just comes down to your personal comfort level.)
interaction: Both Amir and I are around and happy to help with anything you might need during your stay. We live in the apartment upstairs and Amir works from home, so it is usually very easy to get in touch with us quickly.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is great and quite trendy. There are a lot of brand new pubs and restaurants just steps from the apartment.
notes: Check in time is totally flexible.  However I do have a day job and work from 9 AM to 6PM.  So check-in before 9am or after 6:30pm is most likely.  If you check in early morning, you may have to just leave your bags as the current guest doesn't check out until 10am.   You are welcome to leave your bags with my doorman in the lobby of my building and go out and enjoy the city and I will meet you after I return from work.   If arranged prior to your arrival, I can have my cleaning lady meet you however you have to arrive when you say you will as she can't wait for travel delays and the sort so it's best to just message me and we can make arrangements that fit your travel schedule.   I guess if I'm forced to list a time it would be 6:30pm. This allows the prior guests time to check out which is 10AM and for me to clean the room and get it ready for you.  However, you are welcome to drop off your bags at any hour.  You are also welcome to leave your luggage during the day if you have an ev
transit: There are plenty of options for moving about the city.  The M4 Bus stop is right outside my building and takes you all the way to the bottom of Manhattan.  The ride to the top of 5th avenue at 60th street is about 30 mins.  Or you can take the 1, 2 or 3 train which is 5 short blocks from the apt or the A,B, C, and D, trains are 3 long blocks away ... about 5 minutes walk.  Of course you can also use Uber, Lyft, or any of the other new apps out there for car services, and of course there are plenty of taxi's.
interaction: I will be there to meet you when you arrive!  Give you the keys and introduce you to the dogs!!  I will have maps of the area and transportation so that you will be able to navigate the city with ease.  However, should you get stuck during the day, you can always call or text me.  Local restaurants or recommendations in midtown are always available, just ask.
house_rules: - Must take shoes off once you enter the Apt Please don't bring strangers back to the apartment.  No smoking in the apartment or your room.  Please don't let the entrance door slam as it's a heavy door and very loud if just let go.  No Fish of any kind can be cooked in the apartment. No fish can be heated up in the microwave and no canned fish can be opened.  No bacon can be cooked in the apartment.  Please don't feed the dogs.

neighborhood_overview: The Upper West Side has so much character. It is close to so many attractions and museums and super convenient to downtown activities as well! I have lived in most of the neighborhoods in the city and Upper West has been my favorite!
notes: This is New York! Things are old and maybe a little unconventional. Please note the bathtub is old and has rust stains in the bottom. It came that way. It is not dirty, tub is clean and bleached before every guest. Our homes are not always perfect but they are in New York so that makes them perfect! Hope you enjoy!
transit: Public transportation is very convenient! The train is steps away from the apartment and has local and express stops. Walking to Central Park, Riverside Park and many of the museums is very easy also. Columbus Circle is only a 10min walk or 2 stops away on the subway. Times Square is 1 stop away on the express train and Macy’s, Empire State Building and Herald Square is only 2 stops away!  Street parking on the weekends is pretty painless. There is also a parking garage 4 blocks away.
interaction: I will be available by phone.
house_rules: No smoking whatsoever not even in the backyard area, as I am a severe asthmatic and highly allergic.  It may not seem like an issue to you, but even a bare trace of smoke near my living space is critical to my breathing.  You must smoke outside if front of the building if needed.

neighborhood_overview: Harlem is a vibrant and historical neighborhood in New York City. Here are some great places and resources near my home: Ponty Bistro Harlem: chic French-African, great for brunch or dinner The Shrine: historical dance club with great music. Harlem Nights: local bar/lounge with great live music just 1 block away The Edge: great for brunch or dinner, great ambience Make My Cake: local bakery PROOF Coffee: handcrafted high-end coffee shop Manhattanville Coffee Shop: hip place to work and grab a bite with great coffee and vibes Abyssiana: Ethiopian restaurant Babbalucci: Amazing pizza and Italian food Red Rooster: Upscale comfort food eatery with creative cooking from celeb chef Marcus Samuelsson. Dino's BBQ: famous NYC bbq joint by the river on the westside. A gentle 25 minute walk away. A great place to go on a summer evening. Harlem Grow: community garden Studio Museum Harlem: free on Sundays Countee Cullen New York Public Library YMCA: free trial and day rates available, sauna and ste
notes: I am available and happy to touch base on any questions you have about your stay that I have not answered in my listing. Don't hesitate to ask.

neighborhood_overview: Central Harlem is full of great history, restaurants, amd musuems.  But if Harlem is not for you, hop on the express train and get to Rockefeller Center,  Time Square, Grand Central, Columbus Circle, Central Park, or the Empire State in less than 20min on the express train!
transit: 2 blocks from the express train that gets you to Columbus Cirle in 2 stops, Rockefeller Center in 4 stops, and Grand Central Station in 5 stops. Along the way, you'll pass Harlem, Central Park, and the incredible American Museum for Natural History.  There are other local trains nearby as well. neighborhood_overview: From Trip Advisor/ Chelsea:  Home to hundreds of art galleries, beautiful brownstones, and one of New York’s newest and most popular attractions, Chelsea is one of the city’s jewels when it comes to neighborhood life. The contemporary art scene is an integral part of the neighborhood’s identity, with gallery openings almost every night of the week and countless exhibits to explore. As a longtime hub of gay culture in New York City, it’s also a diverse district with a vibrant nightlife scene. The opening of the High Line, an abandoned elevated train track transformed into a world-class pedestrian park, gave this neighborhood new life as a tourist destination. The High Line provides visitors with a tranquil, elevated space with incomparable views, providing an unparalleled way to experience the city.
notes: Please do not wear shoes inside of the apt & remove them in the hallway upon entering the apt.  Do not slam door when leaving the apt & close the living room window once you leave. Also, please make sure to turn off the AC & all the lights when you are not using it/ left the apt. Thank you!
transit: GREAT subway access - 1,2,3,9 A,C,E, F,L, N,R, Path trains, Penn station, the High Line, West Village & Meat Packing district all down the block. Port Authority / Path trains all within a 10 minute walk/ cab. There is no place Manhattan closer to such varied transportation.
interaction: I'm happy to accommodate your trip anyway I can. I have a busy schedule and may not be around much, but I'm always available by phone and happy to address any concerns you may have. I also have good friends in the area that are also available to address any concerns.

neighborhood_overview: Encompassing the area of upper Manhattan in vibrant & historic Harlem, "Room Serendipity" is situated a short metro ride/walk from all major attractions. This area is home to some of New York's most celebrated bars, cocktail lounges and eateries, while also anchoring a host of fabled cultural institutions. From cultural enthusiasts to university students, and its growing music, culinary, and nightlife scene; Harlem is steadily attracting visitors and is the hippest place to be. As a NYC native, I'll be happy to tell you all that's in vogue during your stay. A plethora of transportation options are within short walking distance of the flat making access to the rest of the city a breeze! The nearest metro (5 min away) whisks you away to Times Square via the 2,3 express! Talk about convenience! Harlem is a thriving, exciting, and hip neighborhood that is going through a period of revival, akin to a new "Harlem Renaissance" in the last several years and is visible in its thriving culture.
notes: Feel at home and Enjoy!
transit: Access to the rest of the city is a breeze! Subway/Metro: -2, 3 train is a 5 minute walk from the flat taking you directly to Time's Square -A,B,C,D train is a short 10 minute walk away -M1, M7, M102, BX19, (M60--bus to LGA Airport, 5 mins away via metro) buses all stop within reach of the apartment Cabs & Uber's are plentiful as well.
interaction: I am always available to answer questions.

neighborhood_overview: Washington Heights is a great authentic NY neighborhood, with a majority hispanic population. Despite the fact that I happen to live in a relatively quiet street, you'll find that the neighborhood is quite lively. It's safe and I live right next to a beautiful park, also a short walk away from The Cloisters (which I highly recommend you visit, since it's gorgeous this time of year).
notes: You must let me know upon booking exactly who will be staying with you, in case you are coming as a couple. I must be able verify all guests at the time of booking.  If by any chance I can not be home for your check in, there's a lockbox with the keys on my front door. Just ask me for the combination.  Free Parking is NOT Private Parking. I don't have a parking space or garage for your car, but you may park all around the neighborhood, on the street, for free, or use a few paid garages close by.  Taking off your shoes when you come in is not a must, but greatly appreciated.  Please absolutely no smoking, pets or extra guests.
transit: I'm half a block away from the 1 train at 191st street stop, and about a 10 minute walk from the A train. If you can avoid driving here, I recommend leaving the car parked during your stay and taking the subway to visit the rest of the city. I'm 20 minutes from Central Park and 30 minutes from Times Square (by subway). The 1 train takes you directly to Central Park, Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle, Times Square, Penn Station, West Village, World Trade Center Memorial and South Ferry (where you take the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island). So there's no need to transfer to another subway line.
interaction: I know New York well, as I have lived here for more then a decade. I'll be more then happy to give you tips on where to go, if you desire, and help you with whatever you may need, if I have time. There are no shortage of great little guide books about NY in the guest room, and you are welcome to borrow them during your stay.
house_rules: No extra guests. Please let me know upon booking if you are booking as a couple, or if you are reserving the room only for yourself.

neighborhood_overview: Please note that there is downtown (Chinatown, Soho, 9/11 Memorial), midtown (Times Square, Empire State building) & uptown ( Central Park, Harlem) in Manhattan. The apt is uptown in Washington Heights, so it will take time to go downtown. If you're paying $60 and complaining that its not close to downtown, I would rather you not book the room than giving the location a bad rating that will affect my overall rating. Also it would be difficult to find a nice room with this price in the downtown area. Washington Heights, at its core, is has always been a diverse one - mixing an older Irish-American crowd with Latino community. Throw into the mix plenty of Columbia Med School students in scrubs and off-duty cops and that will round out the scene at many a happy hour in the Heights. There is Dunkin' Donuts, Starbucks, Rite Aid, McDonald's, Wendy's, Chipotle, Sbarro, Famiglia, Chase, Citibank, Bank of America, Gristedes, they're all within 3-5 blocks.
notes: Things we provide: clean sheets, blankets, pillows, towels, toilet paper, paper towels, iron, iron board.
transit: Subway is 3 blocks away from the apt, in front of Columbia Presbyterian Hospital, which is 168th stop of A, C and 1 train.
interaction: I work full time but always accessible via text/phone/email.

It has several live music venues, comedy clubs, art exhibitions, The Nuyorican Poets Cafe, bars, restaurants, clubs, my favorite Improv theater, Upright Citizens Brigade where Amy Poehler and other SNL cast members are known to pop up and perform on occasion, and many off-broadway theaters to see what innovative artists are doing in the city! neighborhood_overview: Very safe/clean downtown neighborhood, lots of parks around!  5 min walk to the East River Park/Water, enjoy a run or walk to the BK bridge.  You're only a short walk to everything from shopping in SoHo, eating your way through Little Italy/Chinatown, bar hopping in LES. The F train is 1 minute walk from the apt, will get you anywhere in the city. You also have the option of taking the bus or renting a Citibike, all located at the F train.  Note: Trader Joe’s and Target are 1 min walk from the apt, super convenient.
notes: If you're looking for places to eat and drink in the neighborhood, I recommend the below local spots but definitely check out my guidebook for more and bars!  1. Kikis for Greek/Mediterranean, can't go wrong here 2. Kossars for bagels and lox  3. Bar Belly for AMAZING cocktails and live music 4. La Contenta for upscale Mexican 5. Dimes very chill brunch place 6. Little Canal for lattes and doughnuts 7. Cafe Petisco, great brunch and vibe 8. Joes Shanghai for amazing soup dumplings and crispy shredded beef 9. Mission Chinese, staple upscale Chinese restaurant. If you need to drop off luggage early please check with me first. There is a place to store luggage for late checkout or early arrival: City Copilot nearby.

neighborhood_overview: Great little local places for coffee are The Edge and Manhattanville Cafe. Explore beautiful City College and St Nicholas Park, Columbia University, and enjoy some of the restaurants that Harlem is famous for. A two minute walk to the subway will have you downtown in minutes. Our subway line makes stops at Central Park, the Museum of Natural History, Columbus Circle, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, and Herald Square. You will have all the beauty and wonder of Harlem, with New York City at your fingertips.
notes: We can arrange to keep your luggage secure prior to check-in. If you arrive early in the day, and would like to explore the city, we can keep your luggage secure until the time you plan to arrive.

neighborhood_overview: Located in the quietest section of Inwood, surrounded by 2 nearby parks and a creek. Minutes way from Fort Tryon Park - A scenic Hudson River park featuring the Cloisters museum & gardens. Restaurants are abound! No need to travel downtown to get a taste of a variety of cuisines within the neighborhood.  Access to Downtown Manhattan from all directions. Closest train line is the 1 Train, which leaves you 1 block away from the apartment on the 215th Street stop. The A line is also nearby, which is just 4 blocks away on the 207th Street stop. MTA Bus # BX7 stops directly in front of apartment building on 215th Street and Broadway.
notes: All backgrounds are welcome, just ask that you treat the room with the same respect you would treat your own and keep noise to a minimum. No pets allowed and no smoking allowed. The bathroom is a shared space with me so please keep it tidy, clean up after yourself and pick up any hair after using the bathroom. If you're cooking, please open the window to allow airflow, refrigerate any leftovers and keep the kitchen area clean for me to use after. There's a security camera that points directly to the front door of the apartment inside the living room to monitor who comes in and out of the apartment.
transit: Multiple public transportation options. Local bus stop directly in front of building. Access to two train lines just steps away.
interaction: I'm a Marketing Director who works from home & I'm available from 9am-5pm most days. The private room is located within a 2 bedroom apartment, I live alone and no other guests stay at this location.
house_rules: - No shoes in house - Limit bathroom usage between 7am-8am on weekdays (needed for getting ready for work) - No visitors (book as an additional guest if needed)

You will find everything you need including: - A big supermarket right across the street. - The Cloisters museum - Inwood Park - St Jude's Roman Catholic Church - Many Latin and fast food restaurants  - A Chase bank - Natural and green juices stores - Pharmacies - And much more... If you need something you will find it.

neighborhood_overview: There are few neighborhoods in the world that have had the kind of cultural impact that Harlem has, and our apartment is truly in the heart of it all. We are a block from the Apollo, a music hall which is credited with launching the careers of some of the most talented African American artists since the 1930s. The amateur night every Wednesday is still incredibly competitive and definitely a fun thing to do in the city. There are several great jazz bars within a five minute walk, and the Studio Museum (a two-minute walk) is an excellent museum dedicated to showcasing African American art. (The gift shop is also highly recommended.) We are one block away from 125th street--the main thoroughfare in Harlem filled with lots of shopping (and some of the best outlet shopping in Manhattan), and there are several neighborhood walking tours that leave just minutes from our apartment organized around a variety of subjects, including food, heritage, jazz, and gospel-themed tours. There is also an
notes: We are generally very flexible about arrival and departure times, but on days when we are expecting one guest to check out and another to check in, we ask those leaving to do so by 11am and those arriving to come no sooner than 1pm in order to ensure adequate time to fully clean the studio. On days when there is no overlap of guests, we are completely flexible about check-in or check-out times (because even if we can't be there, we can keep the key in a lock box for you.) Regardless of whether or not you are overlapping with another guest, you are welcome to keep your luggage in our apartment downstairs, where it will be safely stored until it is time for you to leave. (And if you need to store it while you wait to check in, we bring the luggage down for you so that it is waiting for you when you get into the apartment at 1pm.
transit: The location is pretty amazing for transportation purposes as well. Our apartment is one block away from the 2 (subway) line, 2.5 blocks away from the A-C-B-D line, and 4 blocks from the 4-5-6 line. We are also one block from the M60 (an express bus that goes from La Guardia to Columbia University). Directly across from the street from the apartment is a private parking garage if you would like to keep your car there overnight, but we have a car that we keep on the street as there is free street parking all around. (It really just comes down to your personal comfort level.)
interaction: Both Amir and I are around and happy to help with anything you might need during your stay. We live in the apartment downstairs and Amir works from home, so it is usually very easy to get in touch with us quickly.

neighborhood_overview: Sugar Hill, also known as Hamilton Heights, boasts a unique blend of beauty and culture stemming from a rich history. You can take a walk through St. Nicholas Park, the picturesque City College of New York, or around the two-block Trinity Cemetery, the resting place of such names as Ralph Ellison and John Audubon. George Washington perched there during battles with the British. A stroll up or down Broadway or Amsterdam Avenue will find delicious American, Caribbean, Asian, Italian cuisines as well as convenient supermarkets, pharmacies, and salons. The garden at the Church of the Intercession is gorgeous in the spring and summer, and on Sundays the Church of St Catherine of Genoa rings with the voices of the local choir.
notes: Our family neighborhood  is safe to come home at any time of day, or night. With great transportation (subways running all night), enjoy loud lower Manhattan, Hell's Kitchen, or Times Square and come back for a quiet sleep in Sugar Hill.
transit: 12-15 minutes to mid-town is all it takes. We're very close to several subways and city buses, all of which operate under the NYC MTA, so we recommend purchasing a MetroCard when you arrive in the city. (We will help you figure that out.) The closest subway is the C line, and the A, B, D, and 1 lines are a very short walk away. There are also plenty of taxis and a number of car services available; Uber and Lyft are usually less than five minutes away.
interaction: The space occupies two floors of the townhome, and we occupy the rest. We can leave you undisturbed for the duration of your stay, or (schedules permitting) we're happy to provide tips, advice, or just a friendly chat.
house_rules: Ours is a quiet friendly family neighborhood.  We are aiming to provide delicious relaxation for you after a hectic day in town and our neighbors deserve the same. Please be respectful and keep the noise down to a minimum after hours, especially during the week.

neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is West Soho, a cool area of the City just two blocks from Classic Greenwich Village and two blocks from Tribeca.    It's very safe and convenient to everything.  My building is filled with artists and families.      It's also right near the Hudson River where you can stroll, bike, or jog.  Easy access to subways and buses and surrounded by restaurants, bars, and gyms. If you'd like to map it out, I live across the street from the Children's Museum of Arts on Charlton Street.
transit: The closest subway is the 1 Train on Houston Street or the C/E Train on Spring Street - but just three minutes away.  A large subway hub at West 4th Street is just a little further at under 10 minutes.   Everything is close in New York.   Neighborhood is very convenient.
interaction: Since I live there I'm always available if you need help or advice in the City.  But we like to give our guests space and expect they'll be out and about exploring the city.     If here for work, I'm sure you'll be out doing your work.   But again, we're friendly and welcoming and always available.
house_rules: We want you to have a fun stay and a good time.  We are happy to help in any way with recommendations and advice.    But this is our home.   For the amount of money you are paying, you are renting a room, not an entire home.    NY Hotels are expensive.   Let's not ignore the fact that you are here to save money.  If you want a living room situation, to cook and hang out like this is your place - either rent an entire apartment on this website OR rent a hotel suite.   We are busy professionals so please be respectful of us, our neighbors, and our space.   What that means is: No overnight houseguests.   Honestly, we prefer no social visits either.  I've approved you and only you to be in my home for a reason, not your friends or acquaintances.   If you are in town visiting your friends, this is not the hub to gather before going out.  We don't want or need multiple people socializing in the apartment.  This City is big and lively enough to meet with your friends elsewhere.  If you need r

neighborhood_overview: Greenwich Village is one of the best & safest neighborhoods in NYC. The best chefs in the world have restaurants here and the trendiest bars/nightclubs are within walking distance. There are many original boutiques for your shopping pleasure. The Village has a rich history and the best way to check it out is on foot, you can discover it on your own or through one of the many walking tours.  Interesting facts: Greenwich Village, often referred to by locals as simply "The Village", has been known as an artists' haven, the Bohemian capital, the cradle of the modern LGBT movement, and the East Coast birthplace of both the Beat & '60s counterculture movements.
notes: NYC can be expensive so you're welcome to cook meals in the apartment. Feel free to leave dirty dishes in the sink, I'll clean them at night before going to bed. LBGTQ friendly. All races, religions, creeds welcome. Unfortunately the building does not allow pets.

neighborhood_overview: We are north of the Chelsea district. To learn more about our neighborhood, visit https://www.airbnb.com/locations/new-york/chelsea. Chelsea is one of the friendliest, safest and most centrally located neighborhoods in lower Manhattan. Shopping: Walk to Barney's Downtown within minutes, or stroll to lower 5th Avenue and Broadway for stores such as Lululemon, Bandier, ABC Home, Restoration Hardware, Club Monaco, Nike, Tory Burch, and dozens more. Eating: Walk to Eatly Italian Market, Nomad, Breslin or Michelin restaurants such as Gramercy Tavern and the beloved ABC Kitchen.  If you are feeling casual, there are dozens of bistros and great low key restaurants in the neighborhood. We are also happy to provide recommendations depending on what you are into and give advice on reservations, value and vibe etc.
notes: All amenities are available to guests: a set of sheets, towels and kitchen accessories are reserved and replenished for each stay.  Hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner and body soap are also available, so guests do not have to buy supplies while traveling. Our personal belongings will remain, however space for hanging/storing clothing is provided. Please note that storing space is limited. Iron, vacuum and cleaning supplies are also available if necessary.
transit: We are located across the street from Penn Station, with transportations including trains – Amtrack across East Coast and easy access from Boston to Washington, the LIRR to Long Island, the NJT to New Jersey, and subways (below).  Subway routes include the IRT Broadway – Seventh Avenue Line's 1 and 2 services, the IND Eighth Avenue Line's A, C, and E services, and the IND Sixth Avenue Line's F and M services.  The neighborhood is reachable by the M7, M10, M11, M12, M14, M23 SBS New York City Bus routes.  The 34th Street – Hudson Yards station on the IRT Flushing Line opened in September 2015 with its main entrance in Chelsea. You can walk to Times Square, the Highline or any neighborhood easily.
interaction: We are available to guests for any questions they may have before and during their stay. Unless traveling abroad, we are usually a couple of hours away and can meet guests if necessary.
house_rules: We have lovely neighbors and want to ensure we keep their experience as peaceful as possible. We appreciate that our guests be respectful to all in our building.   Please keep quiet while using the building public areas and noise to a minimum. There are security cameras throughout the buildings and any unusual activities will be reported by our super.
