neighborhood_overview: • Literally in the middle of the West Village / Greenwich Village, nestled on a very quiet tree-lined street yet seconds from all the excitement.  • Very quaint village-style streets, NYC classic restaurants abound, tiny and cozy coffee shops on every corner.  • Minutes away from NYU, Washington Square Park, the Highline, SoHo, West Side Highway, Tribeca, Flatiron Building. •  Seconds from two fully-stocked grocery stores, multiple bakeries, cheese shops, and unique liquor stores. Minutes from multiple gyms (NYSC, Equinox, Soul Cycle). •  A few well known eateries steps away: Murray's Cheese Shop, Bleecker Street Pizza, Magnolia Bakery, Buvette, Babbo, Sushi Nakazawa,  L' Artusi,  Takashi, Faicco's, Tartine, The Little Owl, The Spotted Pig.
notes: • This is a lovely apartment and there is a tenant below and I expect that you will be respectful by keeping the noise to a minimum and following the house rules.  • Please, shoes are to be removed upon entry. • Occasionally (40% chance), mostly Fridays and Saturdays, the hot water will only be lukewarm from 6PM-11:30PM. Mornings are most ideal for very hot water. Please plan accordingly.
transit: • 1 - 2 minutes away from all SUBWAY lines (1, 2, 3, A, C, D, E and F).   • Penn Station, Grand Central Stations a short cab/Uber ride away.   • Paid Parking across the Townhouse.  • CITI Bike station 2 minutes away
interaction: • The front door has a smart lock for easy access. No key is needed.   • No interaction with Host is necessary for check-in.  • Please text (iMessage, (Hidden by Airbnb) ) Alex directly for immediate response.  • Help is always a few minutes away if necessary.
house_rules: • No shoes in the house.   • Quiet hours 9 PM to 9 AM.   • Maximum capacity is 3 people, no more at anytime. No outside guests. • No smoking. • Only use washing/drying machine between 9 AM- 7 PM if possible (medium spin cycles please). • No parties. • Lights and AC off when you leave, please. My neighbor below me is sensitive to noise, it's important to respect that. Thank You.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is called "Sugar Hill". It got its name in the 1920s when the neighborhood became a popular place for wealthy African Americans to live during the Harlem Renaissance. You will find the beautiful mansions where these prominent figures lived. The neighborhood has many trendy restaurants and bars. You will find near you national historic landmarks such as: The Yankee Stadium which is 10 minutes away. The Riverbank State Park where you will find the famous "Red Lighthouse" only 10 minutes away. Also, the "Morris-Jumel Mansion" located on 160 street which is now a museum.
notes: Please remember this is not a hotel. We do not have a 24/7 check in/check out. Please communicate your approximate arrival/departure time so we can plan our day accordingly.  Please clean up after yourself. All common areas will be cleaned once a week. A small basket of toiletries is provided, It includes: shampoo, conditioner, shower gel & toothpaste. If any of us is home the day of your arrival you can check in before 2pm but please ask before you reserve to ensure someone will be home to receive you. The bed can only hold up to 200lbs. If you weight more than this please do not book my place because the bed will brake.
transit: You will have the ABCD trains 2 minutes away and the 1 train 7 minutes away. Also, there are buses right next to the trains. We are 20 minutes away from Time Square on the express train and 15 minutes away from Columbia University on the 1 train.
interaction: We are a respectful, quiet and helpful family of four adults. We will be gone most of the day but once we get home we are available to help you in any way and answer any questions you may have.

From early morning to late-late night, the East Village brims with activity for socialites and scaliwags alike.

neighborhood_overview: Greenwich Village really is a village in the middle of a big city. Characterized by it's historic buildings, artistic vibe, abundant cafes, intimate restaurants and charming small shops. The storied Washington Square Park is just around the corner from our apartment. And it's a quick walk to adjacent neighborhoods like SoHo, the West Village, East Village, the Lower East Side and Chelsea. Nearby subways include the B/D/F/M and the A/C/E.

neighborhood_overview: A vibrant neighborhood bursting with top restaurants, galleries, lively bars, Broadway theaters and chic boutiques, Hell’s Kitchen is the hippest neighborhood in New York City with a rich and cultured history.  With close proxmity to Central Park, Broadway,  Times Square, Restuarant Row, Lincoln Center, Fifth Ave, Rockafeller Center, Chrysler Building, Carnegie Hall, Grand Central Station, Museum of Modern Art (MoMA), Theater District, Radio City Music Hall, Pier 92, Pier 94, Jacob K. Javits Convention Center and many more, Hell's Kitchen embodies all the beauty, mystique and edge of a classic Manhattan haunt, and makes it a neighborhood you’ll want to treasure.
notes: IMPORTANT!! Please read the house manual carefully after booking.  THANK YOU!!
transit: Nearby subway lines include: A, B, C, D, E, F, M, N, Q, R, S, 1, 2, 3 and 7
interaction: I live right upstairs from you, make sure to come and say hi if I am home. :)

neighborhood_overview: Classic Harlem restaurants like Red Rooster, Sylvia’s, Babalucci, etc. Convenient to transportation, including 125th street metronorth train station, subways 4/5/6 and 2/3.
transit: We are in close proximity to public transportation via subway (2/3 or 4/5/6) or bus. There are several nearby bus lines. To the extent that you arrive by car, parking can usually be found on the street and there is a garage a block away on 129th and Lenox
interaction: We are available by text and email and live just upstairs to the extent that you have any questions during your stay
house_rules: Please keep the gates closed at all times. To the extent that you have deliveries or other guests arriving please specify downstairs unit.  The couches downstairs fold flat into beds.  Pull the back of the coach forward and then release it backwards until it is flat.  The linens for these beds are in the brown dresser across the room. Upon checkout: 1) remove the sheets from every bed that was used, put into the washing machine (basement closet), and start the machine 2) place any dirty dishes into the dishwasher and turn the dishwasher on 3) sweep the floor 4) take out the garbage and recycling.  Garbage goes in the black can, cardboard in the blue, and containers in the gray.

neighborhood_overview: This is one of the trendiest neighbourhoods in Up and Coming Harlem. It is very gentrified, safe and a family oriented area. TONS of things to do and some of the most beautiful architecture  in the  whole city. Street Parking usually very easy, but there also is paid private parking available in the neighborhood.
notes: We have a small Yorkie Toy little dog, he is Hypo-allergenic, super friendly and very well house trained. He is very disciplined and will not bother the guests, unless they decide they want to play with him or pat him. He is currently not at the premises..
transit: There are 3 great buses within 20-30 yards from the house. Excellent train that runs the entire length of the city. Very convenient. 18 minute direct train ride to Times Square and very short rides to many of the famous destinations.
interaction: I have been living in NYC for many years now and would be available to offer any help or advice when needed. In case there is  anything I do not know, then I can always ask my  born and raised NYC'er friend who is always happy to help.

PLEASE no dirty laundry and wet      towels on the furniture and on the study desk  in the bedroom. I am expecting my guest to take care of their own garbage in the room. neighborhood_overview: Alphabet City is a great nieghborhood within the heart the East Village in downtown Manhattan.  Walking distance to the Lower East Side, West Village, SoHo, NoHo, Chinatown and Tribeca.  Short commute to Times Square area and Williamsburg Brooklyn.  Too many restaurants, bars, coffee shops, nightclubs, live music and comedy venues, and all other forms of entertainment within steps to list.  One block from Tompkins Square Park and East River Park, and several community gardens and galleries open to the public for you to visit.
transit: Bus stops and CitiBike (public bike share station) within a block.  15 minute walk to multiple subway lines. Or you can always take a bus directly to subway and make a free transfer.
interaction: I've lived in the neighborhood for nearly 12 years, so I'm happy to help with any suggestions, advice or directions.  I live in the room downstairs from you, along with friendly pup Niko.  Niko has never been in your room, and has no access to it. Niko stays  in my bedroom when I'm not home.  I love to meet and interact with guests, but I work a lot and stay very active, so it's very likey we may never even run into each other.
house_rules: No illegal or "pirating" streaming or downloading of any copyrighted materials on the house wifi network.  $200 cleaning fee for smoking in room violation (there is an attached roofdeck to smoke outdoors) $100 lost key fee.  No unregistered Guests.

neighborhood_overview: The house is located in central Harlem, across the street from St. Nicholas Park and a beautiful church, and adjacent to Hamilton Heights.  It is a beautiful, peaceful and quiet neighborhood.  There are many excellent restaurants and bars within walking distance.
transit: The house is just steps away from the 135th Street B and C local train station at St. Nicholas Avenue. Midtown is 15 minutes away.  The express stops at 125th Street and 145th Street (A and D trains) are a five minute walk away.   The 2 and 3 train station on Lenox Avenue and 135th Street is a five minute walk away. There are also buses very close by.The subway (B and C train) local stop is less than a block from the house.  There are also several buses within a block away.
interaction: I live in the townhouse and am also available by phone.
house_rules: Please no oily/greasy frying or other messy cooking.  Please clean up after yourself after using the kitchen.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very safe, due to the 24 hour security service. Its open space, makes it feel like you are in an amusement park. It is airy, fresh, clean, peaceful, and very beautiful. Roosevelt Island is "mini United Nations." The Island boasts of having every nationality, it is a highly inclusive and integrated society, and we all live in peace and harmony with each other.
notes: Going out at night is safe, some public transportations run 24/7, and some run until early hours of the morning. The tramway stops at about 3:30 AM. You can always pick up Uber, or yellow taxis. Never-ever get into an unmarked car.
transit: The "F" Train connects Roosevelt Island with the rest of the city, and to the Air-Train to and from JFK. The Tramway, Q102 Bus, and the Ferry services connect the Island to other boroughs. All transportations are about 10 minutes walk from the apartment. Getting around is quite easy, and a lot of fun. We are in the middle of everything, which makes it great to reach all around New York, in no time.
interaction: I am available to talk, give directions, explain some intricacies of the city, or learn a new recipe.
house_rules: - No extra guest allowed in the room without prior notice, permission or payment of ($50) per extra guest. No exceptions. - All extra guests must be announced ahead of time. - Please, leave your personal stuff, especially toiletries in your room. - Please, kindly keep noise down at all times. Cleaning fee for monthly stay is $100

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the historic Striver's Row neighborhood minutes from St. Nicholas Park, Hamilton Grange (a national historic site), and the City College of New York. The neighborhood boasts great restaurants with lots of local flavor - think Ethiopian, French-Senegalese, British-Jamaican, and Soul Food - all a stone’s throw away.  Our go-to local coffee shop where grad students, local artists and families gather is a few minutes walk from the apartment.  We have a brand new grocery store around the corner. Shopping and entertainment, including the famous Apollo Theater, are minutes away by bus or train or a 20 minute walk if you prefer a leisurely stroll through the neighborhood.
notes: Our family lives in the apartment above the guest space.  Before and after school on weekdays and during the weekends, you will hear footfalls and other noises associated with apartment life in the city. The TV is equipped with livestreaming services like Netflix and Hulu.  You can input your own Amazon Prime account info if you wish.  However, we do not provide cable access or have services that link to local news and sports games.
transit: The apartment is a short 5 minute walk to the B/C train (which goes directly to major stations including 34th Street Penn Station, 42nd Street Times Square, and multiple station stops along Central Park) and 10 minutes to the 2/3 train.  The M10 bus is across the street. Free street parking is usually available on the block or on nearby streets.  Cars do have to be moved a couple times a week to allow for street cleaning.  There are also two commercial garages within a 5 minute walk of the house.
interaction: One of us will be available on your arrival to give you keys and answer any questions.  If you need  anything during your visit, you can reach us anytime via text or by simply ringing the upstairs doorbell.
house_rules: - Remove shoes in the house in order to keep NYC street dust and grime to minimum. -Follow NYC recycling protocols, which involves separating out glass/metals/plastics and paper goods from household trash. Bins are provided for guests use, under the stoop. -On check out: Place household trash and recycling into the appropriate bins. Place dirty dishes in the dishwasher and run. Place used towels and linens by bedroom mirror.

neighborhood_overview: - CVS, Supermarket and Delis in 1 block walking distance on 1st Avenue.  - Dry clean and laundromat options on 82nd Street, or 1st Ave at 84th Street. Both could take drop off and clean at the same day or next day. - Best bar in UES, Penrose is right around the corner on 2nd Avenue. - Renown Luke Lobster is located on 81st Street and 2nd Avenue.  - Lots of new restaurants including Japanes, Thai, Indian, Pizza and Italians are within two clocks radius.
transit: - Q train station is right around the corner of 2nd Avenue and 83rd Street. It takes you directly to midtown, Time Square, Soho and Chinatown. Also Brooklyn Barcelay Center and Coney Island. - Downtown bus station on 2nd Ave at 82nd Street, Uptown bus station on 1st Ave at 82nd Street. - There's a city bike station right on the block. - Uber, Juno, Lyft and Via are great apps to use in the city. * There might be street closure during the school hours during the week when the school has student activities. In case of getting a car or taxi, go to 1st Ave and 82nd Street as the closest pickup point.
interaction: Guest can reach out directly via email, text or phone calls.
house_rules: - No Smoking allowed in the apartment and the building. - No shoes allowed in the apartment, the guests must take off shoes when enter the apartment.  - Please respect the neighbors in the building and no parties allowed in the apartment.  - The guests are fully responsible fot any damages or lost of the property in the apartment. - Check in after 10pm would subject to a late check-in fee of $50 in order to arrange property manager outside regular business hours.

neighborhood_overview: I live in Flatiron, with many restaurants, bars and amazing rooftops.  I can guide you where to go if you want too :)
notes: * If you are getting here early or late, I am happy to accommodate. If you get here early, for example (before the room is ready at 12 pm), you will be able to check in, get the keys, and leave your bags and enjoy the city and the room will be available at the check in time - if the room is ready earlier I will of course inform you. This works for when you are leaving too, for example if you flight takes off late. In this case I am happy to have you leave your bags and take the keys and return simply to pick up the bags to get to the airport or train station etc on time. If you want to store your bags after your check out time there is a $20 fee. * Once you enter the dates and number of guests, AirBnb will give you an accurate price and show all costs including AirBnb fees. If you want to see how the total is calculated, the area on the right of the screen under the pictures shows the total and will detail what the breakdown is - you can get access to this easily via drop-down next to
transit: Subway around the corner, citibike, or simply just walk or taxi service. If you have not used UBER (another taxi / private car service app) and would like to get a free $20 or $25 credit for your trips, use the referral code: "0k03k" for UBER.
interaction: I love meeting people, of course I'll be respectful to your privacy, but don't surprise if I say hi and try to have a cup of tea with you :) This is not a hotel in the end, but my cute home. You can text me or message me anytime if you have any questions, I'll do my best to help.
house_rules: - No parties. - No guests. - No shoes inside. - Checkin between 12-2pm.  - Check out time is 10am. - After checkout, if you'd like to leave your bags and pick them later, the fee is $20.  - If you're checking in after 12am midnight, there is a $20 late check-in fee. - For the lost keys, the fee is $30. - Extra towel fee is $5, sheets $10. - Turn off the AC when you're leaving home. - Most of the time, you'll never see anyone in the apartment, as everyone is enjoying the NYC, but sometimes, everyone will be home at the same time. In these cases, please keep your bathroom time short like 15-20 mins. - If there is anything annoys you, let me know, and see if I can do anything about it before you leave. - I do want you to feel at home, enjoy your trip and your stay at my home :)

neighborhood_overview: You can find a dizzying number of cafes, shops, and wonderful restaurants in the East Village. I am happy to provide recommendations for you, and I will also include a pamphlet on what to do in the neighborhood. You can easily walk to the Lower East Side, Greenwich Village, or Union Square. And you are within just a few minutes of the L train. Most of Manhattan and Brooklyn is just stone's throw away.
notes: If it is a weeknight, I kindly ask that you limit your use of the home theater to before 11pm.
interaction: I work long hours so I won't be around much to disturb you, but I will never be more than a text message away. When I am home, feel free to say hello!
house_rules: Feel free to smoke outside on the patio but please do not smoke indoors.

neighborhood_overview: Let's face it, the price is right for the room and the convenience. And hey, we're pretty cool too if you want to kick it at a local Chinese karaoke bar or eat at an Iron Chef's restaurant. We're at the border of the LES and Chinatown, but anything you need is conveniently located. You can walk the downtown bridges to go sightseeing, there are CitiBike docks all around us, a CitiBank and Chase in walking distance, a Rite Aid that is 24 hours, and Kossar's, Pickle Guys, and Doughtnut Plant all right there. The bars are plentiful, including an open mic stand-up bar two doors down and a craft beer shop downstairs.
notes: 4th floor walk-up. No oven (would only really matter to a visitor who'd wanna throw down against us in the kitchen any how). Open to discussing a bathroom schedule (LOL... but serious). As far as check-in/check-out times go, we're pretty flexible, but for back-to-back reservations, let's agree that check out is 3:00PM latest check-out and 5:00PM earliest check-in, cool?
transit: Where are you trying to go? The closest subway is the B, D, F and M at Delancey and Essex, 2 blocks north of the apartment. The closes bus is the M14A which will take you up Essex and cut west onto 14th Street, passing by Union Square and into the West Village. CitiBikes are everywhere (4 stations within 2 block radius). Download Via or Uber for the convenience.
interaction: We work in the service industry. Just ask for an itinerary/options. We're at your service.
house_rules: $300 for lost keys, because only the building management commissions the main entrance keys. If you lose it, our next guests won't have access to our unit until that is replaced and unfortunately, that is the price of expedited replacement.

neighborhood_overview: Located in upper Manhattan, in the heart of the historic neighborhood Sugar Hill- the birthplace of the Harlem Renaissance and home to many famous musicians, writers and artists, Convent Ave is a gorgeous family-friendly street with beautiful architecture! Walk down the street and check out our historic landmarks- Alexander Hamilton's house, beautiful old churches, City College of New York's beautiful campus with amazing gothic architecture, The Native American Museum and a historic graveyard. There's even a walking tour of the history of the neighborhood! Great coffee shops, bars and restaurants on Amsterdam and Broadway (just one block over).
notes: Please feel free to text/message me if you need anything at all! want some tips on places to go? Good take out spots to order in? Too cold? too hot? Need extra towels, soap/shampoo, coffee pods? Any kitchen/food stuff not provided- we live downstairs and are happy to share anything we have!
transit: The express A and D Trains (literally 2 blocks away) will get you to Times Square in 15-20 minutes and downtown in 20-25 minutes! 145th st & Saint Nicholas ave station provides ABCD trains. 2 avenues away on 145th & Broadway, you can also get the 1 train. Plenty of cabs, Uber's, Lyft's and busses always around the neighborhood.
interaction: We are available if there's anything you should need! We typically greet our guests when they arrive and personally hand off the keys, but If you prefer a more anonymous and private experience that's fine with us too! You have the option to retrieve and drop off keys in a lock box/key keeper if that's what you prefer.
house_rules: - please take shoes off at the door - please be respectful of the neighbors next to and below you

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very diverse with lots of cool people and trendy restaurants/bars! The apartment is across the street from Riverbank Park which has a beautiful jogging trail, swimming pool, gym, ice skating, basketball & tennis courts.

neighborhood_overview: It is a relatively safe neighborhood. We have a park a block away and we have Riverside Park nearby too. We are near the famous Little Red Lighthouse, make sure to check it out!
notes: Welcome to NY the city that never sleeps! Be advised that during the warmer months, you will hear music playing until around midnight. Also, the older generation likes to play dominos outside and it gets pretty lively. Please note, if you plan on using the kitchen, be mindful and purchase your own condiments and spices. Also, please clean after yourself :)

neighborhood_overview: The Upper East Side of Manhattan is the most elegant neighbor, with mostly one family homes. Very limited commercial traffic makes it charming and quite.  Central Park is a short walk away and highly recommended for a walk, a bike ride or a boat ride on the lake. The stretch of Fifth Avenue next door is known as “The Museum Mile” for the so many great museums New York has to offer: The Metropolitan, The Guggenheim, The Frick, the Cooper Hewitt and many more.

neighborhood_overview: Before the Park Avenue Tunnel was covered (finished in 1910), fashionable New Yorkers shunned the smoky railroad trench up Fourth Avenue (now Park Avenue), to build stylish mansions and townhouses on the large lots along Fifth Avenue, facing Central Park, and on the adjacent side streets. The latest arrivals were the rich Pittsburghers Andrew Carnegie and Henry Clay Frick. The classic phase of Gilded Age Fifth Avenue as a stretch of private mansions was not long-lasting: the first apartment house to replace a private mansion on upper Fifth Avenue was 907 Fifth Avenue (1916), at 72nd Street, the neighborhood's grand carriage entrance to Central Park.[18] Most members of New York's upper class families have made residences on the Upper East Side, including the oil-rich Rockefellers,[19] political Roosevelts,[20] political dynastic Kennedys,[21] thoroughbred racing moneyed Whitneys,[22][23] and tobacco and electric power fortuned Dukes.[24]

neighborhood_overview: This apartment is in the hotbed known as South Harlem, right above Central Park North. It's 1 block from the sprawling Morningside Park, dense with great lawns, ponds, waterfalls, turtles, geese, baseball fields, basketball courts and picturesque stairs that take you to Columbia University. Steps away from Best Market, Vineteria, Starbucks, boutique coffee shops, beer gardens, Harlem Food Bar, Melba's soul food, Amy Ruth's and so much more. Walk a few blocks uptown to the famous Apollo Theatre, Marcus Samuelson's Red Rooster/Ginny's Supper Club, Sylvia's and all the treasures 125th has to offer. Walk east a few blocks to experience African restaurants and clothing markets full of traditional fabrics, jewellery and clothes, with tailors ready to make you something on the spot. Under a 10 minute walk to St. John the Divine & the 1/2/3 subway line.

The architecture, people watching, shopping, and restaurants need no introduction. notes: Since this is a townhouse and not a skyscraper, you can hear the noises of New York City. I'm a light sleeper and have no problem sleeping in the apartment, but I am from the city and am accustomed to city noises. If you are concerned about noise, I provide a noise machine with both white noise options and other calming sound options (ocean, campfire, etc.). However, before booking this apartment, please make sure you feel comfortable with sleeping in an apartment that is right above a city street. I like my guests to be happy, so if noise is a concern for you, please find another option that is better suited for your needs. If you are not concerned about this, I am confident that you will have a wonderful time! I do accept same day reservations from  guests! But if you are making a same day reservation - please confirm with me the check in time as I can’t always guarantee the listed 3pm check in time, depending on when you’ve made the reservation. neighborhood_overview: Strivers' Row is a tree-lined, family street of brownstones in the heart of Harlem. Unlike the rest of Manhattan, our street has private alleys behind the buildings, which keeps trash collection off the street; if you've ever spent time in New York City, you'll understand why this is a big deal! Harlem has a rich history, and you'll often see tour groups walking Strivers' Row as they learn about this northern Manhattan community. Within steps of the apartment you'll find upscale neighborhood restaurants like Ponty Bistro, The Edge, The Grange, Maison Harlem, and Yatenga. And of course you won't be far from tourist favorites like Harlem's Red Rooster, Chez Lucienne, Ginny's Supper Club, Minton's, The Cecil, and Harlem Tavern. Harlem is New York City's home for soul food, so there's no shortage of good cookin'. There's also great nightlife - with bars, cafes, happy hours, and plenty of live music across Harlem. And since you're right in Manhattan, there's probably more nightlife on the i
notes: A private parking space with direct apartment access is often available for a small additional charge of $25/night (through Airbnb). Please ask if you’d like to reserve this, as its availability is not guaranteed. The TV has an Apple TV for you to log into, or HDMI inputs for your own devices. Note that you will not have access to a kitchen — just the essential appliances listed. But there are plenty of great places to eat or order delivery! Please note that this apartment uses a hot water tank, so after taking 2 long showers you may need to wait for the tank to reheat.
transit: Our building is right between two major train lines with stations on 135th street: the B/C (orange & blue) trains to the west, and the 2/3 (red) trains to the east. And there's a bus stop right on our corner served by the M2 line. There are also plenty of cabs on Adam Clayton and Fredrick Douglas Blvds, plus of course you can use Uber and Lyft.
interaction: Usually I will be in the apartment upstairs during your stay, but even when I'm not around you'll have my mobile number to get in touch anytime. Having guests on the basement level helps me pay my rent, but I also love meeting new people - so I'm always happy to help with recommendations and ideas if you have questions! neighborhood_overview: The upper east side is the residential area. It's a pretty neighborhood, with a mix of classic brownstones and upscale high-rises. Museum Mile, a stretch of 5th Avenue next to Central Park, draws crowds to cultural institutions that include the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum and El Museo del Barrio.
notes: If you are booking trough airbnb first time keep in mind that this is not a hotel, it is a residential apartment.  This apt will only be rented to responsible individuals or couples. This is a multi-unit building, therefore common courtesies to the other residents must be respected. Airbnb situations are "tolerated" in New York City only when the other tenants don't feel like their lifestyle is being compromised. Nobody wants to feel like their home has been turned into a hotel against their will. So I ask that you maintain a level of respect and courteousness when on premises. Especially when you are entering and exiting the apartment and are on common resident zones. Think of it like your home. Just as I'm sure none of us would want to be woken up in our own homes by loud music from next-door, the same goes for your neighbors. Other than that, it's your home. I just ask that you don't create damage to your home or be a nuisance to your neighbors.  ***PLEASE DO NOT MENTION AIRBNB NAME
transit: Famous museums, Central Park
interaction: I will available for my guests all the time

Steps away from the best shopping, restaurants, bars, and nightlife in lower Manhattan, and just 3blks from iconic Washington Square Park. 24-hr CVS pharmacy 1blk away, 24-hr bodega 2blks away. Washington Sq park area and soho ..Location:   This location is one of the most sought out areas in NYC. You are on Houston street which is the dividing line between the the West Village and SoHo. SoHo is one of the biggest fashion capitals of the world. You can find every high end store and boutique here all nestled together. Among these stores you will find very unique restaurants and cafes.  Right above you you’ll find the west village which is a very historical district for artists of all generations. Jimi Hendrix and Bob Dylan just a few of the musicians that played intimate sets throughout this area when they were just starting out. This is also where NYU has its main campus surrounding the Washington Sq

neighborhood_overview: Greenwich Village, often referred to by locals as simply "the Village", is a neighborhood on the west side of Lower Manhattan, New York City. In the 20th century, Greenwich Village was known as an artists' haven, the Bohemian capital, the cradle of the modern LGBT movement, and the East Coast birthplace of both the Beat and '60s counterculture movements. Groenwijck, one of the Dutch names for the village (meaning "Green District"), was Anglicized to Greenwich. Two of New York's private colleges, New York University (NYU) and the New School, are located in Greenwich Village.
notes: Other things to note The apartment is on the fourth floor, no elevator, 3 flights of stairs from the lobby. Access to a private garage for 35.- a day, 10 minutes walk from the apartment. No parties, no shoes in the apartment.

neighborhood_overview: I've lived in Harlem for over 5 years now and it has been nothing short of amazing. The vibrant culture, friendly neighbors, and historical landmarks in the neighborhood is a crucial part of New York City's multicultural fabric that makes the city great. If you're familiar with the Harlem Renaissance in the 1920s, you'll enjoy the fact that you'll be in walking distance to the famous Apollo Theatre and Savoy Ballroom.  We are also located next to Columbia University, one of the most prestigious universities in the country. There is a bus that brings you to the steps of Morningside Park which is the park that separates the school from the rest of the city. Obviously, safety is one of the main concerns for newcomers to New York. To those that come from suburbia, it is common for there to be many loiterers, especially during the summer months. Being part of the community this long, I can attest that it is as safe as the rest of Manhattan. It is important to remember that no matter where y
notes: Please do not lose the key cards to the building. Replacing it is expensive! I'll have to charge $50 for each missing key card. On days when there will be a guest checking in after you, I ask the guest that is leaving to do check out by 10 am so the house cleaner has adequate time to thoroughly clean for the next guest. I also ask the next guest to check in no earlier than 2 pm. On days when there is no overlap of guests, we are completely flexible about check-in or check-out times.
transit: Most transportation methods get you to the apartment easily. We're conveniently located a few blocks from the 4/5/6 line, 2/3 line, and Metro North. There is also an express bus to and from La Guardia Airport. A few minutes from our doorstep are some of Harlem's favorite eateries: Red Rooster, Chez Lucienne, Barawine, and 125th St shopping (Marshall's, Old Navy, and a plethora of others). There's a gym located two blocks away and they have day passes if you're looking to work out during your stay. Otherwise, you can run along the East River along the esplanade which is a few blocks east of the building. The best form of travel around here is your feet! You are probably in some of the world's most walkable cities (unless bad weather). Many enthusiasts walk down to Central Park and spend the day biking around the most famous park in our city. Citi Bikes can be a fun way to explore the city as well, again if the weather is okay. It is easy to set up and I can help you with that. Airports-
interaction: I work nearby so I can always come by if there are any problems and I am available via text 24/7. I also work in my room that's across from the Loft bedroom, sometimes during the daytime on weekdays. I love meeting new people, sharing experiences, as well as showing off some of Harlem's best restaurants. Harlem gets a bad reputation, but it has so much to offer. Sometimes I'll be too busy with work, but I will do my best to find time to hang out with you in the area for a drink if you stay more than a night or two.
house_rules: Please respect the furniture and building. Quiet time after 12AM. To ensure quick and easy booking, please make sure your Airbnb profile is complete with description and picture on which the booking guest is clearly identifiable, especially if this is your first reservation on Airbnb. According to Airbnb policy, I may have to decline your request if the information requested is not provided. Lost key cards are expensive, they will cost $50 each to be replaced.

neighborhood_overview: The Upper West Side is a wonderful place to both escape the city and get embedded in the pulse of New York. You'll be minutes away from all the attractions Manhattan has to offer. Plus it's a thriving academic area thanks to Columbia University, so don't be surprised if you happen to have a great conversation about Egyptian Poetry or Interstellar Wormholes over a cup of coffee with a new professor friend. You're close to bars, restaurants, and theaters and so much more. But it's also a wonderful place to relax and de-stress after a day exploring the city. Stroll through Central Park, Morningside Park, or the gardens of St. John the Divind Cathedral. The Upper West Side is known to be one of the safest areas in New York and is home to families and charming communities.
transit: There's usually street parking in front of the building if you happen to rent a car, and the 1 train is only a block away. If you're flying through LaGuardia you'll be very close to the 125th street bus that goes directly (and cheaply) to LaGuardia Airport.

neighborhood_overview: You'll fall in love with this charming, tree-lined neighborhood that strikes the perfect balance between cleanliness, architectural beauty, breathing space and culture. Located minutes away from the Q and 4/5/6 trains, gourmet grocery stores on the block, and a plethora of eating and drinking options (including the Michelin starred Cafe Boulud a short walk away), the city really is your playground. You'll also be walkable from Carl Schurz Park overlooking the river in one direction, and all the urbane organic beauty that Central Park has to offer in the other, so you truly can disappear into your own natural haven when its time for a break from Manhattan's unique cityscape.

neighborhood_overview: Manhattan's Lower East Side is known for its music scene, cutting edge bars and restaurants and progressive art and fashion culture. Neighbored by the East Village one way and Chinatown the other you won't be short of cultural diversity and a host of amazing food, drink and nightlife destinations. Go to a burlesque or comedy show at the Slipper Room, grab a comically large pastrami on rye from Katz's Deli or whisper one last cocktail order to the bartender at local speakeasy Nitecap. Or just take a wander and you'll doubtless stumble across one of the areas many contemporary art gallery spaces and dozens of coffee shops to sit and digest. The area really does everything you'll need to get the full New York experience!
notes: You will notice much of this neighborhood is a reflection of the lower east side of the past. People tend to love to spend time hanging with friends outdoors. This will seem odd at first, but if you get to know the neighbors you'll find they have the most interesting stories to tell and are probably some of the happiest, most loving neighbors you could find in all of NYC. Please note that a starter pack of toiletries and paper goods is included, but may not be enough for the duration of your stay. If needed, additional items can be purchased at the nearby store. Last, for 21+ night stays, a bi-weekly clean will be added to your stay. This is an additional $290 every 2 weeks and includes a full cleaning and a fresh change of linens.
transit: The Delancey/Essex St F/J/M/Z trains are a few blocks away and will take you wherever you want to go in Manhattan, or straight over the Williamsburg bridge into Brooklyn. The nearest Citibike location is one block away if you prefer to cycle (the ride over the Williamsburg bridge is beautiful!). Notable Destinations:  - Chinatown: 10 minutes by car, 15 minutes by train, 21 minutes walking - Little Italy: 12 minutes by car, 15 minutes by train, 19 minutes walking - Soho: 15 minutes by car, 19 minutes by train - Williamsburg: 13 minutes by car, 15 minutes by train

neighborhood_overview: On the border of Harlem’s Sugar Hill and Washington Heights, the neighborhood is landmarked and full of history. The surrounding blocks were home to Paul Robeson, Duke Ellington, Count Basie, Thurgood Marshall, Joe Louis and other notable Black Americans. The Jumel Mansion served as George Washington’s headquarters during the Battle of Harlem Heights in 1776. More recently, it is the place where Lin Manuel Miranda wrote several songs for the Broadway hit Hamilton. There’s plenty to do in the neighborhood—including a lot of good restaurants— but it’s also a great base to explore the city. With the subway right on our corner, you can get virtually anywhere in Manhattan in 30 minutes or less.
transit: C local train at 163rd is one block away. Station is newly remodeled with beautiful mosaics by Dominican-born NYC-based artist Firelei Baez. A express train is at 168th. 1 train at 157th. Tons of bus options. Close to major highways. No parking at house, but free, on-street parking is available in the neighborhood. There are also plenty of paid garages within a few blocks.

neighborhood_overview: The Upper East Side is iconic for its landmarks, museums, and history. Known as one of the most affluent neighborhoods in NYC, the historic mansions and brownstones that made this area famous were once home to the country’s wealthiest, such as the Rockefellers, Vanderbilts, and Carnegies. The neighborhood is stacked with landmarks: Central Park borders the Upper East Side to the east, along with a handful of New York City’s best museums, including the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The neighborhood’s leafy avenues house elite schools and world-class retailers and restaurants. Along Fifth Avenue, the construction of ultra-luxury skyscrapers has led to the creation of the exclusive Billionaire’s Row, where some of NYC's most elite residents hang their hats. There are also several consulates located in the area, making the Upper East Side a prestigious neighborhood for those hoping to contribute to its great history.
notes: Like many New York apartment buildings, housing sharing like Airbnb is not permitted in certain buildings so if you're looking to book my apartment-- please note that in the very rare case that someone in the building asks you about your stay/your suitcases, please indicate that you're a friend who's staying with me. If this is something that you're not comfortable with-- this probably won't be the best fit for you. this apartment is HIGH END so I expect high end renters. **The apartment is on the SECOND FLOOR w/ NO elevator it’s 1 flight of stairs to walk up

neighborhood_overview: Harlem is a large neighborhood in the northern section of New York City’s borough of Manhattan. Since the 1920s, Harlem has been known as a major African American residential, cultural and business center. Originally a Dutch village, formally organized in 1658, it is named after the city of Haarlem in the Netherlands.  The famous Apollo Theater opened on 125th Street on January 26, 1934, in a former burlesque house. The Savoy Ballroom, on Lenox Avenue, was a renowned venue for swing dancing, and was immortalized in a popular song of the era, "Stompin' At The Savoy". In the 1920s and 1930s, between Lenox and Seventh Avenues in central Harlem, over 125 entertainment venues were in operation, including speakeasies, cellars, lounges, cafes, taverns, supper clubs, rib joints, theaters, dance halls, and bars and grills. 133rd Street, known as "Swing Street,” became known for its cabarets, speakeasies and jazz scene during the Prohibition era.  Harlem is now undergoing a renaissance with many
notes: New York is an exciting, high-energy city. With that comes the usual level of urban sounds.  Firetrucks, ambulances, car traffic, and loud conversations on the sidewalk can all penetrate the walls of any city home and ours is no exception. We recommend using the supplied sound machines for sleeping or any sound–reducing steps you usually take. This is also a multi-family residential building with another home occupying the floors above you.  As such you may hear footsteps, children and other human sounds.  We feel this makes your stay feel more like a home, rather than a hotel. Early check-in, Late check-out: While we strive to accommodate your travel plans the best we can, in most cases we must adhere to our posted arrival and departure times for Townhouse 109. That said in some cases depending on our booking schedule we can grant an early check-in and/or a late check-out.  Each occurrence comes with a $49 additional fee due before final check-out.  Please let us know at least 72 hour
transit: Just steps to the M7 and M102 bus lines and only a few blocks to the express 2 and 3 subway lines means all of New York is just moments away.

notes: The mezzanine is 10  feet in length 8 feet wide and about five feet in height.  It has a very comfortable single bed, a night stand near the bed , air conditioner, espresso maker, iron, fresh towels, fresh sheets, and a sliding door which provides full privacy and enhanced noise reduction (this doesn’t imply that it is a noisy apartment) and very clean.  It is ideal for the traveler who wants clean and comfortable place but whose focus is to enjoy the city as opposed to being in the house all day, which you of course would be welcome to do. neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a historic brownstone located on Lenox Avenue in the Mount Morris Park historic district.    You will be 2-4 minutes walk to Whole Foods, Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts, Staples, Marshalls, Olive Garden, Burlington, CVS, Mcdonalds, Burger King, Golden Crust, Chipotle.   There are three gyms nearby– Blink, Planet Fitness and NYSC.  You are also easy walking diistance to countless other shops, including H&M, TJMaxx, Victoria secret, Bed Bath & Beyond all the banks. There is also a burgeoning restaurant and cafe scene in the area with places such as Red Rooster by celebrity Chef Marcus Samuelsson only two blocks away.   The casual-chic soul food restaurant BLVD Bistro is only steps away from the apartment. Other restaurants that are very close by include Harlem Shake, Sottocase Pizzeria, Barawine, Settepani, Il cafe Latte,  Sushi Inoue,  Corner Social and the famous soul food classic Sylvia's. There are two parks nearby, Marcus Garvey park is steps aways and it is only a 12
notes: Guests are usually welcome to come early to drop off their bags at the apartment if they arrive in New York earlier than check-in time.  They are also welcome to leave their bags in the apartment (outside of the room) after checkout on their last day.
transit: Access to the rest of the city and beyond is very easy The 2,3 subway is only two minutes’ walk away and will get you to Times Square  in 15 minutes.  The subway will take you north to the top of Manhattan and into the Bronx or it will take south all the way to the Wall Street area and into Brooklyn. There are a number of buses within one or two blocks that will take you all over. The M60 bus will take you to Queens and LaGuardia Airport, saving you the cost of a taxi/Uber. The Metro North train station is a 10 minute walk and will take you to Grand Central Station or all the way to Westchester and Connecticut.

The subway is just a few blocks away giving you access to everything in the city. Midtown is a 20-minute ride away! Here is a sampling of the restaurants within walking distance: Anchor Wine Bar The Draft House Hogshead Tavern The Grange Bar & Eatery OSO Mexican Restaurant Harlem Public Trufa Fumo - and many others. We have menus for information or delivery.
notes: Pack'n' play also available upon request

neighborhood_overview: Wall St., 9/11 Memorial, Woolworth building, Century 21, Statue of Liberty, South Street Seaport, Brooklyn Bridge, and Tribeca are all 5 minute walks (or less).
notes: Only a few minutes away from South Street Seaport, where pop-up shops and awesome food vendors have brought renewed life and energy into the neighborhood. There is a "TKTS" booth only a few blocks away at the South Seaport where you can get up to 75% off Broadway tickets. (this booth opens an hour earlier than the one in Times Square. There is also a MUCH shorter line.) 3 min walk to the new Freedom Tower and the 9/11 Memorial Museum. 3 min walk to Wall Street and the NY Stock Exchange. 10 min walk to Ellis Island/Statue of Liberty Ferry. 1 min walk to Century 21 Dept store. This is truly an awesome location!
transit: Subway entrance to eight different lines (2, 3, 4, 5, A, C, J, Z) is 15 seconds/30 meter/90 feet away (right on the nearest corner, Broadway). You will be minutes (a few train stops) from everything NYC has to offer.

neighborhood_overview: Convenient location · affordable · center of NYC · great takeout · great food Hell's Kitchen has nearly all that one could want in a neighborhood.  Good restaurants, fun bars and most importantly, it is perfectly located for visiting the rest of the city and region. Finer print about HK: Few places in the world can rival Hell's Kitchen for its concentration of iconic landmarks. The Empire State Building towers over 34th Street at Fifth Avenue. From there, you can walk one block west to Macy's flagship, or a few blocks north to see Patience and Fortitude, the photogenic marble lion statues standing guard outside the New York Public Library. You can pass through Times Square en route to Rockefeller Center and the Museum of Modern Art. The area is also home to legendary performance halls, including dozens of Broadway theaters, Radio City Music Hall, Madison Square Garden and Carnegie Hall, as well as newer concert venues like Terminal 5. neighborhood_overview: You'll feel part of the Murray Hill vibe!  There is a coffee shop in the ground floor with communal tables and lots of friendly regulars!  Murray Hill Is A Very Safe Part Of NYC And Central To Everything.   Very Close To The United Nations Head Quarters Means That Murray Hill Is Full Of Embassy Buildings And Consular Offices.  Some Of These Are Super Modern And Stunning, Some Are Very Traditional And Beautiful.  There Are Lots Of Public Parks, I Am Happy To Share With You My Favorite Public Spaces That May Not Be Known By Someone Who Does Not Live Here.  Murray Hill Is A Short Walk to Times Square, Broadway, Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Grand Central, New York City Library, Bryant Park, Gramercy Park, Madison Square Park, Flatiron Building.
notes: This Apartment Is In The Part Of Manhattan Called Murray Hill.  It Is A Safe And Clean Neighbourhood Where You Will Feel Welcome! 3rd Ave bars are open and serving from the sidewalk! It’s a bit of a New Orleans feel, come enjoy! Great pizza slices not to far, McDonalds very close, all the delis sell rolling papers and accessories.
transit: NYC has a ride share service called Via.  Download the Via: Low-Cost-Ride-Sharing app onto your phone and use code a4w5 for a free $20 ride credit you can use right away! You'll Love Walking Up Park Avenue and 5th Ave To See All The Shopping.  Continue North To Central Park Or South To Gramercy, Tompkin Square Park Or Union Square.  West To Bryant Park Where Fashion Week Occurs in February And September.  You'll Get Swept Into The Crowd Of Grand Central Only A Few Steps Away Where All Major Subway Trains Are.   If you're here for a conference at Javitz Center, the 7 train from Grand Central (a 5 minute walk away) will take you right to Hudson Yards in 3 stops.   If you wanted to take the train to Times Square, either the S (1 stop) or the 7 (2 stops) will take you there in minutes.   You Need To See NYC By Water!  Get Wind Blown Hair From Seeing NYC By Ferry at the Ferry Terminal Only Steps Away, Which Will Take You To Queens, Brooklyn, Bronx, Staten Island, NJ.   Be A Real Baller And
interaction: I remember my first time in The City, I'm excited for your visit!  I live very close by, and am very responsive.  I want you to have the best NYC experience and am happy to help you.  I know The City well and have lots of recommendations on what to see, where to go, what to do and kid friendly options.   If you need anything let me know.

neighborhood_overview: The Upper East Side is a great choice for travelers interested in museums, culture, the outdoors, and food. Located in New York City, the apartment is near Museum Mile where you can visit the famed Metropolitan Museum of Art and Guggenheim Museum among many others.  Less than a mile from Central Park and a 5 minute walk to Carl Schurz Park along the East River which features a children's playground, lovely gardens, and a dog park. The neighborhood has a homey feel and lively atmosphere with tons of restaurants,  bars, cafes and shopping.
transit: Great location with easy access to the rest of the city via subway, bus, bicycle and ferry! FERRY: Ferry is an 7-10 minute walk (0.3 mile) and takes you to 34th Street and Wall Street with spectacular city views along the way. TRAINS:  Q train is an 7 minute walk (0.3 mile) and the 4/5/6 trains are less than a 15 minute walk (0.6 mile). BUS:  Cross town bus is 4 minutes away and the downtown/uptown bus is a 4-7 minute walk depending on which direction you are going. BICYCLE:  Citibike stand is located at the end of the street. PARKING:  There is a pay parking structure next door but you can often find free street parking within a few blocks.
interaction: Feel free to call/text/email me if you have any questions.
house_rules: - I kindly ask that you leave the apartment as you found it.  - Please be respectful of neighbors. Parties and gatherings are not permitted. - Host is not responsible for the loss of / damage to guests' valuables / personal property.   - Television is smart TV only and is not connected to cable or satellite TV. You will need to log into your account on Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, etc. to view TV or movies. - Please close windows and turn off AC when you leave the apartment. - Recreational use of the fire escape is not permitted. - You must climb 4 flights of stairs to access the apartment.

neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is located on a charming tree-lined block. It is significantly quieter and cozier than other parts of the neighborhood, given its residential nature. It's the ideal urban oasis! The neighborhood is very safe overall. Although our apartment is on a tranquil block, all of the hustle and bustle of 125th St and Lenox Ave are a short walk away, featuring many restaurants, bars, lounges, shopping, culture and events. There are tons of phenomenal restaurants and bars within a short walk.  Also, getting to major NYC destinations like Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Central Park is possible in about 20 mins via subway.
notes: We can only accommodate 2 adults maximum. We cannot accommodate anyone under the age of 18.
transit: Major subways lines serving Manhattan from 125th St are within walking distance from the apartment: - 2/3 (red line) express trains are a 5 min walk away - 4/5/6 (green line) trains are a 9 min walk away - Metro North is an 8 min walk away - Many bus lines are available at 125th St, Fifth Ave and Lenox Ave

neighborhood_overview: Only couple of minutes away from South Street Seaport, where pop-up shops and awesome food vendors have brought renewed life and energy into the neighborhood. There is a "TKTS" booth only 2 blocks away at the South Seaport where you can get up to 75% off Broadway tickets. (this booth sells tickets for the same night shows AND for next day matinee unlike the one in Times Square. There is also a MUCH shorter line, if any.) 4-5 min walk to the new Freedom Tower and the 9/11 Memorial Museum. 5 min. walk to Brooklyn Bridge (over which you can take a 15 min. leisure and scenic walk to the Brooklyn's new waterside park). 4 min walk to Wall Street and the NY Stock Exchange. 12 min walk to Ellis Island/Statue of Liberty Ferry. 3 min walk to "Century 21" Department store. This is truly an awesome location!
transit: Subway entrance to eight different lines (2, 3, 4, 5, A, C, J, Z) is 2-3 minutes away (right on the corner of Broadway, 3 blocks). You will be minutes (a few train stops) from everything NYC has to offer. Tired of waiting for the cab and explaining to your driver over and over where to take you? We can arrange pick-up and drop-off from/to the airport in luxury Chevy Suburban (see the pictures). Our driver will be outside waiting a soon as you get your luggage. There is free Wi-Fi available in the SUV so you can check your emails as soon as you get in. There is a seating for 8 (driver + 7 passengers + the space for the luggage). If there is more than 3 of you, your ride, beside that you will feel way more comfortable than in a yellow cab, will also be less expensive (you won't have to get two cabs). Please contact us for the special (discounted) rate (it's less than what UBER charges).
interaction: Guests will have access to entire apartment. Ill be available for questions 24/7 (almost).
house_rules: ***The check out is by 11.00am strictly. You will need to vacate the apartment by 11.00am with all of your belongings. Our cleaning team will enter the apartment at 11.00am to prepare the place for the afternoon guest. We are absolutely and positively not flexible about this rule.  If you are not absolutely sure that you can leave the apartment by 11.00am on the last day please understand that our place will not be the best choice for you. Obviously you can always book an additional day if is available. ***We don't live in Manhattan anymore but about 1.5 hour away (3 hours round trip by train) in Queens. For that reason we would need to know at what time of day approximately you will be arriving so we can come to city to meet you with the keys (also, show you around and answer any questions you might  have about the place,  the building and the neighborhood).  ***Maximum 5 guests throughout your stay (no daytime or nighttime visitors). neighborhood_overview: TheMidtown’s one-of-a-kind sites make braving its crammed streets and dodging its honking taxis worth it. Home to the island’s central business district, Midtown boasts the majority of Manhattan’s skyscrapers, including the Empire State building and the Chrysler Building. This on-the-go neighborhood is renowned for more than its famous architecture—it’s also home to an abundance of hotspots and niche destinations like Koreatown.

house_rules: Hello and thank you for the interest in my place. Before you decide to book with me please be aware of the following guidelines: (1)check-in time and check-out time are firm. (4)On days that I can’t check you in, my husband will be available to do so. (5)Please only use the Airbnb messages to contact me to avoid any confusion or if you have any questions.  (6) No parties, no excessive noise, no smoking, no loitering in the building hallways/stairs, no uninvited guest.  (7) Please do not ship packages to the apartment. You will not be provided a mailbox key. And I am not responsible for lost or missing packages. Any package will be returned to sender. Thank you.

neighborhood_overview: Suppose we told you about a neighborhood with some of the city’s best nightlife, along with outstanding restaurants and shops. It’s conveniently located in Lower Manhattan. It’s vital and energetic, gentrifying but reasonably diverse. Yes, the Lower East Side has some prominent warts: Its housing stock is fairly run-down. It’s noisy. And not everyone wants to live where they go out. But few other neighborhoods offer such a complete New York City experience at this price point.
notes: Do note that the place is a NYC apartment in the middle of Lower East Side. The neighborhood is busy. Therefore you will ear a bit of NYC in the apartment but don't worry nothing crazy at all. Another point is that the bathtub has marks, it's not dirty, just old.
transit: The 2nd Av station off of the F Train is right below the apartment and offers two entrances/exits on the East and West side of the apartment. The F train is perfectly located to go midtown to Time Square or Madison Square Garden, to explore Queens or Brooklyn. One change will make you go anywhere else.
interaction: Don't hesitate to send me a text message if you need any help, have an inquiry or recommendation.

neighborhood_overview: Located Right next to the seaport district. a lot of coffee shop, fine dining and bars withing blocks. Two blocks away from the water (east River) with access to ferries that connect to Brooklyn. Short walk to wall street and lots of shops.
transit: 2,3,J,Z,N,Q,R,4,5,A,C,E Ferries At pier 11 and Staten island ferry
interaction: I will always be available for anything that will make your stay easier
house_rules: After midnight you have to put headphones for music or your show. In addition please try to have your phone calls before that time keep in mind that this is a shared apartment!  Other guest of yours that are not listed or hasn’t been disclosed in advance on Airbnb are not allowed in our apartment or in any of the building facilities.  For any questions ask us or talk to us do not engage with the employee of the building or ask the doorman even to keep your bag talk to us.  NO SHIPPING.  for security reason we do not want any package to be delivered to this address!   Don’t leave open food in the kitchen. We cannot keep your bags after checkout or before check in! Neither does the doorman .. we just don’t allow it  contact us in advance so we can figure out other options.  However there should be rentable locker throughout the city that will be able to keep your bag for a few hours if we accommodate you.

neighborhood_overview: We are conveniently located right at Astor Place, in NYC. We sit at the midpoint between East and West Village, Soho and Union Square. We are at the heart of downtown life in a busy and lively area, but our townhouse offers complete peace and quiet to come home to after a day out in the city.
notes: A "Resort Fee"of 5.875% is added to each listing for the New York City Hotel Occupancy Tax required by law.  We ask all guests to kindly remove their shoes before entering the loft spaces.  Please do wear shoes if using your private patio.  No Photo Shoots, Events or Parties. We rent our main loft spaces for private events or photo shoots and can arrange this for you if desired. Private events and shoots are subject to approval. Pricing is based on time, date and # of guests. Please submit a special request through Airbnb if you would like to use the house for this purpose.  All of the original art hanging in the loft is by local Catskill Mountain’s New York artist Eugene Gregan (born 1937 in New Haven, Connecticut). All works are one of a kind and for sale. Please inquire with Alex should you be interested in purchasing one of the works displayed or if you would like a tour of the entire collection. Eugene Gregan is an American Master artist specializing in Oil Painting, Water Colors,
transit: Getting around our neighborhood is easy by foot, train, bike or car- but parking can be difficult.  Closest Subway: Astor Place - 6 train Broadway & 8th St. - NQR train Union Square  Citi Bike Stations: Astor Place Cooper Square 8th St. & 2nd Ave Taxi, and Car Services are easy to access.
interaction: Alex is available and in the house during your stay to help with any of your needs, but your accommodations are private.
